module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ClusterIamRole

-- | An Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that can be used by the
--   associated Amazon Redshift cluster to access other Amazon Web Services
--   services.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newClusterIamRole</a> smart constructor.
data ClusterIamRole
ClusterIamRole' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ClusterIamRole

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role, for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/RedshiftCopyUnload</tt>.
[$sel:iamRoleArn:ClusterIamRole'] :: ClusterIamRole -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that describes the status of the IAM role's association with
--   an Amazon Redshift cluster.
--   
--   The following are possible statuses and descriptions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>in-sync</tt>: The role is available for use by the
--   cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>adding</tt>: The role is in the process of being associated
--   with the cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>removing</tt>: The role is in the process of being
--   disassociated with the cluster.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:applyStatus:ClusterIamRole'] :: ClusterIamRole -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ClusterIamRole</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>clusterIamRole_iamRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the IAM role, for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/RedshiftCopyUnload</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applyStatus:ClusterIamRole'</a>,
--   <a>clusterIamRole_applyStatus</a> - A value that describes the status
--   of the IAM role's association with an Amazon Redshift cluster.
--   
--   The following are possible statuses and descriptions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>in-sync</tt>: The role is available for use by the
--   cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>adding</tt>: The role is in the process of being associated
--   with the cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>removing</tt>: The role is in the process of being
--   disassociated with the cluster.</li>
--   </ul>

module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ClusterNode

-- | The identifier of a node in a cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newClusterNode</a> smart constructor.
data ClusterNode

-- | Whether the node is a leader node or a compute node.

-- | The public IP address of a node within a cluster.

-- | The private IP address of a node within a cluster.

--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   Whether the node is a leader node or a compute node.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicIPAddress:ClusterNode'</a>,
--   <a>clusterNode_publicIPAddress</a> - The public IP address of a node
--   within a cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:privateIPAddress:ClusterNode'</a>,
--   <a>clusterNode_privateIPAddress</a> - The private IP address of a node
--   within a cluster.

-- | Whether the node is a leader node or a compute node.
clusterNode_nodeRole :: Lens' ClusterNode (Maybe Text)

-- | The public IP address of a node within a cluster.
clusterNode_publicIPAddress :: Lens' ClusterNode (Maybe Text)

-- | The private IP address of a node within a cluster.
clusterNode_privateIPAddress :: Lens' ClusterNode (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ClusterNode.ClusterNode
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ClusterNode.ClusterNode
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ClusterNode.ClusterNode
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ClusterNode.ClusterNode
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ClusterNode.ClusterNode
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ClusterNode.ClusterNode
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ClusterNode.ClusterNode

module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ClusterParameterStatus

-- | Describes the status of a parameter group.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newClusterParameterStatus</a> smart constructor.
data ClusterParameterStatus
ClusterParameterStatus' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ClusterParameterStatus

-- | The status of the parameter that indicates whether the parameter is in
--   sync with the database, waiting for a cluster reboot, or encountered
--   an error when being applied.
--   
--   The following are possible statuses and descriptions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>in-sync</tt>: The parameter value is in sync with the
--   database.</li>
--   <li><tt>pending-reboot</tt>: The parameter value will be applied after
--   the cluster reboots.</li>
--   <li><tt>applying</tt>: The parameter value is being applied to the
--   database.</li>
--   <li><tt>invalid-parameter</tt>: Cannot apply the parameter value
--   because it has an invalid value or syntax.</li>
--   <li><tt>apply-deferred</tt>: The parameter contains static property
--   changes. The changes are deferred until the cluster reboots.</li>
--   <li><tt>apply-error</tt>: Cannot connect to the cluster. The parameter
--   change will be applied after the cluster reboots.</li>
--   <li><tt>unknown-error</tt>: Cannot apply the parameter change right
--   now. The change will be applied after the cluster reboots.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:parameterApplyStatus:ClusterParameterStatus'] :: ClusterParameterStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the parameter.
[$sel:parameterName:ClusterParameterStatus'] :: ClusterParameterStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The error that prevented the parameter from being applied to the
--   database.
[$sel:parameterApplyErrorDescription:ClusterParameterStatus'] :: ClusterParameterStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ClusterParameterStatus</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterApplyStatus:ClusterParameterStatus'</a>,
--   <a>clusterParameterStatus_parameterApplyStatus</a> - The status of the
--   parameter that indicates whether the parameter is in sync with the
--   database, waiting for a cluster reboot, or encountered an error when
--   being applied.
--   
--   The following are possible statuses and descriptions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>in-sync</tt>: The parameter value is in sync with the
--   database.</li>
--   <li><tt>pending-reboot</tt>: The parameter value will be applied after
--   the cluster reboots.</li>
--   <li><tt>applying</tt>: The parameter value is being applied to the
--   database.</li>
--   <li><tt>invalid-parameter</tt>: Cannot apply the parameter value
--   because it has an invalid value or syntax.</li>
--   <li><tt>apply-deferred</tt>: The parameter contains static property
--   changes. The changes are deferred until the cluster reboots.</li>
--   <li><tt>apply-error</tt>: Cannot connect to the cluster. The parameter
--   change will be applied after the cluster reboots.</li>
--   <li><tt>unknown-error</tt>: Cannot apply the parameter change right
--   now. The change will be applied after the cluster reboots.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterName:ClusterParameterStatus'</a>,
--   <a>clusterParameterStatus_parameterName</a> - The name of the
--   parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterApplyErrorDescription:ClusterParameterStatus'</a>,
--   <a>clusterParameterStatus_parameterApplyErrorDescription</a> - The
--   error that prevented the parameter from being applied to the database.
newClusterParameterStatus :: ClusterParameterStatus

-- | The status of the parameter that indicates whether the parameter is in
--   sync with the database, waiting for a cluster reboot, or encountered
--   an error when being applied.
--   
--   The following are possible statuses and descriptions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>in-sync</tt>: The parameter value is in sync with the
--   database.</li>
--   <li><tt>pending-reboot</tt>: The parameter value will be applied after
--   the cluster reboots.</li>
--   <li><tt>applying</tt>: The parameter value is being applied to the
--   database.</li>
--   <li><tt>invalid-parameter</tt>: Cannot apply the parameter value
--   because it has an invalid value or syntax.</li>
--   <li><tt>apply-deferred</tt>: The parameter contains static property
--   changes. The changes are deferred until the cluster reboots.</li>
--   <li><tt>apply-error</tt>: Cannot connect to the cluster. The parameter
--   change will be applied after the cluster reboots.</li>
--   <li><tt>unknown-error</tt>: Cannot apply the parameter change right
--   now. The change will be applied after the cluster reboots.</li>
--   </ul>
clusterParameterStatus_parameterApplyStatus :: Lens' ClusterParameterStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the parameter.
clusterParameterStatus_parameterName :: Lens' ClusterParameterStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | The error that prevented the parameter from being applied to the
--   database.
clusterParameterStatus_parameterApplyErrorDescription :: Lens' ClusterParameterStatus (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ClusterParameterStatus.ClusterParameterStatus
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ClusterParameterStatus.ClusterParameterStatus
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ClusterParameterStatus.ClusterParameterStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ClusterParameterStatus.ClusterParameterStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ClusterParameterStatus.ClusterParameterStatus
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ClusterParameterStatus.ClusterParameterStatus
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ClusterParameterStatus.ClusterParameterStatus

module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus

-- | Returns the destination region and retention period that are
--   configured for cross-region snapshot copy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newClusterSnapshotCopyStatus</a> smart constructor.
data ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus
ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Integer -> ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus

-- | The destination region that snapshots are automatically copied to when
--   cross-region snapshot copy is enabled.
[$sel:destinationRegion:ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus'] :: ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the snapshot copy grant.
[$sel:snapshotCopyGrantName:ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus'] :: ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of days that automated snapshots are retained in the
--   destination region after they are copied from a source region. If the
--   value is -1, the manual snapshot is retained indefinitely.
--   
--   The value must be either -1 or an integer between 1 and 3,653.
[$sel:manualSnapshotRetentionPeriod:ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus'] :: ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of days that automated snapshots are retained in the
--   destination region after they are copied from a source region.
[$sel:retentionPeriod:ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus'] :: ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationRegion:ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus'</a>,
--   <a>clusterSnapshotCopyStatus_destinationRegion</a> - The destination
--   region that snapshots are automatically copied to when cross-region
--   snapshot copy is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotCopyGrantName:ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus'</a>,
--   <a>clusterSnapshotCopyStatus_snapshotCopyGrantName</a> - The name of
--   the snapshot copy grant.
--   
--   <a>$sel:manualSnapshotRetentionPeriod:ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus'</a>,
--   <a>clusterSnapshotCopyStatus_manualSnapshotRetentionPeriod</a> - The
--   number of days that automated snapshots are retained in the
--   destination region after they are copied from a source region. If the
--   value is -1, the manual snapshot is retained indefinitely.
--   
--   The value must be either -1 or an integer between 1 and 3,653.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retentionPeriod:ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus'</a>,
--   <a>clusterSnapshotCopyStatus_retentionPeriod</a> - The number of days
--   that automated snapshots are retained in the destination region after
--   they are copied from a source region.
newClusterSnapshotCopyStatus :: ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus

-- | The destination region that snapshots are automatically copied to when
--   cross-region snapshot copy is enabled.
clusterSnapshotCopyStatus_destinationRegion :: Lens' ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the snapshot copy grant.
clusterSnapshotCopyStatus_snapshotCopyGrantName :: Lens' ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of days that automated snapshots are retained in the
--   destination region after they are copied from a source region. If the
--   value is -1, the manual snapshot is retained indefinitely.
--   
--   The value must be either -1 or an integer between 1 and 3,653.
clusterSnapshotCopyStatus_manualSnapshotRetentionPeriod :: Lens' ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of days that automated snapshots are retained in the
--   destination region after they are copied from a source region.
clusterSnapshotCopyStatus_retentionPeriod :: Lens' ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus (Maybe Integer)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus.ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus.ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus

module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.DataShareAssociation

-- | The association of a datashare from a producer account with a data
--   consumer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDataShareAssociation</a> smart constructor.
data DataShareAssociation
DataShareAssociation' :: Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe DataShareStatus -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> DataShareAssociation

-- | The creation date of the datashare that is associated.
[$sel:createdDate:DataShareAssociation'] :: DataShareAssociation -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The status of the datashare that is associated.
[$sel:status:DataShareAssociation'] :: DataShareAssociation -> Maybe DataShareStatus

-- | The status change data of the datashare that is associated.
[$sel:statusChangeDate:DataShareAssociation'] :: DataShareAssociation -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The name of the consumer accounts that have an association with a
--   producer datashare.
[$sel:consumerIdentifier:DataShareAssociation'] :: DataShareAssociation -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DataShareAssociation</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdDate:DataShareAssociation'</a>,
--   <a>dataShareAssociation_createdDate</a> - The creation date of the
--   datashare that is associated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:DataShareAssociation'</a>,
--   <a>dataShareAssociation_status</a> - The status of the datashare that
--   is associated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusChangeDate:DataShareAssociation'</a>,
--   <a>dataShareAssociation_statusChangeDate</a> - The status change data
--   of the datashare that is associated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:consumerIdentifier:DataShareAssociation'</a>,
--   <a>dataShareAssociation_consumerIdentifier</a> - The name of the
--   consumer accounts that have an association with a producer datashare.
newDataShareAssociation :: DataShareAssociation

-- | The creation date of the datashare that is associated.
dataShareAssociation_createdDate :: Lens' DataShareAssociation (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The status of the datashare that is associated.
dataShareAssociation_status :: Lens' DataShareAssociation (Maybe DataShareStatus)

-- | The status change data of the datashare that is associated.

--   producer datashare.

module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.DataShare

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDataShare</a> smart constructor.
data DataShare
DataShare' :: Maybe [DataShareAssociation] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DataShare

-- | A value that specifies when the datashare has an association between a
--   producer and data consumers.
[$sel:dataShareAssociations:DataShare'] :: DataShare -> Maybe [DataShareAssociation]

-- | A value that specifies whether the datashare can be shared to a
--   publicly accessible cluster.
[$sel:allowPubliclyAccessibleConsumers:DataShare'] :: DataShare -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the producer.
[$sel:producerArn:DataShare'] :: DataShare -> Maybe Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that references the datashare that is
--   owned by a specific namespace of the producer cluster. A datashare ARN
--   is in the
--   <tt>arn:aws:redshift:{region}:{account-id}:{datashare}:{namespace-guid}/{datashare-name}</tt>
--   format.
[$sel:dataShareArn:DataShare'] :: DataShare -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DataShare</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataShareAssociations:DataShare'</a>,
--   <a>dataShare_dataShareAssociations</a> - A value that specifies when
--   the datashare has an association between a producer and data
--   consumers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowPubliclyAccessibleConsumers:DataShare'</a>,
--   <a>dataShare_allowPubliclyAccessibleConsumers</a> - A value that
--   specifies whether the datashare can be shared to a publicly accessible
--   cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:producerArn:DataShare'</a>, <a>dataShare_producerArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the producer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataShareArn:DataShare'</a>, <a>dataShare_dataShareArn</a> -
--   An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that references the datashare that is
--   owned by a specific namespace of the producer cluster. A datashare ARN
--   is in the
--   <tt>arn:aws:redshift:{region}:{account-id}:{datashare}:{namespace-guid}/{datashare-name}</tt>
--   format.
newDataShare :: DataShare

-- | A value that specifies when the datashare has an association between a
--   producer and data consumers.
dataShare_dataShareAssociations :: Lens' DataShare (Maybe [DataShareAssociation])

-- | A value that specifies whether the datashare can be shared to a
--   publicly accessible cluster.
dataShare_allowPubliclyAccessibleConsumers :: Lens' DataShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the producer.
dataShare_producerArn :: Lens' DataShare (Maybe Text)

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that references the datashare that is
--   owned by a specific namespace of the producer cluster. A datashare ARN
--   is in the
--   <tt>arn:aws:redshift:{region}:{account-id}:{datashare}:{namespace-guid}/{datashare-name}</tt>
--   format.
dataShare_dataShareArn :: Lens' DataShare (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.DataShare.DataShare
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.DataShare.DataShare
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.DataShare.DataShare

module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.DataTransferProgress

-- | Describes the status of a cluster while it is in the process of
--   resizing with an incremental resize.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDataTransferProgress</a> smart constructor.
data DataTransferProgress
DataTransferProgress' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> DataTransferProgress

-- | Describes the status of the cluster. While the transfer is in progress
--   the status is <tt>transferringdata</tt>.
[$sel:status:DataTransferProgress'] :: DataTransferProgress -> Maybe Text

-- | Describes the estimated number of seconds remaining to complete the
--   transfer.
[$sel:estimatedTimeToCompletionInSeconds:DataTransferProgress'] :: DataTransferProgress -> Maybe Integer

-- | Describes the total amount of data that has been transfered in MB's.
[$sel:dataTransferredInMegaBytes:DataTransferProgress'] :: DataTransferProgress -> Maybe Integer

-- | Describes the data transfer rate in MB's per second.
[$sel:currentRateInMegaBytesPerSecond:DataTransferProgress'] :: DataTransferProgress -> Maybe Double

-- | Describes the number of seconds that have elapsed during the data
--   transfer.
[$sel:elapsedTimeInSeconds:DataTransferProgress'] :: DataTransferProgress -> Maybe Integer

-- | Describes the total amount of data to be transfered in megabytes.
[$sel:totalDataInMegaBytes:DataTransferProgress'] :: DataTransferProgress -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>DataTransferProgress</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:DataTransferProgress'</a>,
--   <a>dataTransferProgress_status</a> - Describes the status of the
--   cluster. While the transfer is in progress the status is
--   <tt>transferringdata</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:estimatedTimeToCompletionInSeconds:DataTransferProgress'</a>,
--   <a>dataTransferProgress_estimatedTimeToCompletionInSeconds</a> -
--   Describes the estimated number of seconds remaining to complete the
--   transfer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataTransferredInMegaBytes:DataTransferProgress'</a>,
--   <a>dataTransferProgress_dataTransferredInMegaBytes</a> - Describes the
--   total amount of data that has been transfered in MB's.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentRateInMegaBytesPerSecond:DataTransferProgress'</a>,
--   <a>dataTransferProgress_currentRateInMegaBytesPerSecond</a> -
--   Describes the data transfer rate in MB's per second.
--   
--   <a>$sel:elapsedTimeInSeconds:DataTransferProgress'</a>,
--   <a>dataTransferProgress_elapsedTimeInSeconds</a> - Describes the
--   number of seconds that have elapsed during the data transfer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalDataInMegaBytes:DataTransferProgress'</a>,
--   <a>dataTransferProgress_totalDataInMegaBytes</a> - Describes the total
--   amount of data to be transfered in megabytes.
newDataTransferProgress :: DataTransferProgress

-- | Describes the status of the cluster. While the transfer is in progress
--   the status is <tt>transferringdata</tt>.
dataTransferProgress_status :: Lens' DataTransferProgress (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes the estimated number of seconds remaining to complete the
--   transfer.
dataTransferProgress_estimatedTimeToCompletionInSeconds :: Lens' DataTransferProgress (Maybe Integer)

-- | Describes the total amount of data that has been transfered in MB's.
dataTransferProgress_dataTransferredInMegaBytes :: Lens' DataTransferProgress (Maybe Integer)

-- | Describes the data transfer rate in MB's per second.
dataTransferProgress_currentRateInMegaBytesPerSecond :: Lens' DataTransferProgress (Maybe Double)

-- | Describes the number of seconds that have elapsed during the data
--   transfer.
dataTransferProgress_elapsedTimeInSeconds :: Lens' DataTransferProgress (Maybe Integer)

-- | Describes the total amount of data to be transfered in megabytes.
dataTransferProgress_totalDataInMegaBytes :: Lens' DataTransferProgress (Maybe Integer)

--   cluster name.

module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.EndpointAuthorization

-- | Describes an endpoint authorization for authorizing Redshift-managed
--   VPC endpoint access to a cluster across Amazon Web Services accounts.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointAuthorization</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointAuthorization
EndpointAuthorization' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe AuthorizationStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> EndpointAuthorization

-- | Indicates whether all VPCs in the grantee account are allowed access
--   to the cluster.
[$sel:allowedAllVPCs:EndpointAuthorization'] :: EndpointAuthorization -> Maybe Bool

-- | The status of the authorization action.
[$sel:status:EndpointAuthorization'] :: EndpointAuthorization -> Maybe AuthorizationStatus

-- | The cluster identifier.
[$sel:clusterIdentifier:EndpointAuthorization'] :: EndpointAuthorization -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services account ID of the grantee of the cluster.
[$sel:grantee:EndpointAuthorization'] :: EndpointAuthorization -> Maybe Text

-- | The time (UTC) when the authorization was created.
[$sel:authorizeTime:EndpointAuthorization'] :: EndpointAuthorization -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The VPCs allowed access to the cluster.
[$sel:allowedVPCs:EndpointAuthorization'] :: EndpointAuthorization -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The status of the cluster.
[$sel:clusterStatus:EndpointAuthorization'] :: EndpointAuthorization -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services account ID of the cluster owner.
[$sel:grantor:EndpointAuthorization'] :: EndpointAuthorization -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of Redshift-managed VPC endpoints created for the
--   authorization.
[$sel:endpointCount:EndpointAuthorization'] :: EndpointAuthorization -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>EndpointAuthorization</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowedAllVPCs:EndpointAuthorization'</a>,
--   <a>endpointAuthorization_allowedAllVPCs</a> - Indicates whether all
--   VPCs in the grantee account are allowed access to the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:EndpointAuthorization'</a>,
--   <a>endpointAuthorization_status</a> - The status of the authorization
--   action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterIdentifier:EndpointAuthorization'</a>,
--   <a>endpointAuthorization_clusterIdentifier</a> - The cluster
--   identifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:grantee:EndpointAuthorization'</a>,
--   <a>endpointAuthorization_grantee</a> - The Amazon Web Services account
--   ID of the grantee of the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authorizeTime:EndpointAuthorization'</a>,
--   <a>endpointAuthorization_authorizeTime</a> - The time (UTC) when the
--   authorization was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowedVPCs:EndpointAuthorization'</a>,
--   <a>endpointAuthorization_allowedVPCs</a> - The VPCs allowed access to
--   the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterStatus:EndpointAuthorization'</a>,
--   <a>endpointAuthorization_clusterStatus</a> - The status of the
--   cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:grantor:EndpointAuthorization'</a>,
--   <a>endpointAuthorization_grantor</a> - The Amazon Web Services account
--   ID of the cluster owner.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointCount:EndpointAuthorization'</a>,
--   <a>endpointAuthorization_endpointCount</a> - The number of
--   Redshift-managed VPC endpoints created for the authorization.
newEndpointAuthorization :: EndpointAuthorization

-- | Indicates whether all VPCs in the grantee account are allowed access
--   to the cluster.
endpointAuthorization_allowedAllVPCs :: Lens' EndpointAuthorization (Maybe Bool)

-- | The status of the authorization action.
endpointAuthorization_status :: Lens' EndpointAuthorization (Maybe AuthorizationStatus)

-- | The cluster identifier.
endpointAuthorization_clusterIdentifier :: Lens' EndpointAuthorization (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Web Services account ID of the grantee of the cluster.
endpointAuthorization_grantee :: Lens' EndpointAuthorization (Maybe Text)

-- | The time (UTC) when the authorization was created.
endpointAuthorization_authorizeTime :: Lens' EndpointAuthorization (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The VPCs allowed access to the cluster.
endpointAuthorization_allowedVPCs :: Lens' EndpointAuthorization (Maybe [Text])

-- | The status of the cluster.
endpointAuthorization_clusterStatus :: Lens' EndpointAuthorization (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Web Services account ID of the cluster owner.
endpointAuthorization_grantor :: Lens' EndpointAuthorization (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of Redshift-managed VPC endpoints created for the
--   authorization.
endpointAuthorization_endpointCount :: Lens' EndpointAuthorization (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.EndpointAuthorization.EndpointAuthorization
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.EndpointAuthorization.EndpointAuthorization
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.EndpointAuthorization.EndpointAuthorization
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.EndpointAuthorization.EndpointAuthorization
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.EndpointAuthorization.EndpointAuthorization

module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.EventInfoMap

-- | Describes event information.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventInfoMap</a> smart constructor.
data EventInfoMap
EventInfoMap' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> EventInfoMap

-- | The identifier of an Amazon Redshift event.
[$sel:eventId:EventInfoMap'] :: EventInfoMap -> Maybe Text

-- | The severity of the event.
--   
--   Values: ERROR, INFO
[$sel:severity:EventInfoMap'] :: EventInfoMap -> Maybe Text

-- | The category of an Amazon Redshift event.
[$sel:eventCategories:EventInfoMap'] :: EventInfoMap -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The description of an Amazon Redshift event.
[$sel:eventDescription:EventInfoMap'] :: EventInfoMap -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EventInfoMap</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventId:EventInfoMap'</a>, <a>eventInfoMap_eventId</a> - The
--   identifier of an Amazon Redshift event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:severity:EventInfoMap'</a>, <a>eventInfoMap_severity</a> - The
--   severity of the event.
--   
--   Values: ERROR, INFO
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventCategories:EventInfoMap'</a>,
--   <a>eventInfoMap_eventCategories</a> - The category of an Amazon
--   Redshift event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventDescription:EventInfoMap'</a>,
--   <a>eventInfoMap_eventDescription</a> - The description of an Amazon
--   Redshift event.
newEventInfoMap :: EventInfoMap

-- | The identifier of an Amazon Redshift event.
eventInfoMap_eventId :: Lens' EventInfoMap (Maybe Text)

-- | The severity of the event.
--   
--   Values: ERROR, INFO
eventInfoMap_severity :: Lens' EventInfoMap (Maybe Text)

-- | The category of an Amazon Redshift event.
eventInfoMap_eventCategories :: Lens' EventInfoMap (Maybe [Text])

-- | The description of an Amazon Redshift event.

module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.HsmStatus

-- | Describes the status of changes to HSM settings.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHsmStatus</a> smart constructor.
data HsmStatus
HsmStatus' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> HsmStatus

-- | Reports whether the Amazon Redshift cluster has finished applying any
--   HSM settings changes specified in a modify cluster command.
--   
--   Values: active, applying
[$sel:status:HsmStatus'] :: HsmStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the name of the HSM client certificate the Amazon Redshift
--   cluster uses to retrieve the data encryption keys stored in an HSM.
[$sel:hsmClientCertificateIdentifier:HsmStatus'] :: HsmStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the name of the HSM configuration that contains the
--   information the Amazon Redshift cluster can use to retrieve and store
--   keys in an HSM.
[$sel:hsmConfigurationIdentifier:HsmStatus'] :: HsmStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>HsmStatus</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:HsmStatus'</a>, <a>hsmStatus_status</a> - Reports
--   whether the Amazon Redshift cluster has finished applying any HSM
--   settings changes specified in a modify cluster command.
--   
--   Values: active, applying
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsmClientCertificateIdentifier:HsmStatus'</a>,
--   <a>hsmStatus_hsmClientCertificateIdentifier</a> - Specifies the name
--   of the HSM client certificate the Amazon Redshift cluster uses to
--   retrieve the data encryption keys stored in an HSM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsmConfigurationIdentifier:HsmStatus'</a>,
--   <a>hsmStatus_hsmConfigurationIdentifier</a> - Specifies the name of
--   the HSM configuration that contains the information the Amazon
--   Redshift cluster can use to retrieve and store keys in an HSM.
newHsmStatus :: HsmStatus

-- | Reports whether the Amazon Redshift cluster has finished applying any
--   HSM settings changes specified in a modify cluster command.
--   
--   Values: active, applying
hsmStatus_status :: Lens' HsmStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the name of the HSM client certificate the Amazon Redshift
--   cluster uses to retrieve the data encryption keys stored in an HSM.
hsmStatus_hsmClientCertificateIdentifier :: Lens' HsmStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the name of the HSM configuration that contains the
--   information the Amazon Redshift cluster can use to retrieve and store
--   keys in an HSM.
hsmStatus_hsmConfigurationIdentifier :: Lens' HsmStatus (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.HsmStatus.HsmStatus

module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.LoggingStatus

-- | Describes the status of logging for a cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLoggingStatus</a> smart constructor.
data LoggingStatus
LoggingStatus' :: Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> LoggingStatus

-- | The last time that logs were delivered.
[$sel:lastSuccessfulDeliveryTime:LoggingStatus'] :: LoggingStatus -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The name of the S3 bucket where the log files are stored.
[$sel:bucketName:LoggingStatus'] :: LoggingStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | <tt>true</tt> if logging is on, <tt>false</tt> if logging is off.
[$sel:loggingEnabled:LoggingStatus'] :: LoggingStatus -> Maybe Bool

-- | The prefix applied to the log file names.
[$sel:s3KeyPrefix:LoggingStatus'] :: LoggingStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The last time when logs failed to be delivered.
[$sel:lastFailureTime:LoggingStatus'] :: LoggingStatus -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The message indicating that logs failed to be delivered.
[$sel:lastFailureMessage:LoggingStatus'] :: LoggingStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>LoggingStatus</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastSuccessfulDeliveryTime:LoggingStatus'</a>,
--   <a>loggingStatus_lastSuccessfulDeliveryTime</a> - The last time that
--   logs were delivered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketName:LoggingStatus'</a>, <a>loggingStatus_bucketName</a>
--   - The name of the S3 bucket where the log files are stored.
--   
--   <a>$sel:loggingEnabled:LoggingStatus'</a>,
--   <a>loggingStatus_loggingEnabled</a> - <tt>true</tt> if logging is on,
--   <tt>false</tt> if logging is off.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3KeyPrefix:LoggingStatus'</a>,
--   <a>loggingStatus_s3KeyPrefix</a> - The prefix applied to the log file
--   names.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastFailureTime:LoggingStatus'</a>,
--   <a>loggingStatus_lastFailureTime</a> - The last time when logs failed
--   to be delivered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastFailureMessage:LoggingStatus'</a>,
--   <a>loggingStatus_lastFailureMessage</a> - The message indicating that
--   logs failed to be delivered.
newLoggingStatus :: LoggingStatus

-- | The last time that logs were delivered.
loggingStatus_lastSuccessfulDeliveryTime :: Lens' LoggingStatus (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the S3 bucket where the log files are stored.
loggingStatus_bucketName :: Lens' LoggingStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | <tt>true</tt> if logging is on, <tt>false</tt> if logging is off.
loggingStatus_loggingEnabled :: Lens' LoggingStatus (Maybe Bool)

-- | The prefix applied to the log file names.
loggingStatus_s3KeyPrefix :: Lens' LoggingStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | The last time when logs failed to be delivered.
loggingStatus_lastFailureTime :: Lens' LoggingStatus (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The message indicating that logs failed to be delivered.
loggingStatus_lastFailureMessage :: Lens' LoggingStatus (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.LoggingStatus.LoggingStatus
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.LoggingStatus.LoggingStatus
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.LoggingStatus.LoggingStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.LoggingStatus.LoggingStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.LoggingStatus.LoggingStatus
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.LoggingStatus.LoggingStatus
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.LoggingStatus.LoggingStatus

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNodeConfigurationOption</a> smart constructor.

--   configuration recommendation.

--   <a>nodeConfigurationOption_numberOfNodes</a> - The number of nodes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:estimatedDiskUtilizationPercent:NodeConfigurationOption'</a>,
--   <a>nodeConfigurationOption_estimatedDiskUtilizationPercent</a> - The
--   estimated disk utilizaton percentage.
--

module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter

-- | A set of elements to filter the returned node configurations.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNodeConfigurationOptionsFilter</a> smart
--   constructor.
data NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter
NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe OperatorType -> Maybe NodeConfigurationOptionsFilterName -> NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter

-- | List of values. Compare Name using Operator to Values. If filter Name
--   is NumberOfNodes, then values can range from 0 to 200. If filter Name
--   is EstimatedDiskUtilizationPercent, then values can range from 0 to
--   100. For example, filter NumberOfNodes (name) GT (operator) 3
--   (values).
[$sel:values:NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter'] :: NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The filter operator. If filter Name is NodeType only the 'in' operator
--   is supported. Provide one value to evaluate for 'eq', 'lt', 'le',
--   'gt', and 'ge'. Provide two values to evaluate for 'between'. Provide
--   a list of values for 'in'.
[$sel:operator:NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter'] :: NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter -> Maybe OperatorType

-- | The name of the element to filter.
[$sel:name:NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter'] :: NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter -> Maybe NodeConfigurationOptionsFilterName

-- | Create a value of <a>NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter'</a>,
--   <a>nodeConfigurationOptionsFilter_values</a> - List of values. Compare
--   Name using Operator to Values. If filter Name is NumberOfNodes, then
--   values can range from 0 to 200. If filter Name is
--   EstimatedDiskUtilizationPercent, then values can range from 0 to 100.
--   For example, filter NumberOfNodes (name) GT (operator) 3 (values).
--   
--   <a>$sel:operator:NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter'</a>,
--   <a>nodeConfigurationOptionsFilter_operator</a> - The filter operator.
--   If filter Name is NodeType only the 'in' operator is supported.
--   Provide one value to evaluate for 'eq', 'lt', 'le', 'gt', and 'ge'.
--   Provide two values to evaluate for 'between'. Provide a list of values
--   for 'in'.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter'</a>,
--   <a>nodeConfigurationOptionsFilter_name</a> - The name of the element
--   to filter.
newNodeConfigurationOptionsFilter :: NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter

-- | List of values. Compare Name using Operator to Values. If filter Name
--   is NumberOfNodes, then values can range from 0 to 200. If filter Name
--   is EstimatedDiskUtilizationPercent, then values can range from 0 to
--   100. For example, filter NumberOfNodes (name) GT (operator) 3
--   (values).
nodeConfigurationOptionsFilter_values :: Lens' NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter (Maybe [Text])

-- | The filter operator. If filter Name is NodeType only the 'in' operator
--   is supported. Provide one value to evaluate for 'eq', 'lt', 'le',
--   'gt', and 'ge'. Provide two values to evaluate for 'between'. Provide
--   a list of values for 'in'.
nodeConfigurationOptionsFilter_operator :: Lens' NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter (Maybe OperatorType)

-- | The name of the element to filter.
nodeConfigurationOptionsFilter_name :: Lens' NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter (Maybe NodeConfigurationOptionsFilterName)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter.NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter.NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter.NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter.NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter

module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.Parameter

-- | Describes a parameter in a cluster parameter group.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newParameter</a> smart constructor.
data Parameter
Parameter' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ParameterApplyType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Parameter

-- | The valid range of values for the parameter.
[$sel:allowedValues:Parameter'] :: Parameter -> Maybe Text

-- | The source of the parameter value, such as "engine-default" or "user".
[$sel:source:Parameter'] :: Parameter -> Maybe Text

-- | The value of the parameter. If <tt>ParameterName</tt> is
--   <tt>wlm_json_configuration</tt>, then the maximum size of
--   <tt>ParameterValue</tt> is 8000 characters.
[$sel:parameterValue:Parameter'] :: Parameter -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies how to apply the WLM configuration parameter. Some
--   properties can be applied dynamically, while other properties require
--   that any associated clusters be rebooted for the configuration changes
--   to be applied. For more information about parameters and parameter
--   groups, go to <a>Amazon Redshift Parameter Groups</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Redshift Cluster Management Guide</i>.
[$sel:applyType:Parameter'] :: Parameter -> Maybe ParameterApplyType

-- | The name of the parameter.
[$sel:parameterName:Parameter'] :: Parameter -> Maybe Text

-- | A description of the parameter.
[$sel:description:Parameter'] :: Parameter -> Maybe Text

-- | The data type of the parameter.
[$sel:dataType:Parameter'] :: Parameter -> Maybe Text

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, the parameter can be modified. Some parameters have
--   security or operational implications that prevent them from being
--   changed.
[$sel:isModifiable:Parameter'] :: Parameter -> Maybe Bool

-- | The earliest engine version to which the parameter can apply.
[$sel:minimumEngineVersion:Parameter'] :: Parameter -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Parameter</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowedValues:Parameter'</a>, <a>parameter_allowedValues</a> -
--   The valid range of values for the parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:source:Parameter'</a>, <a>parameter_source</a> - The source of
--   the parameter value, such as "engine-default" or "user".
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterValue:Parameter'</a>, <a>parameter_parameterValue</a>
--   - The value of the parameter. If <tt>ParameterName</tt> is
--   <tt>wlm_json_configuration</tt>, then the maximum size of
--   <tt>ParameterValue</tt> is 8000 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applyType:Parameter'</a>, <a>parameter_applyType</a> -
--   Specifies how to apply the WLM configuration parameter. Some
--   properties can be applied dynamically, while other properties require
--   that any associated clusters be rebooted for the configuration changes
--   to be applied. For more information about parameters and parameter
--   groups, go to <a>Amazon Redshift Parameter Groups</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Redshift Cluster Management Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterName:Parameter'</a>, <a>parameter_parameterName</a> -
--   The name of the parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:Parameter'</a>, <a>parameter_description</a> - A
--   description of the parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataType:Parameter'</a>, <a>parameter_dataType</a> - The data
--   type of the parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isModifiable:Parameter'</a>, <a>parameter_isModifiable</a> -
--   If <tt>true</tt>, the parameter can be modified. Some parameters have
--   security or operational implications that prevent them from being
--   changed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minimumEngineVersion:Parameter'</a>,
--   <a>parameter_minimumEngineVersion</a> - The earliest engine version to
--   which the parameter can apply.
newParameter :: Parameter

-- | The valid range of values for the parameter.
parameter_allowedValues :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe Text)

-- | The source of the parameter value, such as "engine-default" or "user".
parameter_source :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe Text)

-- | The value of the parameter. If <tt>ParameterName</tt> is
--   <tt>wlm_json_configuration</tt>, then the maximum size of
--   <tt>ParameterValue</tt> is 8000 characters.
parameter_parameterValue :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies how to apply the WLM configuration parameter. Some
--   properties can be applied dynamically, while other properties require
--   that any associated clusters be rebooted for the configuration changes
--   to be applied. For more information about parameters and parameter
--   groups, go to <a>Amazon Redshift Parameter Groups</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Redshift Cluster Management Guide</i>.
parameter_applyType :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe ParameterApplyType)

-- | The name of the parameter.
parameter_parameterName :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe Text)

-- | A description of the parameter.
parameter_description :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe Text)

-- | The data type of the parameter.
parameter_dataType :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe Text)

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, the parameter can be modified. Some parameters have
--   security or operational implications that prevent them from being
--   changed.
parameter_isModifiable :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe Bool)

-- | The earliest engine version to which the parameter can apply.
parameter_minimumEngineVersion :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.Parameter.Parameter
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.Parameter.Parameter
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.Parameter.Parameter
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.Parameter.Parameter
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.Parameter.Parameter
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.Parameter.Parameter
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.Parameter.Parameter
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.Parameter.Parameter


module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.DefaultClusterParameters

-- | Describes the default cluster parameters for a parameter group family.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDefaultClusterParameters</a> smart constructor.
data DefaultClusterParameters
DefaultClusterParameters' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Parameter] -> Maybe Text -> DefaultClusterParameters

-- | The name of the cluster parameter group family to which the engine
--   default parameters apply.
[$sel:parameterGroupFamily:DefaultClusterParameters'] :: DefaultClusterParameters -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of cluster default parameters.
[$sel:parameters:DefaultClusterParameters'] :: DefaultClusterParameters -> Maybe [Parameter]

-- | A value that indicates the starting point for the next set of response
--   records in a subsequent request. If a value is returned in a response,
--   you can retrieve the next set of records by providing this returned
--   marker value in the <tt>Marker</tt> parameter and retrying the
--   command. If the <tt>Marker</tt> field is empty, all response records
--   have been retrieved for the request.
[$sel:marker:DefaultClusterParameters'] :: DefaultClusterParameters -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DefaultClusterParameters</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterGroupFamily:DefaultClusterParameters'</a>,
--   <a>defaultClusterParameters_parameterGroupFamily</a> - The name of the
--   cluster parameter group family to which the engine default parameters
--   apply.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameters:DefaultClusterParameters'</a>,
--   <a>defaultClusterParameters_parameters</a> - The list of cluster
--   default parameters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:marker:DefaultClusterParameters'</a>,
--   <a>defaultClusterParameters_marker</a> - A value that indicates the
--   starting point for the next set of response records in a subsequent
--   request. If a value is returned in a response, you can retrieve the
--   next set of records by providing this returned marker value in the
--   <tt>Marker</tt> parameter and retrying the command. If the
--   <tt>Marker</tt> field is empty, all response records have been
--   retrieved for the request.
newDefaultClusterParameters :: DefaultClusterParameters

-- | The name of the cluster parameter group family to which the engine
--   default parameters apply.
defaultClusterParameters_parameterGroupFamily :: Lens' DefaultClusterParameters (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of cluster default parameters.
defaultClusterParameters_parameters :: Lens' DefaultClusterParameters (Maybe [Parameter])

-- | A value that indicates the starting point for the next set of response
--   records in a subsequent request. If a value is returned in a response,
--   you can retrieve the next set of records by providing this returned
--   marker value in the <tt>Marker</tt> parameter and retrying the
--   command. If the <tt>Marker</tt> field is empty, all response records
--   have been retrieved for the request.
defaultClusterParameters_marker :: Lens' DefaultClusterParameters (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.DefaultClusterParameters.DefaultClusterParameters
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.DefaultClusterParameters.DefaultClusterParameters
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.DefaultClusterParameters.DefaultClusterParameters
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.DefaultClusterParameters.DefaultClusterParameters
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.DefaultClusterParameters.DefaultClusterParameters
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.DefaultClusterParameters.DefaultClusterParameters
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.DefaultClusterParameters.DefaultClusterParameters

module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.PartnerIntegrationInfo

-- | Describes a partner integration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPartnerIntegrationInfo</a> smart constructor.
data PartnerIntegrationInfo
PartnerIntegrationInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe PartnerIntegrationStatus -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> PartnerIntegrationInfo

-- | The status message provided by the partner.
[$sel:statusMessage:PartnerIntegrationInfo'] :: PartnerIntegrationInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The partner integration status.
[$sel:status:PartnerIntegrationInfo'] :: PartnerIntegrationInfo -> Maybe PartnerIntegrationStatus

-- | The date (UTC) that the partner integration status was last updated by
--   the partner.
[$sel:updatedAt:PartnerIntegrationInfo'] :: PartnerIntegrationInfo -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The date (UTC) that the partner integration was created.
[$sel:createdAt:PartnerIntegrationInfo'] :: PartnerIntegrationInfo -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The name of the partner.
[$sel:partnerName:PartnerIntegrationInfo'] :: PartnerIntegrationInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the database that receives data from a partner.
[$sel:databaseName:PartnerIntegrationInfo'] :: PartnerIntegrationInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PartnerIntegrationInfo</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusMessage:PartnerIntegrationInfo'</a>,
--   <a>partnerIntegrationInfo_statusMessage</a> - The status message
--   provided by the partner.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:PartnerIntegrationInfo'</a>,
--   <a>partnerIntegrationInfo_status</a> - The partner integration status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:updatedAt:PartnerIntegrationInfo'</a>,
--   <a>partnerIntegrationInfo_updatedAt</a> - The date (UTC) that the
--   partner integration status was last updated by the partner.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:PartnerIntegrationInfo'</a>,
--   <a>partnerIntegrationInfo_createdAt</a> - The date (UTC) that the
--   partner integration was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:partnerName:PartnerIntegrationInfo'</a>,
--   <a>partnerIntegrationInfo_partnerName</a> - The name of the partner.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseName:PartnerIntegrationInfo'</a>,
--   <a>partnerIntegrationInfo_databaseName</a> - The name of the database
--   that receives data from a partner.
newPartnerIntegrationInfo :: PartnerIntegrationInfo

-- | The status message provided by the partner.
partnerIntegrationInfo_statusMessage :: Lens' PartnerIntegrationInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The partner integration status.
partnerIntegrationInfo_status :: Lens' PartnerIntegrationInfo (Maybe PartnerIntegrationStatus)

-- | The date (UTC) that the partner integration status was last updated by
--   the partner.
partnerIntegrationInfo_updatedAt :: Lens' PartnerIntegrationInfo (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date (UTC) that the partner integration was created.
partnerIntegrationInfo_createdAt :: Lens' PartnerIntegrationInfo (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the partner.
partnerIntegrationInfo_partnerName :: Lens' PartnerIntegrationInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the database that receives data from a partner.

module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.PendingModifiedValues

-- | Describes cluster attributes that are in a pending state. A change to
--   one or more the attributes was requested and is in progress or will be
--   applied.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPendingModifiedValues</a> smart constructor.
data PendingModifiedValues
PendingModifiedValues' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> PendingModifiedValues

-- | An option that specifies whether to create the cluster with enhanced
--   VPC routing enabled. To create a cluster that uses enhanced VPC
--   routing, the cluster must be in a VPC. For more information, see
--   <a>Enhanced VPC Routing</a> in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management
--   Guide.
--   
--   If this option is <tt>true</tt>, enhanced VPC routing is enabled.
--   
--   Default: false
[$sel:enhancedVpcRouting:PendingModifiedValues'] :: PendingModifiedValues -> Maybe Bool

-- | The encryption type for a cluster. Possible values are: KMS and None.
[$sel:encryptionType:PendingModifiedValues'] :: PendingModifiedValues -> Maybe Text

-- | The pending or in-progress change of the automated snapshot retention
--   period.
[$sel:automatedSnapshotRetentionPeriod:PendingModifiedValues'] :: PendingModifiedValues -> Maybe Int

-- | The pending or in-progress change of the admin user password for the
--   cluster.
[$sel:masterUserPassword:PendingModifiedValues'] :: PendingModifiedValues -> Maybe Text

-- | The pending or in-progress change of the ability to connect to the
--   cluster from the public network.
[$sel:publiclyAccessible:PendingModifiedValues'] :: PendingModifiedValues -> Maybe Bool

-- | The pending or in-progress change of the cluster type.
[$sel:clusterType:PendingModifiedValues'] :: PendingModifiedValues -> Maybe Text

-- | The pending or in-progress change of the new identifier for the
--   cluster.
[$sel:clusterIdentifier:PendingModifiedValues'] :: PendingModifiedValues -> Maybe Text

-- | The pending or in-progress change of the number of nodes in the
--   cluster.
[$sel:numberOfNodes:PendingModifiedValues'] :: PendingModifiedValues -> Maybe Int

-- | The pending or in-progress change of the service version.
[$sel:clusterVersion:PendingModifiedValues'] :: PendingModifiedValues -> Maybe Text

-- | The pending or in-progress change of the cluster's node type.
[$sel:nodeType:PendingModifiedValues'] :: PendingModifiedValues -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the maintenance track that the cluster will change to
--   during the next maintenance window.
[$sel:maintenanceTrackName:PendingModifiedValues'] :: PendingModifiedValues -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PendingModifiedValues</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--

--   specifies whether to create the cluster with enhanced VPC routing
--   enabled. To create a cluster that uses enhanced VPC routing, the
--   cluster must be in a VPC. For more information, see <a>Enhanced VPC
--   Routing</a> in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management Guide.
--   
--   If this option is <tt>true</tt>, enhanced VPC routing is enabled.
--   
--   Default: false

--   <a>$sel:encryptionType:PendingModifiedValues'</a>,
--   <a>pendingModifiedValues_encryptionType</a> - The encryption type for

--   public network.

--   maintenance track that the cluster will change to during the next
--   maintenance window.
newPendingModifiedValues :: PendingModifiedValues

module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ReservedNodeOffering

-- | Describes a reserved node offering.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReservedNodeOffering</a> smart constructor.
data ReservedNodeOffering
ReservedNodeOffering' :: Maybe ReservedNodeOfferingType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [RecurringCharge] -> ReservedNodeOffering
[$sel:reservedNodeOfferingType:ReservedNodeOffering'] :: ReservedNodeOffering -> Maybe ReservedNodeOfferingType

-- | The offering identifier.
[$sel:reservedNodeOfferingId:ReservedNodeOffering'] :: ReservedNodeOffering -> Maybe Text

-- | The duration, in seconds, for which the offering will reserve the
--   node.
[$sel:duration:ReservedNodeOffering'] :: ReservedNodeOffering -> Maybe Int

-- | The currency code for the compute nodes offering.
[$sel:currencyCode:ReservedNodeOffering'] :: ReservedNodeOffering -> Maybe Text

-- | The upfront fixed charge you will pay to purchase the specific
--   reserved node offering.
[$sel:fixedPrice:ReservedNodeOffering'] :: ReservedNodeOffering -> Maybe Double

-- | The rate you are charged for each hour the cluster that is using the
--   offering is running.
[$sel:usagePrice:ReservedNodeOffering'] :: ReservedNodeOffering -> Maybe Double

-- | The anticipated utilization of the reserved node, as defined in the
--   reserved node offering.
[$sel:offeringType:ReservedNodeOffering'] :: ReservedNodeOffering -> Maybe Text

-- | The node type offered by the reserved node offering.
[$sel:nodeType:ReservedNodeOffering'] :: ReservedNodeOffering -> Maybe Text

-- | The charge to your account regardless of whether you are creating any
--   clusters using the node offering. Recurring charges are only in effect
--   for heavy-utilization reserved nodes.
[$sel:recurringCharges:ReservedNodeOffering'] :: ReservedNodeOffering -> Maybe [RecurringCharge]

-- | Create a value of <a>ReservedNodeOffering</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:reservedNodeOfferingType:ReservedNodeOffering'</a>,
--   <a>reservedNodeOffering_reservedNodeOfferingType</a> -
--   
--   <a>$sel:reservedNodeOfferingId:ReservedNodeOffering'</a>,
--   <a>reservedNodeOffering_reservedNodeOfferingId</a> - The offering
--   identifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:duration:ReservedNodeOffering'</a>,
--   <a>reservedNodeOffering_duration</a> - The duration, in seconds, for
--   which the offering will reserve the node.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currencyCode:ReservedNodeOffering'</a>,
--   <a>reservedNodeOffering_currencyCode</a> - The currency code for the
--   compute nodes offering.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fixedPrice:ReservedNodeOffering'</a>,
--   <a>reservedNodeOffering_fixedPrice</a> - The upfront fixed charge you
--   will pay to purchase the specific reserved node offering.
--   
--   <a>$sel:usagePrice:ReservedNodeOffering'</a>,
--   <a>reservedNodeOffering_usagePrice</a> - The rate you are charged for
--   each hour the cluster that is using the offering is running.
--   
--   <a>$sel:offeringType:ReservedNodeOffering'</a>,
--   <a>reservedNodeOffering_offeringType</a> - The anticipated utilization
--   of the reserved node, as defined in the reserved node offering.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nodeType:ReservedNodeOffering'</a>,
--   <a>reservedNodeOffering_nodeType</a> - The node type offered by the
--   reserved node offering.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recurringCharges:ReservedNodeOffering'</a>,
--   <a>reservedNodeOffering_recurringCharges</a> - The charge to your
--   account regardless of whether you are creating any clusters using the
--   node offering. Recurring charges are only in effect for
--   heavy-utilization reserved nodes.
newReservedNodeOffering :: ReservedNodeOffering

--   reserved node offering.
reservedNodeOffering_fixedPrice :: Lens' ReservedNodeOffering (Maybe Double)

--   offering is running.
reservedNodeOffering_usagePrice :: Lens' ReservedNodeOffering (Maybe Double)

--   reserved node offering.

module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ReservedNode

-- | Describes a reserved node. You can call the
--   DescribeReservedNodeOfferings API to obtain the available reserved
--   node offerings.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReservedNode</a> smart constructor.
data ReservedNode
ReservedNode' :: Maybe ReservedNodeOfferingType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [RecurringCharge] -> ReservedNode
[$sel:reservedNodeOfferingType:ReservedNode'] :: ReservedNode -> Maybe ReservedNodeOfferingType

-- | The unique identifier for the reservation.
[$sel:reservedNodeId:ReservedNode'] :: ReservedNode -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier for the reserved node offering.
[$sel:reservedNodeOfferingId:ReservedNode'] :: ReservedNode -> Maybe Text

-- | The duration of the node reservation in seconds.
[$sel:duration:ReservedNode'] :: ReservedNode -> Maybe Int

-- | The time the reservation started. You purchase a reserved node
--   offering for a duration. This is the start time of that duration.
[$sel:startTime:ReservedNode'] :: ReservedNode -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The currency code for the reserved cluster.
[$sel:currencyCode:ReservedNode'] :: ReservedNode -> Maybe Text

-- | The state of the reserved compute node.
--   
--   Possible Values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>pending-payment-This reserved node has recently been purchased,
--   and the sale has been approved, but payment has not yet been
--   confirmed.</li>
--   <li>active-This reserved node is owned by the caller and is available
--   for use.</li>
--   <li>payment-failed-Payment failed for the purchase attempt.</li>
--   <li>retired-The reserved node is no longer available.</li>
--   <li>exchanging-The owner is exchanging the reserved node for another
--   reserved node.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:state:ReservedNode'] :: ReservedNode -> Maybe Text

-- | The fixed cost Amazon Redshift charges you for this reserved node.
[$sel:fixedPrice:ReservedNode'] :: ReservedNode -> Maybe Double

-- | The number of reserved compute nodes.
[$sel:nodeCount:ReservedNode'] :: ReservedNode -> Maybe Int

-- | The hourly rate Amazon Redshift charges you for this reserved node.
[$sel:usagePrice:ReservedNode'] :: ReservedNode -> Maybe Double

-- | The anticipated utilization of the reserved node, as defined in the
--   reserved node offering.
[$sel:offeringType:ReservedNode'] :: ReservedNode -> Maybe Text

-- | The node type of the reserved node.
[$sel:nodeType:ReservedNode'] :: ReservedNode -> Maybe Text

-- | The recurring charges for the reserved node.
[$sel:recurringCharges:ReservedNode'] :: ReservedNode -> Maybe [RecurringCharge]

-- | Create a value of <a>ReservedNode</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:reservedNodeOfferingType:ReservedNode'</a>,
--   <a>reservedNode_reservedNodeOfferingType</a> -
--   
--   <a>$sel:reservedNodeId:ReservedNode'</a>,
--   <a>reservedNode_reservedNodeId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   reservation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reservedNodeOfferingId:ReservedNode'</a>,
--   <a>reservedNode_reservedNodeOfferingId</a> - The identifier for the
--   reserved node offering.
--   
--   <a>$sel:duration:ReservedNode'</a>, <a>reservedNode_duration</a> - The
--   duration of the node reservation in seconds.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:ReservedNode'</a>, <a>reservedNode_startTime</a> -
--   The time the reservation started. You purchase a reserved node
--   offering for a duration. This is the start time of that duration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currencyCode:ReservedNode'</a>,
--   <a>reservedNode_currencyCode</a> - The currency code for the reserved
--   cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:ReservedNode'</a>, <a>reservedNode_state</a> - The state
--   of the reserved compute node.
--   
--   Possible Values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>pending-payment-This reserved node has recently been purchased,
--   and the sale has been approved, but payment has not yet been
--   confirmed.</li>
--   <li>active-This reserved node is owned by the caller and is available
--   for use.</li>
--   <li>payment-failed-Payment failed for the purchase attempt.</li>
--   <li>retired-The reserved node is no longer available.</li>
--   <li>exchanging-The owner is exchanging the reserved node for another
--   reserved node.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:fixedPrice:ReservedNode'</a>, <a>reservedNode_fixedPrice</a> -
--   The fixed cost Amazon Redshift charges you for this reserved node.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nodeCount:ReservedNode'</a>, <a>reservedNode_nodeCount</a> -
--   The number of reserved compute nodes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:usagePrice:ReservedNode'</a>, <a>reservedNode_usagePrice</a> -
--   The hourly rate Amazon Redshift charges you for this reserved node.
--   
--   <a>$sel:offeringType:ReservedNode'</a>,
--   <a>reservedNode_offeringType</a> - The anticipated utilization of the
--   reserved node, as defined in the reserved node offering.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nodeType:ReservedNode'</a>, <a>reservedNode_nodeType</a> - The
--   node type of the reserved node.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recurringCharges:ReservedNode'</a>,
--   <a>reservedNode_recurringCharges</a> - The recurring charges for the
--   reserved node.
newReservedNode :: ReservedNode

reservedNode_reservedNodeOfferingType :: Lens' ReservedNode (Maybe ReservedNodeOfferingType)

-- | The unique identifier for the reservation.
reservedNode_reservedNodeId :: Lens' ReservedNode (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier for the reserved node offering.
reservedNode_reservedNodeOfferingId :: Lens' ReservedNode (Maybe Text)

-- | The duration of the node reservation in seconds.
reservedNode_duration :: Lens' ReservedNode (Maybe Int)

-- | The time the reservation started. You purchase a reserved node
--   offering for a duration. This is the start time of that duration.
reservedNode_startTime :: Lens' ReservedNode (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The currency code for the reserved cluster.
reservedNode_currencyCode :: Lens' ReservedNode (Maybe Text)

-- | The state of the reserved compute node.
--   
--   Possible Values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>pending-payment-This reserved node has recently been purchased,
--   and the sale has been approved, but payment has not yet been
--   confirmed.</li>
--   <li>active-This reserved node is owned by the caller and is available
--   for use.</li>
--   <li>payment-failed-Payment failed for the purchase attempt.</li>
--   <li>retired-The reserved node is no longer available.</li>
--   <li>exchanging-The owner is exchanging the reserved node for another
--   reserved node.</li>
--   </ul>
reservedNode_state :: Lens' ReservedNode (Maybe Text)

-- | The fixed cost Amazon Redshift charges you for this reserved node.
reservedNode_fixedPrice :: Lens' ReservedNode (Maybe Double)

-- | The number of reserved compute nodes.
reservedNode_nodeCount :: Lens' ReservedNode (Maybe Int)

-- | The hourly rate Amazon Redshift charges you for this reserved node.
reservedNode_usagePrice :: Lens' ReservedNode (Maybe Double)

-- | The anticipated utilization of the reserved node, as defined in the
--   reserved node offering.
reservedNode_offeringType :: Lens' ReservedNode (Maybe Text)

-- | The node type of the reserved node.
reservedNode_nodeType :: Lens' ReservedNode (Maybe Text)

-- | The recurring charges for the reserved node.
reservedNode_recurringCharges :: Lens' ReservedNode (Maybe [RecurringCharge])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ReservedNode.ReservedNode
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ReservedNode.ReservedNode
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ReservedNode.ReservedNode
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ReservedNode.ReservedNode
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ReservedNode.ReservedNode
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ReservedNode.ReservedNode
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ReservedNode.ReservedNode


module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ResizeClusterMessage

-- | Describes a resize cluster operation. For example, a scheduled action
--   to run the <tt>ResizeCluster</tt> API operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResizeClusterMessage</a> smart constructor.
data ResizeClusterMessage
ResizeClusterMessage' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Text -> ResizeClusterMessage

-- | A boolean value indicating whether the resize operation is using the
--   classic resize process. If you don't provide this parameter or set the
--   value to <tt>false</tt>, the resize type is elastic.
[$sel:classic:ResizeClusterMessage'] :: ResizeClusterMessage -> Maybe Bool

-- | The new cluster type for the specified cluster.
[$sel:clusterType:ResizeClusterMessage'] :: ResizeClusterMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The new number of nodes for the cluster. If not specified, the
--   cluster's current number of nodes is used.
[$sel:numberOfNodes:ResizeClusterMessage'] :: ResizeClusterMessage -> Maybe Int

-- | The new node type for the nodes you are adding. If not specified, the
--   cluster's current node type is used.
[$sel:nodeType:ResizeClusterMessage'] :: ResizeClusterMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the cluster to resize.
[$sel:clusterIdentifier:ResizeClusterMessage'] :: ResizeClusterMessage -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ResizeClusterMessage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:classic:ResizeClusterMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeClusterMessage_classic</a> - A boolean value indicating
--   whether the resize operation is using the classic resize process. If
--   you don't provide this parameter or set the value to <tt>false</tt>,
--   the resize type is elastic.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterType:ResizeClusterMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeClusterMessage_clusterType</a> - The new cluster type for the
--   specified cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfNodes:ResizeClusterMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeClusterMessage_numberOfNodes</a> - The new number of nodes
--   for the cluster. If not specified, the cluster's current number of
--   nodes is used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nodeType:ResizeClusterMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeClusterMessage_nodeType</a> - The new node type for the nodes
--   you are adding. If not specified, the cluster's current node type is
--   used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterIdentifier:ResizeClusterMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeClusterMessage_clusterIdentifier</a> - The unique identifier
--   for the cluster to resize.
newResizeClusterMessage :: Text -> ResizeClusterMessage

-- | A boolean value indicating whether the resize operation is using the
--   classic resize process. If you don't provide this parameter or set the
--   value to <tt>false</tt>, the resize type is elastic.
resizeClusterMessage_classic :: Lens' ResizeClusterMessage (Maybe Bool)

-- | The new cluster type for the specified cluster.
resizeClusterMessage_clusterType :: Lens' ResizeClusterMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The new number of nodes for the cluster. If not specified, the
--   cluster's current number of nodes is used.
resizeClusterMessage_numberOfNodes :: Lens' ResizeClusterMessage (Maybe Int)

-- | The new node type for the nodes you are adding. If not specified, the
--   cluster's current node type is used.
resizeClusterMessage_nodeType :: Lens' ResizeClusterMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the cluster to resize.
resizeClusterMessage_clusterIdentifier :: Lens' ResizeClusterMessage Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ResizeClusterMessage.ResizeClusterMessage
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ResizeClusterMessage.ResizeClusterMessage
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ResizeClusterMessage.ResizeClusterMessage
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ResizeClusterMessage.ResizeClusterMessage
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ResizeClusterMessage.ResizeClusterMessage
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ResizeClusterMessage.ResizeClusterMessage
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ResizeClusterMessage.ResizeClusterMessage
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ResizeClusterMessage.ResizeClusterMessage


module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ResizeInfo

-- | Describes a resize operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResizeInfo</a> smart constructor.
data ResizeInfo
ResizeInfo' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> ResizeInfo

-- | A boolean value indicating if the resize operation can be cancelled.
[$sel:allowCancelResize:ResizeInfo'] :: ResizeInfo -> Maybe Bool

-- | Returns the value <tt>ClassicResize</tt>.
[$sel:resizeType:ResizeInfo'] :: ResizeInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ResizeInfo</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowCancelResize:ResizeInfo'</a>,
--   <a>resizeInfo_allowCancelResize</a> - A boolean value indicating if
--   the resize operation can be cancelled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resizeType:ResizeInfo'</a>, <a>resizeInfo_resizeType</a> -
--   Returns the value <tt>ClassicResize</tt>.
newResizeInfo :: ResizeInfo

-- | A boolean value indicating if the resize operation can be cancelled.
resizeInfo_allowCancelResize :: Lens' ResizeInfo (Maybe Bool)

-- | Returns the value <tt>ClassicResize</tt>.
resizeInfo_resizeType :: Lens' ResizeInfo (Maybe Text)
