instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ResizeInfo.ResizeInfo


module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ResizeProgressMessage

-- | Describes the result of a cluster resize operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResizeProgressMessage</a> smart constructor.
data ResizeProgressMessage
ResizeProgressMessage' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Double -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> ResizeProgressMessage

-- | The status of the resize operation.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>NONE</tt> | <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> | <tt>FAILED</tt> |
--   <tt>SUCCEEDED</tt> | <tt>CANCELLING</tt>
[$sel:status:ResizeProgressMessage'] :: ResizeProgressMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The estimated time remaining, in seconds, until the resize operation
--   is complete. This value is calculated based on the average resize rate
--   and the estimated amount of data remaining to be processed. Once the
--   resize operation is complete, this value will be 0.
[$sel:estimatedTimeToCompletionInSeconds:ResizeProgressMessage'] :: ResizeProgressMessage -> Maybe Integer

-- | The names of tables that have not been yet imported.
--   
--   Valid Values: List of table names
[$sel:importTablesNotStarted:ResizeProgressMessage'] :: ResizeProgressMessage -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The node type that the cluster will have after the resize operation is
--   complete.
[$sel:targetNodeType:ResizeProgressMessage'] :: ResizeProgressMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | An optional string to provide additional details about the resize
--   action.
[$sel:message:ResizeProgressMessage'] :: ResizeProgressMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The cluster type after the resize operation is complete.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>multi-node</tt> | <tt>single-node</tt>
[$sel:targetClusterType:ResizeProgressMessage'] :: ResizeProgressMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The average rate of the resize operation over the last few minutes,
--   measured in megabytes per second. After the resize operation
--   completes, this value shows the average rate of the entire resize
--   operation.
[$sel:avgResizeRateInMegaBytesPerSecond:ResizeProgressMessage'] :: ResizeProgressMessage -> Maybe Double

-- | The type of encryption for the cluster after the resize is complete.
--   
--   Possible values are <tt>KMS</tt> and <tt>None</tt>.
[$sel:targetEncryptionType:ResizeProgressMessage'] :: ResizeProgressMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The amount of seconds that have elapsed since the resize operation
--   began. After the resize operation completes, this value shows the
--   total actual time, in seconds, for the resize operation.
[$sel:elapsedTimeInSeconds:ResizeProgressMessage'] :: ResizeProgressMessage -> Maybe Integer

-- | The estimated total amount of data, in megabytes, on the cluster
--   before the resize operation began.
[$sel:totalResizeDataInMegaBytes:ResizeProgressMessage'] :: ResizeProgressMessage -> Maybe Integer

-- | The number of nodes that the cluster will have after the resize
--   operation is complete.
[$sel:targetNumberOfNodes:ResizeProgressMessage'] :: ResizeProgressMessage -> Maybe Int

-- | The percent of data transferred from source cluster to target cluster.
[$sel:dataTransferProgressPercent:ResizeProgressMessage'] :: ResizeProgressMessage -> Maybe Double

-- | The names of tables that have been completely imported .
--   
--   Valid Values: List of table names.
[$sel:importTablesCompleted:ResizeProgressMessage'] :: ResizeProgressMessage -> Maybe [Text]

-- | While the resize operation is in progress, this value shows the
--   current amount of data, in megabytes, that has been processed so far.
--   When the resize operation is complete, this value shows the total
--   amount of data, in megabytes, on the cluster, which may be more or
--   less than TotalResizeDataInMegaBytes (the estimated total amount of
--   data before resize).
[$sel:progressInMegaBytes:ResizeProgressMessage'] :: ResizeProgressMessage -> Maybe Integer

-- | The names of tables that are being currently imported.
--   
--   Valid Values: List of table names.
[$sel:importTablesInProgress:ResizeProgressMessage'] :: ResizeProgressMessage -> Maybe [Text]

-- | An enum with possible values of <tt>ClassicResize</tt> and
--   <tt>ElasticResize</tt>. These values describe the type of resize
--   operation being performed.
[$sel:resizeType:ResizeProgressMessage'] :: ResizeProgressMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ResizeProgressMessage</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_status</a> - The status of the resize
--   operation.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>NONE</tt> | <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> | <tt>FAILED</tt> |
--   <tt>SUCCEEDED</tt> | <tt>CANCELLING</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:estimatedTimeToCompletionInSeconds:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_estimatedTimeToCompletionInSeconds</a> - The
--   estimated time remaining, in seconds, until the resize operation is
--   complete. This value is calculated based on the average resize rate
--   and the estimated amount of data remaining to be processed. Once the
--   resize operation is complete, this value will be 0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:importTablesNotStarted:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_importTablesNotStarted</a> - The names of
--   tables that have not been yet imported.
--   
--   Valid Values: List of table names
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetNodeType:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_targetNodeType</a> - The node type that the
--   cluster will have after the resize operation is complete.
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_message</a> - An optional string to provide
--   additional details about the resize action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetClusterType:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_targetClusterType</a> - The cluster type
--   after the resize operation is complete.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>multi-node</tt> | <tt>single-node</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:avgResizeRateInMegaBytesPerSecond:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_avgResizeRateInMegaBytesPerSecond</a> - The
--   average rate of the resize operation over the last few minutes,
--   measured in megabytes per second. After the resize operation
--   completes, this value shows the average rate of the entire resize
--   operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetEncryptionType:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_targetEncryptionType</a> - The type of
--   encryption for the cluster after the resize is complete.
--   
--   Possible values are <tt>KMS</tt> and <tt>None</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:elapsedTimeInSeconds:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_elapsedTimeInSeconds</a> - The amount of
--   seconds that have elapsed since the resize operation began. After the
--   resize operation completes, this value shows the total actual time, in
--   seconds, for the resize operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalResizeDataInMegaBytes:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_totalResizeDataInMegaBytes</a> - The
--   estimated total amount of data, in megabytes, on the cluster before
--   the resize operation began.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetNumberOfNodes:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_targetNumberOfNodes</a> - The number of nodes
--   that the cluster will have after the resize operation is complete.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataTransferProgressPercent:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_dataTransferProgressPercent</a> - The percent
--   of data transferred from source cluster to target cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:importTablesCompleted:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_importTablesCompleted</a> - The names of
--   tables that have been completely imported .
--   
--   Valid Values: List of table names.
--   
--   <a>$sel:progressInMegaBytes:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_progressInMegaBytes</a> - While the resize
--   operation is in progress, this value shows the current amount of data,
--   in megabytes, that has been processed so far. When the resize
--   operation is complete, this value shows the total amount of data, in
--   megabytes, on the cluster, which may be more or less than
--   TotalResizeDataInMegaBytes (the estimated total amount of data before
--   resize).
--   
--   <a>$sel:importTablesInProgress:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_importTablesInProgress</a> - The names of
--   tables that are being currently imported.
--   
--   Valid Values: List of table names.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resizeType:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_resizeType</a> - An enum with possible values
--   of <tt>ClassicResize</tt> and <tt>ElasticResize</tt>. These values
--   describe the type of resize operation being performed.
newResizeProgressMessage :: ResizeProgressMessage

-- | The status of the resize operation.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>NONE</tt> | <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> | <tt>FAILED</tt> |
--   <tt>SUCCEEDED</tt> | <tt>CANCELLING</tt>
resizeProgressMessage_status :: Lens' ResizeProgressMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The estimated time remaining, in seconds, until the resize operation
--   is complete. This value is calculated based on the average resize rate
--   and the estimated amount of data remaining to be processed. Once the
--   resize operation is complete, this value will be 0.
resizeProgressMessage_estimatedTimeToCompletionInSeconds :: Lens' ResizeProgressMessage (Maybe Integer)

-- | The names of tables that have not been yet imported.
--   
--   Valid Values: List of table names
resizeProgressMessage_importTablesNotStarted :: Lens' ResizeProgressMessage (Maybe [Text])

-- | The node type that the cluster will have after the resize operation is
--   complete.
resizeProgressMessage_targetNodeType :: Lens' ResizeProgressMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | An optional string to provide additional details about the resize
--   action.
resizeProgressMessage_message :: Lens' ResizeProgressMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The cluster type after the resize operation is complete.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>multi-node</tt> | <tt>single-node</tt>
resizeProgressMessage_targetClusterType :: Lens' ResizeProgressMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The average rate of the resize operation over the last few minutes,
--   measured in megabytes per second. After the resize operation
--   completes, this value shows the average rate of the entire resize
--   operation.
resizeProgressMessage_avgResizeRateInMegaBytesPerSecond :: Lens' ResizeProgressMessage (Maybe Double)

-- | The type of encryption for the cluster after the resize is complete.
--   
--   Possible values are <tt>KMS</tt> and <tt>None</tt>.
resizeProgressMessage_targetEncryptionType :: Lens' ResizeProgressMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The amount of seconds that have elapsed since the resize operation
--   began. After the resize operation completes, this value shows the
--   total actual time, in seconds, for the resize operation.
resizeProgressMessage_elapsedTimeInSeconds :: Lens' ResizeProgressMessage (Maybe Integer)

-- | The estimated total amount of data, in megabytes, on the cluster
--   before the resize operation began.
resizeProgressMessage_totalResizeDataInMegaBytes :: Lens' ResizeProgressMessage (Maybe Integer)

-- | The number of nodes that the cluster will have after the resize
--   operation is complete.
resizeProgressMessage_targetNumberOfNodes :: Lens' ResizeProgressMessage (Maybe Int)

-- | The percent of data transferred from source cluster to target cluster.
resizeProgressMessage_dataTransferProgressPercent :: Lens' ResizeProgressMessage (Maybe Double)

-- | The names of tables that have been completely imported .
--   
--   Valid Values: List of table names.
resizeProgressMessage_importTablesCompleted :: Lens' ResizeProgressMessage (Maybe [Text])

-- | While the resize operation is in progress, this value shows the
--   current amount of data, in megabytes, that has been processed so far.
--   When the resize operation is complete, this value shows the total
--   amount of data, in megabytes, on the cluster, which may be more or
--   less than TotalResizeDataInMegaBytes (the estimated total amount of
--   data before resize).
resizeProgressMessage_progressInMegaBytes :: Lens' ResizeProgressMessage (Maybe Integer)

-- | The names of tables that are being currently imported.
--   
--   Valid Values: List of table names.

resizeProgressMessage_resizeType :: Lens' ResizeProgressMessage (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.RestoreStatus

-- | Describes the status of a cluster restore action. Returns null if the
--   cluster was not created by restoring a snapshot.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRestoreStatus</a> smart constructor.
data RestoreStatus
RestoreStatus' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> RestoreStatus

-- | The status of the restore action. Returns starting, restoring,
--   completed, or failed.
[$sel:status:RestoreStatus'] :: RestoreStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The estimate of the time remaining before the restore will complete.
--   Returns 0 for a completed restore. This field is only updated when you
--   restore to DC2 and DS2 node types.
[$sel:estimatedTimeToCompletionInSeconds:RestoreStatus'] :: RestoreStatus -> Maybe Integer

-- | The size of the set of snapshot data used to restore the cluster. This
--   field is only updated when you restore to DC2 and DS2 node types.
[$sel:snapshotSizeInMegaBytes:RestoreStatus'] :: RestoreStatus -> Maybe Integer

-- | The number of megabytes per second being transferred from the backup
--   storage. Returns the average rate for a completed backup. This field
--   is only updated when you restore to DC2 and DS2 node types.
[$sel:currentRestoreRateInMegaBytesPerSecond:RestoreStatus'] :: RestoreStatus -> Maybe Double

-- | The amount of time an in-progress restore has been running, or the
--   amount of time it took a completed restore to finish. This field is
--   only updated when you restore to DC2 and DS2 node types.
[$sel:elapsedTimeInSeconds:RestoreStatus'] :: RestoreStatus -> Maybe Integer

-- | The number of megabytes that have been transferred from snapshot
--   storage. This field is only updated when you restore to DC2 and DS2
--   node types.
[$sel:progressInMegaBytes:RestoreStatus'] :: RestoreStatus -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>RestoreStatus</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:RestoreStatus'</a>, <a>restoreStatus_status</a> - The
--   status of the restore action. Returns starting, restoring, completed,
--   or failed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:estimatedTimeToCompletionInSeconds:RestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>restoreStatus_estimatedTimeToCompletionInSeconds</a> - The estimate
--   of the time remaining before the restore will complete. Returns 0 for
--   a completed restore. This field is only updated when you restore to
--   DC2 and DS2 node types.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotSizeInMegaBytes:RestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>restoreStatus_snapshotSizeInMegaBytes</a> - The size of the set of
--   snapshot data used to restore the cluster. This field is only updated
--   when you restore to DC2 and DS2 node types.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentRestoreRateInMegaBytesPerSecond:RestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>restoreStatus_currentRestoreRateInMegaBytesPerSecond</a> - The
--   number of megabytes per second being transferred from the backup
--   storage. Returns the average rate for a completed backup. This field
--   is only updated when you restore to DC2 and DS2 node types.
--   
--   <a>$sel:elapsedTimeInSeconds:RestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>restoreStatus_elapsedTimeInSeconds</a> - The amount of time an
--   in-progress restore has been running, or the amount of time it took a
--   completed restore to finish. This field is only updated when you
--   restore to DC2 and DS2 node types.
--   
--   <a>$sel:progressInMegaBytes:RestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>restoreStatus_progressInMegaBytes</a> - The number of megabytes
--   that have been transferred from snapshot storage. This field is only
--   updated when you restore to DC2 and DS2 node types.
newRestoreStatus :: RestoreStatus

-- | The status of the restore action. Returns starting, restoring,
--   completed, or failed.
restoreStatus_status :: Lens' RestoreStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | The estimate of the time remaining before the restore will complete.
--   Returns 0 for a completed restore. This field is only updated when you
--   restore to DC2 and DS2 node types.
restoreStatus_estimatedTimeToCompletionInSeconds :: Lens' RestoreStatus (Maybe Integer)

-- | The size of the set of snapshot data used to restore the cluster. This
--   field is only updated when you restore to DC2 and DS2 node types.
restoreStatus_snapshotSizeInMegaBytes :: Lens' RestoreStatus (Maybe Integer)

-- | The number of megabytes per second being transferred from the backup
--   storage. Returns the average rate for a completed backup. This field
--   is only updated when you restore to DC2 and DS2 node types.
restoreStatus_currentRestoreRateInMegaBytesPerSecond :: Lens' RestoreStatus (Maybe Double)

-- | The amount of time an in-progress restore has been running, or the
--   amount of time it took a completed restore to finish. This field is
--   only updated when you restore to DC2 and DS2 node types.
restoreStatus_elapsedTimeInSeconds :: Lens' RestoreStatus (Maybe Integer)

-- | The number of megabytes that have been transferred from snapshot
--   storage. This field is only updated when you restore to DC2 and DS2
--   node types.
restoreStatus_progressInMegaBytes :: Lens' RestoreStatus (Maybe Integer)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.RestoreStatus.RestoreStatus
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.RestoreStatus.RestoreStatus
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.RestoreStatus.RestoreStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.RestoreStatus.RestoreStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.RestoreStatus.RestoreStatus
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.RestoreStatus.RestoreStatus
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.RestoreStatus.RestoreStatus


module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ResumeClusterMessage

-- | Describes a resume cluster operation. For example, a scheduled action
--   to run the <tt>ResumeCluster</tt> API operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResumeClusterMessage</a> smart constructor.
data ResumeClusterMessage
ResumeClusterMessage' :: Text -> ResumeClusterMessage

-- | The identifier of the cluster to be resumed.
[$sel:clusterIdentifier:ResumeClusterMessage'] :: ResumeClusterMessage -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ResumeClusterMessage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterIdentifier:ResumeClusterMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resumeClusterMessage_clusterIdentifier</a> - The identifier of the
--   cluster to be resumed.
newResumeClusterMessage :: Text -> ResumeClusterMessage

-- | The identifier of the cluster to be resumed.
resumeClusterMessage_clusterIdentifier :: Lens' ResumeClusterMessage Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ResumeClusterMessage.ResumeClusterMessage
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ResumeClusterMessage.ResumeClusterMessage
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ResumeClusterMessage.ResumeClusterMessage
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ResumeClusterMessage.ResumeClusterMessage
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ResumeClusterMessage.ResumeClusterMessage
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ResumeClusterMessage.ResumeClusterMessage
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ResumeClusterMessage.ResumeClusterMessage
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ResumeClusterMessage.ResumeClusterMessage


module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.RevisionTarget

-- | Describes a <tt>RevisionTarget</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRevisionTarget</a> smart constructor.
data RevisionTarget
RevisionTarget' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> RevisionTarget

-- | A string that describes the changes and features that will be applied
--   to the cluster when it is updated to the corresponding
--   ClusterDbRevision.
[$sel:description:RevisionTarget'] :: RevisionTarget -> Maybe Text

-- | A unique string that identifies the version to update the cluster to.
--   You can use this value in ModifyClusterDbRevision.
[$sel:databaseRevision:RevisionTarget'] :: RevisionTarget -> Maybe Text

-- | The date on which the database revision was released.
[$sel:databaseRevisionReleaseDate:RevisionTarget'] :: RevisionTarget -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Create a value of <a>RevisionTarget</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:RevisionTarget'</a>,
--   <a>revisionTarget_description</a> - A string that describes the
--   changes and features that will be applied to the cluster when it is
--   updated to the corresponding ClusterDbRevision.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseRevision:RevisionTarget'</a>,
--   <a>revisionTarget_databaseRevision</a> - A unique string that
--   identifies the version to update the cluster to. You can use this
--   value in ModifyClusterDbRevision.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseRevisionReleaseDate:RevisionTarget'</a>,
--   <a>revisionTarget_databaseRevisionReleaseDate</a> - The date on which
--   the database revision was released.
newRevisionTarget :: RevisionTarget

-- | A string that describes the changes and features that will be applied
--   to the cluster when it is updated to the corresponding
--   ClusterDbRevision.
revisionTarget_description :: Lens' RevisionTarget (Maybe Text)

-- | A unique string that identifies the version to update the cluster to.
--   You can use this value in ModifyClusterDbRevision.
revisionTarget_databaseRevision :: Lens' RevisionTarget (Maybe Text)

-- | The date on which the database revision was released.
revisionTarget_databaseRevisionReleaseDate :: Lens' RevisionTarget (Maybe UTCTime)

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.RevisionTarget.RevisionTarget

data ClusterDbRevision

--   the cluster.

module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ScheduledActionFilter

-- | A set of elements to filter the returned scheduled actions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScheduledActionFilter</a> smart constructor.
data ScheduledActionFilter
ScheduledActionFilter' :: ScheduledActionFilterName -> [Text] -> ScheduledActionFilter

[$sel:name:ScheduledActionFilter'] :: ScheduledActionFilter -> ScheduledActionFilterName

-- | List of values. Compare if the value (of type defined by
--   <tt>Name</tt>) equals an item in the list of scheduled actions.
[$sel:values:ScheduledActionFilter'] :: ScheduledActionFilter -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>ScheduledActionFilter</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--

--   
--   <a>$sel:values:ScheduledActionFilter'</a>,
--   <a>scheduledActionFilter_values</a> - List of values. Compare if the
--   value (of type defined by <tt>Name</tt>) equals an item in the list of
--   scheduled actions.
newScheduledActionFilter :: ScheduledActionFilterName -> ScheduledActionFilter

--   <tt>Name</tt>) equals an item in the list of scheduled actions.

module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ScheduledActionType

-- | The action type that specifies an Amazon Redshift API operation that
--   is supported by the Amazon Redshift scheduler.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScheduledActionType</a> smart constructor.
data ScheduledActionType
ScheduledActionType' :: Maybe ResumeClusterMessage -> Maybe PauseClusterMessage -> Maybe ResizeClusterMessage -> ScheduledActionType

-- | An action that runs a <tt>ResumeCluster</tt> API operation.
[$sel:resumeCluster:ScheduledActionType'] :: ScheduledActionType -> Maybe ResumeClusterMessage

-- | An action that runs a <tt>PauseCluster</tt> API operation.
[$sel:pauseCluster:ScheduledActionType'] :: ScheduledActionType -> Maybe PauseClusterMessage

-- | An action that runs a <tt>ResizeCluster</tt> API operation.
[$sel:resizeCluster:ScheduledActionType'] :: ScheduledActionType -> Maybe ResizeClusterMessage

-- | Create a value of <a>ScheduledActionType</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resumeCluster:ScheduledActionType'</a>,
--   <a>scheduledActionType_resumeCluster</a> - An action that runs a
--   <tt>ResumeCluster</tt> API operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pauseCluster:ScheduledActionType'</a>,
--   <a>scheduledActionType_pauseCluster</a> - An action that runs a
--   <tt>PauseCluster</tt> API operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resizeCluster:ScheduledActionType'</a>,
--   <a>scheduledActionType_resizeCluster</a> - An action that runs a
--   <tt>ResizeCluster</tt> API operation.
newScheduledActionType :: ScheduledActionType

-- | An action that runs a <tt>ResumeCluster</tt> API operation.
scheduledActionType_resumeCluster :: Lens' ScheduledActionType (Maybe ResumeClusterMessage)

-- | An action that runs a <tt>PauseCluster</tt> API operation.
scheduledActionType_pauseCluster :: Lens' ScheduledActionType (Maybe PauseClusterMessage)

-- | An action that runs a <tt>ResizeCluster</tt> API operation.
scheduledActionType_resizeCluster :: Lens' ScheduledActionType (Maybe ResizeClusterMessage)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ScheduledActionType.ScheduledActionType
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ScheduledActionType.ScheduledActionType
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ScheduledActionType.ScheduledActionType
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ScheduledActionType.ScheduledActionType
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ScheduledActionType.ScheduledActionType

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ScheduledActionType.ScheduledActionType


module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ScheduledAction

-- | Describes a scheduled action. You can use a scheduled action to
--   trigger some Amazon Redshift API operations on a schedule. For
--   information about which API operations can be scheduled, see
--   ScheduledActionType.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScheduledAction</a> smart constructor.
data ScheduledAction
ScheduledAction' :: Maybe ScheduledActionType -> Maybe [ISO8601] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe ScheduledActionState -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ScheduledAction

-- | A JSON format string of the Amazon Redshift API operation with input
--   parameters.
--   
--   
--   "<tt>{\"ResizeCluster\":{\"NodeType\":\"ds2.8xlarge\",\"ClusterIdentifier\":\"my-test-cluster\",\"NumberOfNodes\":3}}</tt>".
[$sel:targetAction:ScheduledAction'] :: ScheduledAction -> Maybe ScheduledActionType

-- | List of times when the scheduled action will run.
[$sel:nextInvocations:ScheduledAction'] :: ScheduledAction -> Maybe [ISO8601]

-- | The IAM role to assume to run the scheduled action. This IAM role must
--   have permission to run the Amazon Redshift API operation in the
--   scheduled action. This IAM role must allow the Amazon Redshift
--   scheduler (Principal scheduler.redshift.amazonaws.com) to assume
--   permissions on your behalf. For more information about the IAM role to
--   use with the Amazon Redshift scheduler, see <a>Using Identity-Based
--   Policies for Amazon Redshift</a> in the <i>Amazon Redshift Cluster
--   Management Guide</i>.
[$sel:iamRole:ScheduledAction'] :: ScheduledAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The description of the scheduled action.
[$sel:scheduledActionDescription:ScheduledAction'] :: ScheduledAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The start time in UTC when the schedule is active. Before this time,
--   the scheduled action does not trigger.
[$sel:startTime:ScheduledAction'] :: ScheduledAction -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The end time in UTC when the schedule is no longer active. After this
--   time, the scheduled action does not trigger.
[$sel:endTime:ScheduledAction'] :: ScheduledAction -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The state of the scheduled action. For example, <tt>DISABLED</tt>.
[$sel:state:ScheduledAction'] :: ScheduledAction -> Maybe ScheduledActionState

-- | The name of the scheduled action.
[$sel:scheduledActionName:ScheduledAction'] :: ScheduledAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The schedule for a one-time (at format) or recurring (cron format)
--   scheduled action. Schedule invocations must be separated by at least
--   one hour.
--   
--   Format of at expressions is "<tt>at(yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss)</tt>". For
--   example, "<tt>at(2016-03-04T17:27:00)</tt>".
--   
--   Format of cron expressions is "<tt>cron(Minutes Hours Day-of-month
--   Month Day-of-week Year)</tt>". For example, "<tt>cron(0 10 ? * MON
--   *)</tt>". For more information, see <a>Cron Expressions</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon CloudWatch Events User Guide</i>.
[$sel:schedule:ScheduledAction'] :: ScheduledAction -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ScheduledAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetAction:ScheduledAction'</a>,
--   <a>scheduledAction_targetAction</a> - A JSON format string of the
--   Amazon Redshift API operation with input parameters.
--   
--   
--   "<tt>{\"ResizeCluster\":{\"NodeType\":\"ds2.8xlarge\",\"ClusterIdentifier\":\"my-test-cluster\",\"NumberOfNodes\":3}}</tt>".
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextInvocations:ScheduledAction'</a>,
--   <a>scheduledAction_nextInvocations</a> - List of times when the
--   scheduled action will run.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamRole:ScheduledAction'</a>, <a>scheduledAction_iamRole</a> -
--   The IAM role to assume to run the scheduled action. This IAM role must
--   have permission to run the Amazon Redshift API operation in the
--   scheduled action. This IAM role must allow the Amazon Redshift
--   scheduler (Principal scheduler.redshift.amazonaws.com) to assume
--   permissions on your behalf. For more information about the IAM role to
--   use with the Amazon Redshift scheduler, see <a>Using Identity-Based
--   Policies for Amazon Redshift</a> in the <i>Amazon Redshift Cluster
--   Management Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduledActionDescription:ScheduledAction'</a>,
--   <a>scheduledAction_scheduledActionDescription</a> - The description of
--   the scheduled action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:ScheduledAction'</a>,
--   <a>scheduledAction_startTime</a> - The start time in UTC when the
--   schedule is active. Before this time, the scheduled action does not
--   trigger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:ScheduledAction'</a>, <a>scheduledAction_endTime</a> -
--   The end time in UTC when the schedule is no longer active. After this
--   time, the scheduled action does not trigger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:ScheduledAction'</a>, <a>scheduledAction_state</a> - The
--   state of the scheduled action. For example, <tt>DISABLED</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduledActionName:ScheduledAction'</a>,
--   <a>scheduledAction_scheduledActionName</a> - The name of the scheduled
--   action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:schedule:ScheduledAction'</a>, <a>scheduledAction_schedule</a>
--   - The schedule for a one-time (at format) or recurring (cron format)
--   scheduled action. Schedule invocations must be separated by at least
--   one hour.
--   
--   Format of at expressions is "<tt>at(yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss)</tt>". For
--   example, "<tt>at(2016-03-04T17:27:00)</tt>".
--   
--   Format of cron expressions is "<tt>cron(Minutes Hours Day-of-month
--   Month Day-of-week Year)</tt>". For example, "<tt>cron(0 10 ? * MON
--   *)</tt>". For more information, see <a>Cron Expressions</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon CloudWatch Events User Guide</i>.
newScheduledAction :: ScheduledAction

-- | A JSON format string of the Amazon Redshift API operation with input
--   parameters.
--   
--   
--   "<tt>{\"ResizeCluster\":{\"NodeType\":\"ds2.8xlarge\",\"ClusterIdentifier\":\"my-test-cluster\",\"NumberOfNodes\":3}}</tt>".
scheduledAction_targetAction :: Lens' ScheduledAction (Maybe ScheduledActionType)

-- | List of times when the scheduled action will run.
scheduledAction_nextInvocations :: Lens' ScheduledAction (Maybe [UTCTime])

-- | The IAM role to assume to run the scheduled action. This IAM role must
--   have permission to run the Amazon Redshift API operation in the
--   scheduled action. This IAM role must allow the Amazon Redshift
--   scheduler (Principal scheduler.redshift.amazonaws.com) to assume
--   permissions on your behalf. For more information about the IAM role to
--   use with the Amazon Redshift scheduler, see <a>Using Identity-Based
--   Policies for Amazon Redshift</a> in the <i>Amazon Redshift Cluster
--   Management Guide</i>.
scheduledAction_iamRole :: Lens' ScheduledAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the scheduled action.
scheduledAction_scheduledActionDescription :: Lens' ScheduledAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The start time in UTC when the schedule is active. Before this time,
--   the scheduled action does not trigger.
scheduledAction_startTime :: Lens' ScheduledAction (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The end time in UTC when the schedule is no longer active. After this
--   time, the scheduled action does not trigger.
scheduledAction_endTime :: Lens' ScheduledAction (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The state of the scheduled action. For example, <tt>DISABLED</tt>.
scheduledAction_state :: Lens' ScheduledAction (Maybe ScheduledActionState)

-- | The name of the scheduled action.
scheduledAction_scheduledActionName :: Lens' ScheduledAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The schedule for a one-time (at format) or recurring (cron format)
--   scheduled action. Schedule invocations must be separated by at least
--   one hour.
--   
--   Format of at expressions is "<tt>at(yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss)</tt>". For
--   example, "<tt>at(2016-03-04T17:27:00)</tt>".
--   
--   Format of cron expressions is "<tt>cron(Minutes Hours Day-of-month
--   Month Day-of-week Year)</tt>". For example, "<tt>cron(0 10 ? * MON
--   *)</tt>". For more information, see <a>Cron Expressions</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon CloudWatch Events User Guide</i>.
scheduledAction_schedule :: Lens' ScheduledAction (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ScheduledAction.ScheduledAction
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ScheduledAction.ScheduledAction
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ScheduledAction.ScheduledAction
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ScheduledAction.ScheduledAction
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ScheduledAction.ScheduledAction
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ScheduledAction.ScheduledAction
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ScheduledAction.ScheduledAction

module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.SnapshotErrorMessage

-- | Describes the errors returned by a snapshot.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSnapshotErrorMessage</a> smart constructor.
data SnapshotErrorMessage
SnapshotErrorMessage' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> SnapshotErrorMessage

-- | A unique identifier for the snapshot returning the error.
[$sel:snapshotIdentifier:SnapshotErrorMessage'] :: SnapshotErrorMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The failure code for the error.
[$sel:failureCode:SnapshotErrorMessage'] :: SnapshotErrorMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | A unique identifier for the cluster.
[$sel:snapshotClusterIdentifier:SnapshotErrorMessage'] :: SnapshotErrorMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The text message describing the error.
[$sel:failureReason:SnapshotErrorMessage'] :: SnapshotErrorMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SnapshotErrorMessage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotIdentifier:SnapshotErrorMessage'</a>,
--   <a>snapshotErrorMessage_snapshotIdentifier</a> - A unique identifier
--   for the snapshot returning the error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureCode:SnapshotErrorMessage'</a>,
--   <a>snapshotErrorMessage_failureCode</a> - The failure code for the
--   error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotClusterIdentifier:SnapshotErrorMessage'</a>,
--   <a>snapshotErrorMessage_snapshotClusterIdentifier</a> - A unique
--   identifier for the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureReason:SnapshotErrorMessage'</a>,
--   <a>snapshotErrorMessage_failureReason</a> - The text message
--   describing the error.
newSnapshotErrorMessage :: SnapshotErrorMessage

-- | A unique identifier for the snapshot returning the error.
snapshotErrorMessage_snapshotIdentifier :: Lens' SnapshotErrorMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The failure code for the error.
snapshotErrorMessage_failureCode :: Lens' SnapshotErrorMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | A unique identifier for the cluster.
snapshotErrorMessage_snapshotClusterIdentifier :: Lens' SnapshotErrorMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The text message describing the error.
snapshotErrorMessage_failureReason :: Lens' SnapshotErrorMessage (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.SnapshotErrorMessage.SnapshotErrorMessage
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.SnapshotErrorMessage.SnapshotErrorMessage

module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.Event

-- | Describes an event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEvent</a> smart constructor.
data Event
Event' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SourceType -> Event

-- | The identifier of the event.
[$sel:eventId:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe Text

-- | The severity of the event.
--   
--   Values: ERROR, INFO
[$sel:severity:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe Text

-- | The text of this event.
[$sel:message:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of the event categories.
--   
--   Values: Configuration, Management, Monitoring, Security, Pending
[$sel:eventCategories:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The date and time of the event.
[$sel:date:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The identifier for the source of the event.
[$sel:sourceIdentifier:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe Text

-- | The source type for this event.
[$sel:sourceType:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe SourceType

-- | Create a value of <a>Event</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventId:Event'</a>, <a>event_eventId</a> - The identifier of
--   the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:severity:Event'</a>, <a>event_severity</a> - The severity of
--   the event.
--   
--   Values: ERROR, INFO
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:Event'</a>, <a>event_message</a> - The text of this
--   event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventCategories:Event'</a>, <a>event_eventCategories</a> - A
--   list of the event categories.
--   
--   Values: Configuration, Management, Monitoring, Security, Pending
--   
--   <a>$sel:date:Event'</a>, <a>event_date</a> - The date and time of the
--   event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceIdentifier:Event'</a>, <a>event_sourceIdentifier</a> -
--   The identifier for the source of the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceType:Event'</a>, <a>event_sourceType</a> - The source
--   type for this event.
newEvent :: Event

-- | The identifier of the event.
event_eventId :: Lens' Event (Maybe Text)

-- | The severity of the event.
--   
--   Values: ERROR, INFO
event_severity :: Lens' Event (Maybe Text)

-- | The text of this event.
event_message :: Lens' Event (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of the event categories.
--   
--   Values: Configuration, Management, Monitoring, Security, Pending
event_eventCategories :: Lens' Event (Maybe [Text])

-- | The date and time of the event.
event_date :: Lens' Event (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The identifier for the source of the event.
event_sourceIdentifier :: Lens' Event (Maybe Text)

-- | The source type for this event.
event_sourceType :: Lens' Event (Maybe SourceType)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.Event.Event
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.Event.Event
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.Event.Event
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.Event.Event
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.Event.Event
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.Event.Event
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.Event.Event

module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.OrderableClusterOption

-- | Describes an orderable cluster option.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOrderableClusterOption</a> smart constructor.
data OrderableClusterOption
OrderableClusterOption' :: Maybe [AvailabilityZone] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> OrderableClusterOption

module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.TableRestoreStatus

-- | Describes the status of a RestoreTableFromClusterSnapshot operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTableRestoreStatus</a> smart constructor.
data TableRestoreStatus
TableRestoreStatus' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TableRestoreStatusType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> TableRestoreStatus

-- | The name of the schema to restore the table to.
[$sel:targetSchemaName:TableRestoreStatus'] :: TableRestoreStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the snapshot that the table is being restored from.
[$sel:snapshotIdentifier:TableRestoreStatus'] :: TableRestoreStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the source database that contains the table being
--   restored.
[$sel:sourceDatabaseName:TableRestoreStatus'] :: TableRestoreStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that describes the current state of the table restore request.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>SUCCEEDED</tt>, <tt>FAILED</tt>, <tt>CANCELED</tt>,
--   <tt>PENDING</tt>, <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>
[$sel:status:TableRestoreStatus'] :: TableRestoreStatus -> Maybe TableRestoreStatusType

-- | The name of the source table being restored.
[$sel:sourceTableName:TableRestoreStatus'] :: TableRestoreStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The time that the table restore request was made, in Universal
--   Coordinated Time (UTC).
[$sel:requestTime:TableRestoreStatus'] :: TableRestoreStatus -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The name of the source schema that contains the table being restored.
[$sel:sourceSchemaName:TableRestoreStatus'] :: TableRestoreStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the database to restore the table to.
[$sel:targetDatabaseName:TableRestoreStatus'] :: TableRestoreStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | A description of the status of the table restore request. Status
--   values include <tt>SUCCEEDED</tt>, <tt>FAILED</tt>, <tt>CANCELED</tt>,
--   <tt>PENDING</tt>, <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>.
[$sel:message:TableRestoreStatus'] :: TableRestoreStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Redshift cluster that the table is being
--   restored to.
[$sel:clusterIdentifier:TableRestoreStatus'] :: TableRestoreStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the table to create as a result of the table restore
--   request.
[$sel:newTableName':TableRestoreStatus'] :: TableRestoreStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The amount of data restored to the new table so far, in megabytes
--   (MB).
[$sel:progressInMegaBytes:TableRestoreStatus'] :: TableRestoreStatus -> Maybe Integer

-- | The unique identifier for the table restore request.
[$sel:tableRestoreRequestId:TableRestoreStatus'] :: TableRestoreStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The total amount of data to restore to the new table, in megabytes
--   (MB).
[$sel:totalDataInMegaBytes:TableRestoreStatus'] :: TableRestoreStatus -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>TableRestoreStatus</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetSchemaName:TableRestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>tableRestoreStatus_targetSchemaName</a> - The name of the schema to
--   restore the table to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotIdentifier:TableRestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>tableRestoreStatus_snapshotIdentifier</a> - The identifier of the
--   snapshot that the table is being restored from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceDatabaseName:TableRestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>tableRestoreStatus_sourceDatabaseName</a> - The name of the source
--   database that contains the table being restored.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:TableRestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>tableRestoreStatus_status</a> - A value that describes the current
--   state of the table restore request.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>SUCCEEDED</tt>, <tt>FAILED</tt>, <tt>CANCELED</tt>,
--   <tt>PENDING</tt>, <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceTableName:TableRestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>tableRestoreStatus_sourceTableName</a> - The name of the source
--   table being restored.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestTime:TableRestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>tableRestoreStatus_requestTime</a> - The time that the table
--   restore request was made, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceSchemaName:TableRestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>tableRestoreStatus_sourceSchemaName</a> - The name of the source
--   schema that contains the table being restored.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetDatabaseName:TableRestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>tableRestoreStatus_targetDatabaseName</a> - The name of the
--   database to restore the table to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:TableRestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>tableRestoreStatus_message</a> - A description of the status of the
--   table restore request. Status values include <tt>SUCCEEDED</tt>,
--   <tt>FAILED</tt>, <tt>CANCELED</tt>, <tt>PENDING</tt>,
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterIdentifier:TableRestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>tableRestoreStatus_clusterIdentifier</a> - The identifier of the
--   Amazon Redshift cluster that the table is being restored to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:newTableName':TableRestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>tableRestoreStatus_newTableName</a> - The name of the table to
--   create as a result of the table restore request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:progressInMegaBytes:TableRestoreStatus'</a>,

--   restored to the new table so far, in megabytes (MB).

--   <a>tableRestoreStatus_tableRestoreRequestId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the table restore request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalDataInMegaBytes:TableRestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>tableRestoreStatus_totalDataInMegaBytes</a> - The total amount of
--   data to restore to the new table, in megabytes (MB).
newTableRestoreStatus :: TableRestoreStatus

-- | The name of the source database that contains the table being
--   restored.

-- | A value that describes the current state of the table restore request.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>SUCCEEDED</tt>, <tt>FAILED</tt>, <tt>CANCELED</tt>,
--   <tt>PENDING</tt>, <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>
tableRestoreStatus_status :: Lens' TableRestoreStatus (Maybe TableRestoreStatusType)

--   restored to.

--   request.

module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.Tag

-- | A tag consisting of a name/value pair for a resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Tag

-- | The key, or name, for the resource tag.
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Maybe Text

-- | The value for the resource tag.
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - The key, or name, for the
--   resource tag.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - The value for the resource
--   tag.
newTag :: Tag

-- | The key, or name, for the resource tag.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)

-- | The value for the resource tag.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.Tag.Tag

module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.SnapshotSchedule

-- | Describes a snapshot schedule. You can set a regular interval for
--   creating snapshots of a cluster. You can also schedule snapshots for
--   specific dates.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSnapshotSchedule</a> smart constructor.
data SnapshotSchedule
SnapshotSchedule' :: Maybe [ISO8601] -> Maybe [ClusterAssociatedToSchedule] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Int -> SnapshotSchedule
[$sel:nextInvocations:SnapshotSchedule'] :: SnapshotSchedule -> Maybe [ISO8601]

-- | A list of clusters associated with the schedule. A maximum of 100
--   clusters is returned.
[$sel:associatedClusters:SnapshotSchedule'] :: SnapshotSchedule -> Maybe [ClusterAssociatedToSchedule]

-- | A unique identifier for the schedule.
[$sel:scheduleIdentifier:SnapshotSchedule'] :: SnapshotSchedule -> Maybe Text

-- | The description of the schedule.
[$sel:scheduleDescription:SnapshotSchedule'] :: SnapshotSchedule -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of ScheduleDefinitions.
[$sel:scheduleDefinitions:SnapshotSchedule'] :: SnapshotSchedule -> Maybe [Text]

-- | An optional set of tags describing the schedule.
[$sel:tags:SnapshotSchedule'] :: SnapshotSchedule -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The number of clusters associated with the schedule.
[$sel:associatedClusterCount:SnapshotSchedule'] :: SnapshotSchedule -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>SnapshotSchedule</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextInvocations:SnapshotSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>snapshotSchedule_nextInvocations</a> -
--   
--   <a>$sel:associatedClusters:SnapshotSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>snapshotSchedule_associatedClusters</a> - A list of clusters
--   associated with the schedule. A maximum of 100 clusters is returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduleIdentifier:SnapshotSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>snapshotSchedule_scheduleIdentifier</a> - A unique identifier for
--   the schedule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduleDescription:SnapshotSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>snapshotSchedule_scheduleDescription</a> - The description of the
--   schedule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduleDefinitions:SnapshotSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>snapshotSchedule_scheduleDefinitions</a> - A list of
--   ScheduleDefinitions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:SnapshotSchedule'</a>, <a>snapshotSchedule_tags</a> - An
--   optional set of tags describing the schedule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:associatedClusterCount:SnapshotSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>snapshotSchedule_associatedClusterCount</a> - The number of
--   clusters associated with the schedule.
newSnapshotSchedule :: SnapshotSchedule

snapshotSchedule_nextInvocations :: Lens' SnapshotSchedule (Maybe [UTCTime])

-- | A list of clusters associated with the schedule. A maximum of 100
--   clusters is returned.
snapshotSchedule_associatedClusters :: Lens' SnapshotSchedule (Maybe [ClusterAssociatedToSchedule])

-- | A unique identifier for the schedule.
snapshotSchedule_scheduleIdentifier :: Lens' SnapshotSchedule (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the schedule.
snapshotSchedule_scheduleDescription :: Lens' SnapshotSchedule (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of ScheduleDefinitions.
snapshotSchedule_scheduleDefinitions :: Lens' SnapshotSchedule (Maybe [Text])

-- | An optional set of tags describing the schedule.
snapshotSchedule_tags :: Lens' SnapshotSchedule (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The number of clusters associated with the schedule.
snapshotSchedule_associatedClusterCount :: Lens' SnapshotSchedule (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.SnapshotSchedule.SnapshotSchedule
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.SnapshotSchedule.SnapshotSchedule
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.SnapshotSchedule.SnapshotSchedule
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.SnapshotSchedule.SnapshotSchedule
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.SnapshotSchedule.SnapshotSchedule
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.SnapshotSchedule.SnapshotSchedule
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.SnapshotSchedule.SnapshotSchedule


module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.SnapshotCopyGrant

-- | The snapshot copy grant that grants Amazon Redshift permission to
--   encrypt copied snapshots with the specified customer master key (CMK)
--   from Amazon Web Services KMS in the destination region.
--   
--   For more information about managing snapshot copy grants, go to
--   <a>Amazon Redshift Database Encryption</a> in the <i>Amazon Redshift
--   Cluster Management Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSnapshotCopyGrant</a> smart constructor.
data SnapshotCopyGrant
SnapshotCopyGrant' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> SnapshotCopyGrant

-- | The name of the snapshot copy grant.
[$sel:snapshotCopyGrantName:SnapshotCopyGrant'] :: SnapshotCopyGrant -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier of the customer master key (CMK) in Amazon Web
--   Services KMS to which Amazon Redshift is granted permission.
[$sel:kmsKeyId:SnapshotCopyGrant'] :: SnapshotCopyGrant -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of tag instances.
[$sel:tags:SnapshotCopyGrant'] :: SnapshotCopyGrant -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>SnapshotCopyGrant</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotCopyGrantName:SnapshotCopyGrant'</a>,
--   <a>snapshotCopyGrant_snapshotCopyGrantName</a> - The name of the
--   snapshot copy grant.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyId:SnapshotCopyGrant'</a>,
--   <a>snapshotCopyGrant_kmsKeyId</a> - The unique identifier of the
--   customer master key (CMK) in Amazon Web Services KMS to which Amazon
--   Redshift is granted permission.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:SnapshotCopyGrant'</a>, <a>snapshotCopyGrant_tags</a> - A
--   list of tag instances.
newSnapshotCopyGrant :: SnapshotCopyGrant

-- | The name of the snapshot copy grant.
snapshotCopyGrant_snapshotCopyGrantName :: Lens' SnapshotCopyGrant (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier of the customer master key (CMK) in Amazon Web
--   Services KMS to which Amazon Redshift is granted permission.
snapshotCopyGrant_kmsKeyId :: Lens' SnapshotCopyGrant (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of tag instances.
snapshotCopyGrant_tags :: Lens' SnapshotCopyGrant (Maybe [Tag])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.SnapshotCopyGrant.SnapshotCopyGrant
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.SnapshotCopyGrant.SnapshotCopyGrant
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.SnapshotCopyGrant.SnapshotCopyGrant
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.SnapshotCopyGrant.SnapshotCopyGrant
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.SnapshotCopyGrant.SnapshotCopyGrant
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.SnapshotCopyGrant.SnapshotCopyGrant
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.SnapshotCopyGrant.SnapshotCopyGrant


module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.Snapshot

-- | Describes a snapshot.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSnapshot</a> smart constructor.
data Snapshot
Snapshot' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Int -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [AccountWithRestoreAccess] -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Snapshot

-- | An option that specifies whether to create the cluster with enhanced
--   VPC routing enabled. To create a cluster that uses enhanced VPC
--   routing, the cluster must be in a VPC. For more information, see
--   <a>Enhanced VPC Routing</a> in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management
--   Guide.
--   
--   If this option is <tt>true</tt>, enhanced VPC routing is enabled.
--   
--   Default: false
[$sel:enhancedVpcRouting:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe Bool

-- | The snapshot identifier that is provided in the request.
[$sel:snapshotIdentifier:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The snapshot status. The value of the status depends on the API
--   operation used:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>CreateClusterSnapshot and CopyClusterSnapshot returns status as
--   "creating".</li>
--   <li>DescribeClusterSnapshots returns status as "creating",
--   "available", "final snapshot", or "failed".</li>
--   <li>DeleteClusterSnapshot returns status as "deleted".</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The estimate of the time remaining before the snapshot backup will
--   complete. Returns <tt>0</tt> for a completed backup.
[$sel:estimatedSecondsToCompletion:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe Integer

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, the data in the snapshot is encrypted at rest.
[$sel:encrypted:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe Bool

-- | The time (UTC) when the cluster was originally created.
[$sel:clusterCreateTime:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The number of days until a manual snapshot will pass its retention
--   period.
[$sel:manualSnapshotRemainingDays:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe Int

-- | The time (in UTC format) when Amazon Redshift began the snapshot. A
--   snapshot contains a copy of the cluster data as of this exact time.
[$sel:snapshotCreateTime:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | A boolean that indicates whether the snapshot data is encrypted using
--   the HSM keys of the source cluster. <tt>true</tt> indicates that the
--   data is encrypted using HSM keys.
[$sel:encryptedWithHSM:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe Bool

-- | The number of megabytes per second being transferred to the snapshot
--   backup. Returns <tt>0</tt> for a completed backup.
[$sel:currentBackupRateInMegaBytesPerSecond:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe Double

-- | The admin user name for the cluster.
[$sel:masterUsername:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The Key Management Service (KMS) key ID of the encryption key that was
--   used to encrypt data in the cluster from which the snapshot was taken.
[$sel:kmsKeyId:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of days that a manual snapshot is retained. If the value is
--   -1, the manual snapshot is retained indefinitely.
--   
--   The value must be either -1 or an integer between 1 and 3,653.
[$sel:manualSnapshotRetentionPeriod:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe Int

-- | The cluster version of the cluster used to create the snapshot. For
--   example, 1.0.15503.
[$sel:engineFullVersion:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The Availability Zone in which the cluster was created.
[$sel:availabilityZone:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The snapshot type. Snapshots created using CreateClusterSnapshot and
--   CopyClusterSnapshot are of type "manual".
[$sel:snapshotType:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of node types that this cluster snapshot is able to restore
--   into.
[$sel:restorableNodeTypes:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A list of the Amazon Web Services accounts authorized to restore the
--   snapshot. Returns <tt>null</tt> if no accounts are authorized. Visible
--   only to the snapshot owner.
[$sel:accountsWithRestoreAccess:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe [AccountWithRestoreAccess]

-- | The list of tags for the cluster snapshot.
[$sel:tags:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The name of the database that was created when the cluster was
--   created.
[$sel:dbName:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The size of the incremental backup.
[$sel:actualIncrementalBackupSizeInMegaBytes:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe Double

-- | The identifier of the cluster for which the snapshot was taken.
[$sel:clusterIdentifier:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The size of the complete set of backup data that would be used to
--   restore the cluster.
[$sel:totalBackupSizeInMegaBytes:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe Double

-- | The port that the cluster is listening on.
[$sel:port:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of nodes in the cluster.
[$sel:numberOfNodes:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe Int

-- | The amount of time an in-progress snapshot backup has been running, or
--   the amount of time it took a completed backup to finish.
[$sel:elapsedTimeInSeconds:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe Integer

-- | The number of megabytes that have been transferred to the snapshot
--   backup.
[$sel:backupProgressInMegaBytes:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe Double

-- | The version ID of the Amazon Redshift engine that is running on the
--   cluster.
[$sel:clusterVersion:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The VPC identifier of the cluster if the snapshot is from a cluster in
--   a VPC. Otherwise, this field is not in the output.
[$sel:vpcId:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | For manual snapshots, the Amazon Web Services account used to create
--   or copy the snapshot. For automatic snapshots, the owner of the
--   cluster. The owner can perform all snapshot actions, such as sharing a
--   manual snapshot.
[$sel:ownerAccount:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The node type of the nodes in the cluster.
[$sel:nodeType:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The source region from which the snapshot was copied.
[$sel:sourceRegion:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | A timestamp representing the start of the retention period for the
--   snapshot.
[$sel:snapshotRetentionStartTime:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The name of the maintenance track for the snapshot.
[$sel:maintenanceTrackName:Snapshot'] :: Snapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Snapshot</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:enhancedVpcRouting:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_enhancedVpcRouting</a> - An option that specifies whether
--   to create the cluster with enhanced VPC routing enabled. To create a
--   cluster that uses enhanced VPC routing, the cluster must be in a VPC.
--   For more information, see <a>Enhanced VPC Routing</a> in the Amazon
--   Redshift Cluster Management Guide.
--   
--   If this option is <tt>true</tt>, enhanced VPC routing is enabled.
--   
--   Default: false
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotIdentifier:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_snapshotIdentifier</a> - The snapshot identifier that is
--   provided in the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Snapshot'</a>, <a>snapshot_status</a> - The snapshot
--   status. The value of the status depends on the API operation used:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>CreateClusterSnapshot and CopyClusterSnapshot returns status as
--   "creating".</li>
--   <li>DescribeClusterSnapshots returns status as "creating",
--   "available", "final snapshot", or "failed".</li>
--   <li>DeleteClusterSnapshot returns status as "deleted".</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:estimatedSecondsToCompletion:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_estimatedSecondsToCompletion</a> - The estimate of the
--   time remaining before the snapshot backup will complete. Returns
--   <tt>0</tt> for a completed backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encrypted:Snapshot'</a>, <a>snapshot_encrypted</a> - If
--   <tt>true</tt>, the data in the snapshot is encrypted at rest.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterCreateTime:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_clusterCreateTime</a> - The time (UTC) when the cluster
--   was originally created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:manualSnapshotRemainingDays:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_manualSnapshotRemainingDays</a> - The number of days until
--   a manual snapshot will pass its retention period.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotCreateTime:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_snapshotCreateTime</a> - The time (in UTC format) when
--   Amazon Redshift began the snapshot. A snapshot contains a copy of the
--   cluster data as of this exact time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptedWithHSM:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_encryptedWithHSM</a> - A boolean that indicates whether
--   the snapshot data is encrypted using the HSM keys of the source
--   cluster. <tt>true</tt> indicates that the data is encrypted using HSM
--   keys.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentBackupRateInMegaBytesPerSecond:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_currentBackupRateInMegaBytesPerSecond</a> - The number of
--   megabytes per second being transferred to the snapshot backup. Returns
--   <tt>0</tt> for a completed backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:masterUsername:Snapshot'</a>, <a>snapshot_masterUsername</a> -
--   The admin user name for the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyId:Snapshot'</a>, <a>snapshot_kmsKeyId</a> - The Key
--   Management Service (KMS) key ID of the encryption key that was used to
--   encrypt data in the cluster from which the snapshot was taken.
--   
--   <a>$sel:manualSnapshotRetentionPeriod:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_manualSnapshotRetentionPeriod</a> - The number of days
--   that a manual snapshot is retained. If the value is -1, the manual
--   snapshot is retained indefinitely.
--   
--   The value must be either -1 or an integer between 1 and 3,653.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engineFullVersion:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_engineFullVersion</a> - The cluster version of the cluster
--   used to create the snapshot. For example, 1.0.15503.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZone:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_availabilityZone</a> - The Availability Zone in which the
--   cluster was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotType:Snapshot'</a>, <a>snapshot_snapshotType</a> - The
--   snapshot type. Snapshots created using CreateClusterSnapshot and
--   CopyClusterSnapshot are of type "manual".
--   
--   <a>$sel:restorableNodeTypes:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_restorableNodeTypes</a> - The list of node types that this
--   cluster snapshot is able to restore into.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountsWithRestoreAccess:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_accountsWithRestoreAccess</a> - A list of the Amazon Web
--   Services accounts authorized to restore the snapshot. Returns
--   <tt>null</tt> if no accounts are authorized. Visible only to the
--   snapshot owner.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Snapshot'</a>, <a>snapshot_tags</a> - The list of tags
--   for the cluster snapshot.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbName:Snapshot'</a>, <a>snapshot_dbName</a> - The name of the
--   database that was created when the cluster was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:actualIncrementalBackupSizeInMegaBytes:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_actualIncrementalBackupSizeInMegaBytes</a> - The size of
--   the incremental backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterIdentifier:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_clusterIdentifier</a> - The identifier of the cluster for
--   which the snapshot was taken.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalBackupSizeInMegaBytes:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_totalBackupSizeInMegaBytes</a> - The size of the complete
--   set of backup data that would be used to restore the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:Snapshot'</a>, <a>snapshot_port</a> - The port that the
--   cluster is listening on.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfNodes:Snapshot'</a>, <a>snapshot_numberOfNodes</a> -
--   The number of nodes in the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:elapsedTimeInSeconds:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_elapsedTimeInSeconds</a> - The amount of time an
--   in-progress snapshot backup has been running, or the amount of time it
--   took a completed backup to finish.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupProgressInMegaBytes:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_backupProgressInMegaBytes</a> - The number of megabytes
--   that have been transferred to the snapshot backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterVersion:Snapshot'</a>, <a>snapshot_clusterVersion</a> -
--   The version ID of the Amazon Redshift engine that is running on the
--   cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcId:Snapshot'</a>, <a>snapshot_vpcId</a> - The VPC
--   identifier of the cluster if the snapshot is from a cluster in a VPC.
--   Otherwise, this field is not in the output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ownerAccount:Snapshot'</a>, <a>snapshot_ownerAccount</a> - For
--   manual snapshots, the Amazon Web Services account used to create or
--   copy the snapshot. For automatic snapshots, the owner of the cluster.
--   The owner can perform all snapshot actions, such as sharing a manual
--   snapshot.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nodeType:Snapshot'</a>, <a>snapshot_nodeType</a> - The node
--   type of the nodes in the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceRegion:Snapshot'</a>, <a>snapshot_sourceRegion</a> - The
--   source region from which the snapshot was copied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotRetentionStartTime:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_snapshotRetentionStartTime</a> - A timestamp representing
--   the start of the retention period for the snapshot.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maintenanceTrackName:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_maintenanceTrackName</a> - The name of the maintenance
--   track for the snapshot.
newSnapshot :: Snapshot

-- | An option that specifies whether to create the cluster with enhanced
--   VPC routing enabled. To create a cluster that uses enhanced VPC
--   routing, the cluster must be in a VPC. For more information, see
--   <a>Enhanced VPC Routing</a> in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management
--   Guide.
--   
--   If this option is <tt>true</tt>, enhanced VPC routing is enabled.
--   
--   Default: false
snapshot_enhancedVpcRouting :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Bool)

-- | The snapshot identifier that is provided in the request.
snapshot_snapshotIdentifier :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The snapshot status. The value of the status depends on the API
--   operation used:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>CreateClusterSnapshot and CopyClusterSnapshot returns status as
--   "creating".</li>
--   <li>DescribeClusterSnapshots returns status as "creating",
--   "available", "final snapshot", or "failed".</li>
--   <li>DeleteClusterSnapshot returns status as "deleted".</li>
--   </ul>
snapshot_status :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The estimate of the time remaining before the snapshot backup will
--   complete. Returns <tt>0</tt> for a completed backup.
snapshot_estimatedSecondsToCompletion :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Integer)

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, the data in the snapshot is encrypted at rest.
snapshot_encrypted :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Bool)

-- | The time (UTC) when the cluster was originally created.
snapshot_clusterCreateTime :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The number of days until a manual snapshot will pass its retention
--   period.
snapshot_manualSnapshotRemainingDays :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Int)

-- | The time (in UTC format) when Amazon Redshift began the snapshot. A
--   snapshot contains a copy of the cluster data as of this exact time.
snapshot_snapshotCreateTime :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A boolean that indicates whether the snapshot data is encrypted using
--   the HSM keys of the source cluster. <tt>true</tt> indicates that the
--   data is encrypted using HSM keys.
snapshot_encryptedWithHSM :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Bool)

-- | The number of megabytes per second being transferred to the snapshot
--   backup. Returns <tt>0</tt> for a completed backup.
snapshot_currentBackupRateInMegaBytesPerSecond :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Double)

-- | The admin user name for the cluster.
snapshot_masterUsername :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The Key Management Service (KMS) key ID of the encryption key that was
--   used to encrypt data in the cluster from which the snapshot was taken.
snapshot_kmsKeyId :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of days that a manual snapshot is retained. If the value is
--   -1, the manual snapshot is retained indefinitely.
--   
--   The value must be either -1 or an integer between 1 and 3,653.
snapshot_manualSnapshotRetentionPeriod :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Int)

-- | The cluster version of the cluster used to create the snapshot. For
--   example, 1.0.15503.
snapshot_engineFullVersion :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The Availability Zone in which the cluster was created.
snapshot_availabilityZone :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The snapshot type. Snapshots created using CreateClusterSnapshot and
--   CopyClusterSnapshot are of type "manual".
snapshot_snapshotType :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of node types that this cluster snapshot is able to restore
--   into.
snapshot_restorableNodeTypes :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe [Text])

-- | A list of the Amazon Web Services accounts authorized to restore the
--   snapshot. Returns <tt>null</tt> if no accounts are authorized. Visible
--   only to the snapshot owner.
snapshot_accountsWithRestoreAccess :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe [AccountWithRestoreAccess])

-- | The list of tags for the cluster snapshot.
snapshot_tags :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The name of the database that was created when the cluster was
--   created.
snapshot_dbName :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The size of the incremental backup.
snapshot_actualIncrementalBackupSizeInMegaBytes :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Double)

-- | The identifier of the cluster for which the snapshot was taken.
snapshot_clusterIdentifier :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The size of the complete set of backup data that would be used to
--   restore the cluster.
snapshot_totalBackupSizeInMegaBytes :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Double)

-- | The port that the cluster is listening on.
snapshot_port :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of nodes in the cluster.
snapshot_numberOfNodes :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Int)

-- | The amount of time an in-progress snapshot backup has been running, or
--   the amount of time it took a completed backup to finish.
snapshot_elapsedTimeInSeconds :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Integer)

-- | The number of megabytes that have been transferred to the snapshot
--   backup.
snapshot_backupProgressInMegaBytes :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Double)

-- | The version ID of the Amazon Redshift engine that is running on the
--   cluster.
snapshot_clusterVersion :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The VPC identifier of the cluster if the snapshot is from a cluster in
--   a VPC. Otherwise, this field is not in the output.
snapshot_vpcId :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | For manual snapshots, the Amazon Web Services account used to create
--   or copy the snapshot. For automatic snapshots, the owner of the
--   cluster. The owner can perform all snapshot actions, such as sharing a
--   manual snapshot.
snapshot_ownerAccount :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The node type of the nodes in the cluster.
snapshot_nodeType :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The source region from which the snapshot was copied.
snapshot_sourceRegion :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | A timestamp representing the start of the retention period for the
--   snapshot.
snapshot_snapshotRetentionStartTime :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the maintenance track for the snapshot.
snapshot_maintenanceTrackName :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Text)

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.Snapshot.Snapshot
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.Snapshot.Snapshot
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.Snapshot.Snapshot
