module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.IPRange

-- | Describes an IP range used in a security group.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIPRange</a> smart constructor.
data IPRange
IPRange' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> IPRange

-- | The status of the IP range, for example, "authorized".
[$sel:status:IPRange'] :: IPRange -> Maybe Text

-- | The IP range in Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) notation.
[$sel:cidrip:IPRange'] :: IPRange -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of tags for the IP range.
[$sel:tags:IPRange'] :: IPRange -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>IPRange</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:IPRange'</a>, <a>iPRange_status</a> - The status of the
--   IP range, for example, "authorized".
--   
--   <a>$sel:cidrip:IPRange'</a>, <a>iPRange_cidrip</a> - The IP range in
--   Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) notation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:IPRange'</a>, <a>iPRange_tags</a> - The list of tags for
--   the IP range.
newIPRange :: IPRange

-- | The status of the IP range, for example, "authorized".
iPRange_status :: Lens' IPRange (Maybe Text)

-- | The IP range in Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) notation.
iPRange_cidrip :: Lens' IPRange (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of tags for the IP range.
iPRange_tags :: Lens' IPRange (Maybe [Tag])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.IPRange.IPRange
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.IPRange.IPRange
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.IPRange.IPRange
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.IPRange.IPRange
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.IPRange.IPRange
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.IPRange.IPRange
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.IPRange.IPRange


module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.HsmConfiguration

-- | Returns information about an HSM configuration, which is an object
--   that describes to Amazon Redshift clusters the information they
--   require to connect to an HSM where they can store database encryption
--   keys.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHsmConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data HsmConfiguration
HsmConfiguration' :: Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> HsmConfiguration

-- | The list of tags for the HSM configuration.
[$sel:tags:HsmConfiguration'] :: HsmConfiguration -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The IP address that the Amazon Redshift cluster must use to access the
--   HSM.
[$sel:hsmIpAddress:HsmConfiguration'] :: HsmConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | A text description of the HSM configuration.
[$sel:description:HsmConfiguration'] :: HsmConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the partition in the HSM where the Amazon Redshift
--   clusters will store their database encryption keys.
[$sel:hsmPartitionName:HsmConfiguration'] :: HsmConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the Amazon Redshift HSM configuration.
[$sel:hsmConfigurationIdentifier:HsmConfiguration'] :: HsmConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>HsmConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:HsmConfiguration'</a>, <a>hsmConfiguration_tags</a> - The
--   list of tags for the HSM configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsmIpAddress:HsmConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>hsmConfiguration_hsmIpAddress</a> - The IP address that the Amazon
--   Redshift cluster must use to access the HSM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:HsmConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>hsmConfiguration_description</a> - A text description of the HSM
--   configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsmPartitionName:HsmConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>hsmConfiguration_hsmPartitionName</a> - The name of the partition
--   in the HSM where the Amazon Redshift clusters will store their
--   database encryption keys.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsmConfigurationIdentifier:HsmConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>hsmConfiguration_hsmConfigurationIdentifier</a> - The name of the
--   Amazon Redshift HSM configuration.
newHsmConfiguration :: HsmConfiguration

-- | The list of tags for the HSM configuration.
hsmConfiguration_tags :: Lens' HsmConfiguration (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The IP address that the Amazon Redshift cluster must use to access the
--   HSM.
hsmConfiguration_hsmIpAddress :: Lens' HsmConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | A text description of the HSM configuration.
hsmConfiguration_description :: Lens' HsmConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the partition in the HSM where the Amazon Redshift
--   clusters will store their database encryption keys.
hsmConfiguration_hsmPartitionName :: Lens' HsmConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the Amazon Redshift HSM configuration.
hsmConfiguration_hsmConfigurationIdentifier :: Lens' HsmConfiguration (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.HsmConfiguration.HsmConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.HsmConfiguration.HsmConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.HsmConfiguration.HsmConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.HsmConfiguration.HsmConfiguration
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.HsmConfiguration.HsmConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.HsmConfiguration.HsmConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.HsmConfiguration.HsmConfiguration


module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.HsmClientCertificate

-- | Returns information about an HSM client certificate. The certificate
--   is stored in a secure Hardware Storage Module (HSM), and used by the
--   Amazon Redshift cluster to encrypt data files.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHsmClientCertificate</a> smart constructor.
data HsmClientCertificate
HsmClientCertificate' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> HsmClientCertificate

-- | The public key that the Amazon Redshift cluster will use to connect to
--   the HSM. You must register the public key in the HSM.
[$sel:hsmClientCertificatePublicKey:HsmClientCertificate'] :: HsmClientCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the HSM client certificate.
[$sel:hsmClientCertificateIdentifier:HsmClientCertificate'] :: HsmClientCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of tags for the HSM client certificate.
[$sel:tags:HsmClientCertificate'] :: HsmClientCertificate -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>HsmClientCertificate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsmClientCertificatePublicKey:HsmClientCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>hsmClientCertificate_hsmClientCertificatePublicKey</a> - The public
--   key that the Amazon Redshift cluster will use to connect to the HSM.
--   You must register the public key in the HSM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsmClientCertificateIdentifier:HsmClientCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>hsmClientCertificate_hsmClientCertificateIdentifier</a> - The
--   identifier of the HSM client certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:HsmClientCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>hsmClientCertificate_tags</a> - The list of tags for the HSM client
--   certificate.
newHsmClientCertificate :: HsmClientCertificate

-- | The public key that the Amazon Redshift cluster will use to connect to
--   the HSM. You must register the public key in the HSM.
hsmClientCertificate_hsmClientCertificatePublicKey :: Lens' HsmClientCertificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the HSM client certificate.
hsmClientCertificate_hsmClientCertificateIdentifier :: Lens' HsmClientCertificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of tags for the HSM client certificate.
hsmClientCertificate_tags :: Lens' HsmClientCertificate (Maybe [Tag])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.HsmClientCertificate.HsmClientCertificate
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.HsmClientCertificate.HsmClientCertificate
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.HsmClientCertificate.HsmClientCertificate
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.HsmClientCertificate.HsmClientCertificate
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.HsmClientCertificate.HsmClientCertificate
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.HsmClientCertificate.HsmClientCertificate
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.HsmClientCertificate.HsmClientCertificate


module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.EventSubscription

-- | Describes event subscriptions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventSubscription</a> smart constructor.
data EventSubscription
EventSubscription' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> EventSubscription

-- | The name of the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription.
[$sel:custSubscriptionId:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe Text

-- | The status of the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Can be one of the following: active | no-permission |
--   topic-not-exist</li>
--   <li>The status "no-permission" indicates that Amazon Redshift no
--   longer has permission to post to the Amazon SNS topic. The status
--   "topic-not-exist" indicates that the topic was deleted after the
--   subscription was created.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of the sources that publish events to the Amazon Redshift event
--   notification subscription.
[$sel:sourceIdsList:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The event severity specified in the Amazon Redshift event notification
--   subscription.
--   
--   Values: ERROR, INFO
[$sel:severity:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of Amazon Redshift event categories specified in the event
--   notification subscription.
--   
--   Values: Configuration, Management, Monitoring, Security, Pending
[$sel:eventCategoriesList:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A boolean value indicating whether the subscription is enabled;
--   <tt>true</tt> indicates that the subscription is enabled.
[$sel:enabled:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe Bool

-- | The date and time the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription
--   was created.
[$sel:subscriptionCreationTime:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The Amazon Web Services account associated with the Amazon Redshift
--   event notification subscription.
[$sel:customerAwsId:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of tags for the event subscription.
[$sel:tags:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The source type of the events returned by the Amazon Redshift event
--   notification, such as cluster, cluster-snapshot,
--   cluster-parameter-group, cluster-security-group, or scheduled-action.
[$sel:sourceType:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic used by the
--   event notification subscription.
[$sel:snsTopicArn:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EventSubscription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:custSubscriptionId:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_custSubscriptionId</a> - The name of the Amazon
--   Redshift event notification subscription.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:EventSubscription'</a>, <a>eventSubscription_status</a>
--   - The status of the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Can be one of the following: active | no-permission |
--   topic-not-exist</li>
--   <li>The status "no-permission" indicates that Amazon Redshift no
--   longer has permission to post to the Amazon SNS topic. The status
--   "topic-not-exist" indicates that the topic was deleted after the
--   subscription was created.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceIdsList:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_sourceIdsList</a> - A list of the sources that
--   publish events to the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription.
--   
--   <a>$sel:severity:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_severity</a> - The event severity specified in
--   the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription.
--   
--   Values: ERROR, INFO
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventCategoriesList:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_eventCategoriesList</a> - The list of Amazon
--   Redshift event categories specified in the event notification
--   subscription.
--   
--   Values: Configuration, Management, Monitoring, Security, Pending
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_enabled</a> - A boolean value indicating whether
--   the subscription is enabled; <tt>true</tt> indicates that the
--   subscription is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subscriptionCreationTime:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_subscriptionCreationTime</a> - The date and time
--   the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customerAwsId:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_customerAwsId</a> - The Amazon Web Services
--   account associated with the Amazon Redshift event notification
--   subscription.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:EventSubscription'</a>, <a>eventSubscription_tags</a> -
--   The list of tags for the event subscription.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceType:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_sourceType</a> - The source type of the events
--   returned by the Amazon Redshift event notification, such as cluster,
--   cluster-snapshot, cluster-parameter-group, cluster-security-group, or
--   scheduled-action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snsTopicArn:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_snsTopicArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the Amazon SNS topic used by the event notification subscription.
newEventSubscription :: EventSubscription

-- | The name of the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription.
eventSubscription_custSubscriptionId :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Can be one of the following: active | no-permission |
--   topic-not-exist</li>
--   <li>The status "no-permission" indicates that Amazon Redshift no
--   longer has permission to post to the Amazon SNS topic. The status
--   "topic-not-exist" indicates that the topic was deleted after the
--   subscription was created.</li>
--   </ul>
eventSubscription_status :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of the sources that publish events to the Amazon Redshift event
--   notification subscription.
eventSubscription_sourceIdsList :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe [Text])

-- | The event severity specified in the Amazon Redshift event notification
--   subscription.
--   
--   Values: ERROR, INFO
eventSubscription_severity :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of Amazon Redshift event categories specified in the event
--   notification subscription.
--   
--   Values: Configuration, Management, Monitoring, Security, Pending
eventSubscription_eventCategoriesList :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe [Text])

-- | A boolean value indicating whether the subscription is enabled;
--   <tt>true</tt> indicates that the subscription is enabled.
eventSubscription_enabled :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Bool)

-- | The date and time the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription
--   was created.
eventSubscription_subscriptionCreationTime :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Amazon Web Services account associated with the Amazon Redshift
--   event notification subscription.
eventSubscription_customerAwsId :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of tags for the event subscription.
eventSubscription_tags :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The source type of the events returned by the Amazon Redshift event
--   notification, such as cluster, cluster-snapshot,
--   cluster-parameter-group, cluster-security-group, or scheduled-action.
eventSubscription_sourceType :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic used by the
--   event notification subscription.
eventSubscription_snsTopicArn :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.EventSubscription.EventSubscription
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.EventSubscription.EventSubscription
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.EventSubscription.EventSubscription
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.EventSubscription.EventSubscription
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.EventSubscription.EventSubscription
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.EventSubscription.EventSubscription
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.EventSubscription.EventSubscription

module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.ClusterSecurityGroup

-- | Describes a security group.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newClusterSecurityGroup</a> smart constructor.
data ClusterSecurityGroup
ClusterSecurityGroup' :: Maybe [IPRange] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe [EC2SecurityGroup] -> Maybe Text -> ClusterSecurityGroup

-- | A list of IP ranges (CIDR blocks) that are permitted to access
--   clusters associated with this cluster security group.
[$sel:iPRanges:ClusterSecurityGroup'] :: ClusterSecurityGroup -> Maybe [IPRange]

-- | The name of the cluster security group to which the operation was
--   applied.
[$sel:clusterSecurityGroupName:ClusterSecurityGroup'] :: ClusterSecurityGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of tags for the cluster security group.
[$sel:tags:ClusterSecurityGroup'] :: ClusterSecurityGroup -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | A list of EC2 security groups that are permitted to access clusters
--   associated with this cluster security group.
[$sel:eC2SecurityGroups:ClusterSecurityGroup'] :: ClusterSecurityGroup -> Maybe [EC2SecurityGroup]

-- | A description of the security group.
[$sel:description:ClusterSecurityGroup'] :: ClusterSecurityGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ClusterSecurityGroup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:iPRanges:ClusterSecurityGroup'</a>,
--   <a>clusterSecurityGroup_iPRanges</a> - A list of IP ranges (CIDR
--   blocks) that are permitted to access clusters associated with this
--   cluster security group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterSecurityGroupName:ClusterSecurityGroup'</a>,
--   <a>clusterSecurityGroup_clusterSecurityGroupName</a> - The name of the
--   cluster security group to which the operation was applied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:ClusterSecurityGroup'</a>,
--   <a>clusterSecurityGroup_tags</a> - The list of tags for the cluster
--   security group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eC2SecurityGroups:ClusterSecurityGroup'</a>,
--   <a>clusterSecurityGroup_eC2SecurityGroups</a> - A list of EC2 security
--   groups that are permitted to access clusters associated with this
--   cluster security group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:ClusterSecurityGroup'</a>,
--   <a>clusterSecurityGroup_description</a> - A description of the
--   security group.
newClusterSecurityGroup :: ClusterSecurityGroup

-- | A list of IP ranges (CIDR blocks) that are permitted to access
--   clusters associated with this cluster security group.
clusterSecurityGroup_iPRanges :: Lens' ClusterSecurityGroup (Maybe [IPRange])

-- | The name of the cluster security group to which the operation was
--   applied.
clusterSecurityGroup_clusterSecurityGroupName :: Lens' ClusterSecurityGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of tags for the cluster security group.
clusterSecurityGroup_tags :: Lens' ClusterSecurityGroup (Maybe [Tag])

-- | A list of EC2 security groups that are permitted to access clusters
--   associated with this cluster security group.
clusterSecurityGroup_eC2SecurityGroups :: Lens' ClusterSecurityGroup (Maybe [EC2SecurityGroup])

-- | A description of the security group.
clusterSecurityGroup_description :: Lens' ClusterSecurityGroup (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.TaggedResource

-- | A tag and its associated resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTaggedResource</a> smart constructor.
data TaggedResource
TaggedResource' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Tag -> TaggedResource

-- | The type of resource with which the tag is associated. Valid resource
--   types are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Cluster</li>
--   <li>CIDR/IP</li>
--   <li>EC2 security group</li>
--   <li>Snapshot</li>
--   <li>Cluster security group</li>
--   <li>Subnet group</li>
--   <li>HSM connection</li>
--   <li>HSM certificate</li>
--   <li>Parameter group</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information about Amazon Redshift resource types and
--   constructing ARNs, go to <a>Constructing an Amazon Redshift Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN)</a> in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management
--   Guide.
[$sel:resourceType:TaggedResource'] :: TaggedResource -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) with which the tag is associated, for
--   example: <tt>arn:aws:redshift:us-east-2:123456789:cluster:t1</tt>.
[$sel:resourceName:TaggedResource'] :: TaggedResource -> Maybe Text

-- | The tag for the resource.
[$sel:tag:TaggedResource'] :: TaggedResource -> Maybe Tag

-- | Create a value of <a>TaggedResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:TaggedResource'</a>,
--   <a>taggedResource_resourceType</a> - The type of resource with which
--   the tag is associated. Valid resource types are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Cluster</li>
--   <li>CIDR/IP</li>
--   <li>EC2 security group</li>
--   <li>Snapshot</li>
--   <li>Cluster security group</li>
--   <li>Subnet group</li>
--   <li>HSM connection</li>
--   <li>HSM certificate</li>
--   <li>Parameter group</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information about Amazon Redshift resource types and
--   constructing ARNs, go to <a>Constructing an Amazon Redshift Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN)</a> in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management
--   Guide.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceName:TaggedResource'</a>,
--   <a>taggedResource_resourceName</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   with which the tag is associated, for example:
--   <tt>arn:aws:redshift:us-east-2:123456789:cluster:t1</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tag:TaggedResource'</a>, <a>taggedResource_tag</a> - The tag
--   for the resource.
newTaggedResource :: TaggedResource

-- | The type of resource with which the tag is associated. Valid resource
--   types are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Cluster</li>
--   <li>CIDR/IP</li>
--   <li>EC2 security group</li>
--   <li>Snapshot</li>
--   <li>Cluster security group</li>
--   <li>Subnet group</li>
--   <li>HSM connection</li>
--   <li>HSM certificate</li>
--   <li>Parameter group</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information about Amazon Redshift resource types and
--   constructing ARNs, go to <a>Constructing an Amazon Redshift Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN)</a> in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management
--   Guide.
taggedResource_resourceType :: Lens' TaggedResource (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) with which the tag is associated, for
--   example: <tt>arn:aws:redshift:us-east-2:123456789:cluster:t1</tt>.
taggedResource_resourceName :: Lens' TaggedResource (Maybe Text)

-- | The tag for the resource.
taggedResource_tag :: Lens' TaggedResource (Maybe Tag)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.TaggedResource.TaggedResource
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.TaggedResource.TaggedResource
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.TaggedResource.TaggedResource
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.TaggedResource.TaggedResource
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.TaggedResource.TaggedResource
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.TaggedResource.TaggedResource
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.TaggedResource.TaggedResource


module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.UpdateTarget

-- | A maintenance track that you can switch the current track to.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateTarget</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateTarget
UpdateTarget' :: Maybe [SupportedOperation] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> UpdateTarget

-- | A list of operations supported by the maintenance track.
[$sel:supportedOperations:UpdateTarget'] :: UpdateTarget -> Maybe [SupportedOperation]

-- | The cluster version for the new maintenance track.
[$sel:databaseVersion:UpdateTarget'] :: UpdateTarget -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the new maintenance track.
[$sel:maintenanceTrackName:UpdateTarget'] :: UpdateTarget -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateTarget</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportedOperations:UpdateTarget'</a>,
--   <a>updateTarget_supportedOperations</a> - A list of operations
--   supported by the maintenance track.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseVersion:UpdateTarget'</a>,
--   <a>updateTarget_databaseVersion</a> - The cluster version for the new
--   maintenance track.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maintenanceTrackName:UpdateTarget'</a>,
--   <a>updateTarget_maintenanceTrackName</a> - The name of the new
--   maintenance track.
newUpdateTarget :: UpdateTarget

-- | A list of operations supported by the maintenance track.
updateTarget_supportedOperations :: Lens' UpdateTarget (Maybe [SupportedOperation])

-- | The cluster version for the new maintenance track.
updateTarget_databaseVersion :: Lens' UpdateTarget (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the new maintenance track.
updateTarget_maintenanceTrackName :: Lens' UpdateTarget (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.UpdateTarget.UpdateTarget
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.UpdateTarget.UpdateTarget
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.UpdateTarget.UpdateTarget
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.UpdateTarget.UpdateTarget
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.UpdateTarget.UpdateTarget
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.UpdateTarget.UpdateTarget
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.UpdateTarget.UpdateTarget


module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.MaintenanceTrack

-- | Defines a maintenance track that determines which Amazon Redshift
--   version to apply during a maintenance window. If the value for
--   <tt>MaintenanceTrack</tt> is <tt>current</tt>, the cluster is updated
--   to the most recently certified maintenance release. If the value is
--   <tt>trailing</tt>, the cluster is updated to the previously certified
--   maintenance release.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMaintenanceTrack</a> smart constructor.
data MaintenanceTrack
MaintenanceTrack' :: Maybe [UpdateTarget] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> MaintenanceTrack

-- | An array of UpdateTarget objects to update with the maintenance track.
[$sel:updateTargets:MaintenanceTrack'] :: MaintenanceTrack -> Maybe [UpdateTarget]

-- | The version number for the cluster release.
[$sel:databaseVersion:MaintenanceTrack'] :: MaintenanceTrack -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the maintenance track. Possible values are
--   <tt>current</tt> and <tt>trailing</tt>.
[$sel:maintenanceTrackName:MaintenanceTrack'] :: MaintenanceTrack -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MaintenanceTrack</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:updateTargets:MaintenanceTrack'</a>,
--   <a>maintenanceTrack_updateTargets</a> - An array of UpdateTarget
--   objects to update with the maintenance track.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseVersion:MaintenanceTrack'</a>,
--   <a>maintenanceTrack_databaseVersion</a> - The version number for the
--   cluster release.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maintenanceTrackName:MaintenanceTrack'</a>,
--   <a>maintenanceTrack_maintenanceTrackName</a> - The name of the
--   maintenance track. Possible values are <tt>current</tt> and
--   <tt>trailing</tt>.
newMaintenanceTrack :: MaintenanceTrack

-- | An array of UpdateTarget objects to update with the maintenance track.
maintenanceTrack_updateTargets :: Lens' MaintenanceTrack (Maybe [UpdateTarget])

-- | The version number for the cluster release.
maintenanceTrack_databaseVersion :: Lens' MaintenanceTrack (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the maintenance track. Possible values are
--   <tt>current</tt> and <tt>trailing</tt>.
maintenanceTrack_maintenanceTrackName :: Lens' MaintenanceTrack (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.MaintenanceTrack.MaintenanceTrack
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.MaintenanceTrack.MaintenanceTrack
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.MaintenanceTrack.MaintenanceTrack
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.MaintenanceTrack.MaintenanceTrack
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.MaintenanceTrack.MaintenanceTrack
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.MaintenanceTrack.MaintenanceTrack
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.MaintenanceTrack.MaintenanceTrack

module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.UsageLimit

-- | Describes a usage limit object for a cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUsageLimit</a> smart constructor.
data UsageLimit
UsageLimit' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe UsageLimitFeatureType -> Maybe UsageLimitBreachAction -> Maybe UsageLimitLimitType -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe UsageLimitPeriod -> Maybe Text -> UsageLimit

-- | The limit amount. If time-based, this amount is in minutes. If
--   data-based, this amount is in terabytes (TB).
[$sel:amount:UsageLimit'] :: UsageLimit -> Maybe Integer

-- | The Amazon Redshift feature to which the limit applies.
[$sel:featureType:UsageLimit'] :: UsageLimit -> Maybe UsageLimitFeatureType

-- | The action that Amazon Redshift takes when the limit is reached.
--   Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>log</b> - To log an event in a system table. The default is
--   log.</li>
--   <li><b>emit-metric</b> - To emit CloudWatch metrics.</li>
--   <li><b>disable</b> - To disable the feature until the next usage
--   period begins.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:breachAction:UsageLimit'] :: UsageLimit -> Maybe UsageLimitBreachAction

-- | The type of limit. Depending on the feature type, this can be based on
--   a time duration or data size.
[$sel:limitType:UsageLimit'] :: UsageLimit -> Maybe UsageLimitLimitType

-- | A list of tag instances.
[$sel:tags:UsageLimit'] :: UsageLimit -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The identifier of the cluster with a usage limit.
[$sel:clusterIdentifier:UsageLimit'] :: UsageLimit -> Maybe Text

-- | The time period that the amount applies to. A <tt>weekly</tt> period
--   begins on Sunday. The default is <tt>monthly</tt>.
[$sel:period:UsageLimit'] :: UsageLimit -> Maybe UsageLimitPeriod

-- | The identifier of the usage limit.
[$sel:usageLimitId:UsageLimit'] :: UsageLimit -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UsageLimit</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:amount:UsageLimit'</a>, <a>usageLimit_amount</a> - The limit
--   amount. If time-based, this amount is in minutes. If data-based, this
--   amount is in terabytes (TB).
--   
--   <a>$sel:featureType:UsageLimit'</a>, <a>usageLimit_featureType</a> -
--   The Amazon Redshift feature to which the limit applies.
--   
--   <a>$sel:breachAction:UsageLimit'</a>, <a>usageLimit_breachAction</a> -
--   The action that Amazon Redshift takes when the limit is reached.
--   Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>log</b> - To log an event in a system table. The default is
--   log.</li>
--   <li><b>emit-metric</b> - To emit CloudWatch metrics.</li>
--   <li><b>disable</b> - To disable the feature until the next usage
--   period begins.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:limitType:UsageLimit'</a>, <a>usageLimit_limitType</a> - The
--   type of limit. Depending on the feature type, this can be based on a
--   time duration or data size.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:UsageLimit'</a>, <a>usageLimit_tags</a> - A list of tag
--   instances.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterIdentifier:UsageLimit'</a>,
--   <a>usageLimit_clusterIdentifier</a> - The identifier of the cluster
--   with a usage limit.
--   
--   <a>$sel:period:UsageLimit'</a>, <a>usageLimit_period</a> - The time
--   period that the amount applies to. A <tt>weekly</tt> period begins on
--   Sunday. The default is <tt>monthly</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:usageLimitId:UsageLimit'</a>, <a>usageLimit_usageLimitId</a> -
--   The identifier of the usage limit.
newUsageLimit :: UsageLimit

-- | The limit amount. If time-based, this amount is in minutes. If
--   data-based, this amount is in terabytes (TB).
usageLimit_amount :: Lens' UsageLimit (Maybe Integer)

-- | The Amazon Redshift feature to which the limit applies.
usageLimit_featureType :: Lens' UsageLimit (Maybe UsageLimitFeatureType)

-- | The action that Amazon Redshift takes when the limit is reached.
--   Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>log</b> - To log an event in a system table. The default is
--   log.</li>
--   <li><b>emit-metric</b> - To emit CloudWatch metrics.</li>
--   <li><b>disable</b> - To disable the feature until the next usage
--   period begins.</li>
--   </ul>
usageLimit_breachAction :: Lens' UsageLimit (Maybe UsageLimitBreachAction)

-- | The type of limit. Depending on the feature type, this can be based on
--   a time duration or data size.
usageLimit_limitType :: Lens' UsageLimit (Maybe UsageLimitLimitType)

-- | A list of tag instances.
usageLimit_tags :: Lens' UsageLimit (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The identifier of the cluster with a usage limit.
usageLimit_clusterIdentifier :: Lens' UsageLimit (Maybe Text)

-- | The time period that the amount applies to. A <tt>weekly</tt> period
--   begins on Sunday. The default is <tt>monthly</tt>.
usageLimit_period :: Lens' UsageLimit (Maybe UsageLimitPeriod)

-- | The identifier of the usage limit.
usageLimit_usageLimitId :: Lens' UsageLimit (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.UsageLimit.UsageLimit
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.UsageLimit.UsageLimit
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.UsageLimit.UsageLimit
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.UsageLimit.UsageLimit
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.UsageLimit.UsageLimit
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.UsageLimit.UsageLimit
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.UsageLimit.UsageLimit


module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.VpcEndpoint

-- | The connection endpoint for connecting to an Amazon Redshift cluster
--   through the proxy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVpcEndpoint</a> smart constructor.
data VpcEndpoint
VpcEndpoint' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [NetworkInterface] -> VpcEndpoint

-- | The connection endpoint ID for connecting an Amazon Redshift cluster
--   through the proxy.
[$sel:vpcEndpointId:VpcEndpoint'] :: VpcEndpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The VPC identifier that the endpoint is associated.
[$sel:vpcId:VpcEndpoint'] :: VpcEndpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | One or more network interfaces of the endpoint. Also known as an
--   interface endpoint.
[$sel:networkInterfaces:VpcEndpoint'] :: VpcEndpoint -> Maybe [NetworkInterface]

-- | Create a value of <a>VpcEndpoint</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcEndpointId:VpcEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>vpcEndpoint_vpcEndpointId</a> - The connection endpoint ID for
--   connecting an Amazon Redshift cluster through the proxy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcId:VpcEndpoint'</a>, <a>vpcEndpoint_vpcId</a> - The VPC
--   identifier that the endpoint is associated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkInterfaces:VpcEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>vpcEndpoint_networkInterfaces</a> - One or more network interfaces
--   of the endpoint. Also known as an interface endpoint.
newVpcEndpoint :: VpcEndpoint

-- | The connection endpoint ID for connecting an Amazon Redshift cluster
--   through the proxy.
vpcEndpoint_vpcEndpointId :: Lens' VpcEndpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | The VPC identifier that the endpoint is associated.
vpcEndpoint_vpcId :: Lens' VpcEndpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | One or more network interfaces of the endpoint. Also known as an
--   interface endpoint.
vpcEndpoint_networkInterfaces :: Lens' VpcEndpoint (Maybe [NetworkInterface])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.VpcEndpoint.VpcEndpoint
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.VpcEndpoint.VpcEndpoint
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.VpcEndpoint.VpcEndpoint
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.VpcEndpoint.VpcEndpoint
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.VpcEndpoint.VpcEndpoint
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.VpcEndpoint.VpcEndpoint
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.VpcEndpoint.VpcEndpoint


module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.Endpoint

-- | Describes a connection endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpoint</a> smart constructor.
data Endpoint
Endpoint' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [VpcEndpoint] -> Maybe Int -> Endpoint

-- | The DNS address of the Cluster.
[$sel:address:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | Describes a connection endpoint.
[$sel:vpcEndpoints:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe [VpcEndpoint]

-- | The port that the database engine is listening on.
[$sel:port:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Int

--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   address of the Cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcEndpoints:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_vpcEndpoints</a> -
--   Describes a connection endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_port</a> - The port that the
--   database engine is listening on.
newEndpoint :: Endpoint

module Network.AWS.Redshift.Types.VpcSecurityGroupMembership

--
