-- | Describes a cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCluster</a> smart constructor.
data Cluster
Cluster' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe [VpcSecurityGroupMembership] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ResizeInfo -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [DeferredMaintenanceWindow] -> Maybe ScheduleState -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> Maybe ElasticIpStatus -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe HsmStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [ClusterParameterGroupStatus] -> Maybe ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RestoreStatus -> Maybe AquaConfiguration -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe [ClusterNode] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe DataTransferProgress -> Maybe PendingModifiedValues -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Endpoint -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [ClusterSecurityGroupMembership] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [ClusterIamRole] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Cluster

-- | The total storage capacity of the cluster in megabytes.
[$sel:totalStorageCapacityInMegaBytes:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Integer

-- | A list of Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) security groups
--   that are associated with the cluster. This parameter is returned only
--   if the cluster is in a VPC.
[$sel:vpcSecurityGroups:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe [VpcSecurityGroupMembership]

-- | An option that specifies whether to create the cluster with enhanced
--   VPC routing enabled. To create a cluster that uses enhanced VPC
--   routing, the cluster must be in a VPC. For more information, see
--   <a>Enhanced VPC Routing</a> in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management
--   Guide.
--   
--   If this option is <tt>true</tt>, enhanced VPC routing is enabled.
--   
--   Default: false
[$sel:enhancedVpcRouting:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Bool

-- | The namespace Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the cluster.
[$sel:clusterNamespaceArn:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Returns the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AllowCancelResize: a boolean value indicating if the resize
--   operation can be cancelled.</li>
--   <li>ResizeType: Returns ClassicResize</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:resizeInfo:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe ResizeInfo

-- | The name of the subnet group that is associated with the cluster. This
--   parameter is valid only when the cluster is in a VPC.
[$sel:clusterSubnetGroupName:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The status of next expected snapshot for clusters having a valid
--   snapshot schedule and backups enabled. Possible values are the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OnTrack - The next snapshot is expected to be taken on time.</li>
--   <li>Pending - The next snapshot is pending to be taken.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:expectedNextSnapshotScheduleTimeStatus:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Describes a group of <tt>DeferredMaintenanceWindow</tt> objects.
[$sel:deferredMaintenanceWindows:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe [DeferredMaintenanceWindow]

-- | The current state of the cluster snapshot schedule.
[$sel:snapshotScheduleState:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe ScheduleState

-- | A boolean value that, if <tt>true</tt>, indicates that data in the
--   cluster is encrypted at rest.
[$sel:encrypted:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Bool

-- | The date and time that the cluster was created.
[$sel:clusterCreateTime:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | A boolean value that, if <tt>true</tt>, indicates that major version
--   upgrades will be applied automatically to the cluster during the
--   maintenance window.
[$sel:allowVersionUpgrade:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Bool

-- | The number of days that automatic cluster snapshots are retained.
[$sel:automatedSnapshotRetentionPeriod:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Int

-- | The status of the elastic IP (EIP) address.
[$sel:elasticIpStatus:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe ElasticIpStatus

-- | A boolean value that, if <tt>true</tt>, indicates that the cluster can
--   be accessed from a public network.
[$sel:publiclyAccessible:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Bool

-- | The admin user name for the cluster. This name is used to connect to
--   the database that is specified in the <b>DBName</b> parameter.
[$sel:masterUsername:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | A unique identifier for the cluster snapshot schedule.
[$sel:snapshotScheduleIdentifier:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that reports whether the Amazon Redshift cluster has finished
--   applying any hardware security module (HSM) settings changes specified
--   in a modify cluster command.
--   
--   Values: active, applying
[$sel:hsmStatus:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe HsmStatus

-- | The Key Management Service (KMS) key ID of the encryption key used to
--   encrypt data in the cluster.
[$sel:kmsKeyId:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The default number of days to retain a manual snapshot. If the value
--   is -1, the snapshot is retained indefinitely. This setting doesn't
--   change the retention period of existing snapshots.
--   
--   The value must be either -1 or an integer between 1 and 3,653.
[$sel:manualSnapshotRetentionPeriod:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Int

-- | The list of cluster parameter groups that are associated with this
--   cluster. Each parameter group in the list is returned with its status.
[$sel:clusterParameterGroups:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe [ClusterParameterGroupStatus]

-- | A value that returns the destination region and retention period that
--   are configured for cross-region snapshot copy.
[$sel:clusterSnapshotCopyStatus:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus

-- | The availability status of the cluster for queries. Possible values
--   are the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Available - The cluster is available for queries.</li>
--   <li>Unavailable - The cluster is not available for queries.</li>
--   <li>Maintenance - The cluster is intermittently available for queries
--   due to maintenance activities.</li>
--   <li>Modifying - The cluster is intermittently available for queries
--   due to changes that modify the cluster.</li>
--   <li>Failed - The cluster failed and is not available for queries.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:clusterAvailabilityStatus:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the Availability Zone in which the cluster is located.
[$sel:availabilityZone:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The status of a modify operation, if any, initiated for the cluster.
[$sel:modifyStatus:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The weekly time range, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC), during
--   which system maintenance can occur.
[$sel:preferredMaintenanceWindow:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The public key for the cluster.
[$sel:clusterPublicKey:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that describes the status of a cluster restore action. This
--   parameter returns null if the cluster was not created by restoring a
--   snapshot.
[$sel:restoreStatus:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe RestoreStatus

-- | The AQUA (Advanced Query Accelerator) configuration of the cluster.
[$sel:aquaConfiguration:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe AquaConfiguration

-- | The list of tags for the cluster.
[$sel:tags:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The nodes in the cluster.
[$sel:clusterNodes:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe [ClusterNode]

-- | The name of the initial database that was created when the cluster was
--   created. This same name is returned for the life of the cluster. If an
--   initial database was not specified, a database named <tt>dev</tt>dev
--   was created by default.
[$sel:dbName:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Describes the status of the Availability Zone relocation operation.
[$sel:availabilityZoneRelocationStatus:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier of the cluster.
[$sel:clusterIdentifier:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of compute nodes in the cluster.
[$sel:numberOfNodes:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Int
[$sel:dataTransferProgress:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe DataTransferProgress

-- | A value that, if present, indicates that changes to the cluster are
--   pending. Specific pending changes are identified by subelements.
[$sel:pendingModifiedValues:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe PendingModifiedValues

-- | The current state of the cluster. Possible values are the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>available</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>available, prep-for-resize</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>available, resize-cleanup</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>cancelling-resize</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>creating</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>deleting</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>final-snapshot</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>hardware-failure</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>incompatible-hsm</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>incompatible-network</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>incompatible-parameters</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>incompatible-restore</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>modifying</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>paused</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>rebooting</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>renaming</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>resizing</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>rotating-keys</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>storage-full</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>updating-hsm</pre></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:clusterStatus:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The connection endpoint.
[$sel:endpoint:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Endpoint

-- | The date and time in UTC when system maintenance can begin.
[$sel:nextMaintenanceWindowStartTime:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The version ID of the Amazon Redshift engine that is running on the
--   cluster.
[$sel:clusterVersion:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of cluster security group that are associated with the cluster.
--   Each security group is represented by an element that contains
--   <tt>ClusterSecurityGroup.Name</tt> and
--   <tt>ClusterSecurityGroup.Status</tt> subelements.
--   
--   Cluster security groups are used when the cluster is not created in an
--   Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC). Clusters that are created in a VPC
--   use VPC security groups, which are listed by the
--   <b>VpcSecurityGroups</b> parameter.
[$sel:clusterSecurityGroups:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe [ClusterSecurityGroupMembership]

-- | The identifier of the VPC the cluster is in, if the cluster is in a
--   VPC.
[$sel:vpcId:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The node type for the nodes in the cluster.
[$sel:nodeType:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time when the next snapshot is expected to be taken for
--   clusters with a valid snapshot schedule and backups enabled.
[$sel:expectedNextSnapshotScheduleTime:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The number of nodes that you can resize the cluster to with the
--   elastic resize method.
[$sel:elasticResizeNumberOfNodeOptions:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the maintenance track for the cluster.
[$sel:maintenanceTrackName:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of Identity and Access Management (IAM) roles that can be used
--   by the cluster to access other Amazon Web Services services.
[$sel:iamRoles:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe [ClusterIamRole]

-- | Cluster operations that are waiting to be started.
[$sel:pendingActions:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The specific revision number of the database in the cluster.
[$sel:clusterRevisionNumber:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

cluster_tags :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The nodes in the cluster.
cluster_clusterNodes :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe [ClusterNode])

-- | The name of the initial database that was created when the cluster was
--   created. This same name is returned for the life of the cluster. If an
--   initial database was not specified, a database named <tt>dev</tt>dev
--   was created by default.
cluster_dbName :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes the status of the Availability Zone relocation operation.
cluster_availabilityZoneRelocationStatus :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier of the cluster.
cluster_clusterIdentifier :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of compute nodes in the cluster.
cluster_numberOfNodes :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Int)

cluster_dataTransferProgress :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe DataTransferProgress)

-- | A value that, if present, indicates that changes to the cluster are
--   pending. Specific pending changes are identified by subelements.
cluster_pendingModifiedValues :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe PendingModifiedValues)

-- | The current state of the cluster. Possible values are the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>available</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>available, prep-for-resize</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>available, resize-cleanup</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>cancelling-resize</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>creating</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>deleting</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>final-snapshot</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>hardware-failure</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>incompatible-hsm</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>incompatible-network</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>incompatible-parameters</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>incompatible-restore</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>modifying</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>paused</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>rebooting</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>renaming</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>resizing</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>rotating-keys</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>storage-full</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>updating-hsm</pre></li>
--   </ul>
cluster_clusterStatus :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The connection endpoint.
cluster_endpoint :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Endpoint)

-- | The date and time in UTC when system maintenance can begin.
cluster_nextMaintenanceWindowStartTime :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The version ID of the Amazon Redshift engine that is running on the
--   cluster.
cluster_clusterVersion :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of cluster security group that are associated with the cluster.
--   Each security group is represented by an element that contains
--   <tt>ClusterSecurityGroup.Name</tt> and
--   <tt>ClusterSecurityGroup.Status</tt> subelements.
--   
--   Cluster security groups are used when the cluster is not created in an
--   Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC). Clusters that are created in a VPC
--   use VPC security groups, which are listed by the
--   <b>VpcSecurityGroups</b> parameter.
cluster_clusterSecurityGroups :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe [ClusterSecurityGroupMembership])

-- | The identifier of the VPC the cluster is in, if the cluster is in a
--   VPC.
cluster_vpcId :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The node type for the nodes in the cluster.
cluster_nodeType :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time when the next snapshot is expected to be taken for
--   clusters with a valid snapshot schedule and backups enabled.
cluster_expectedNextSnapshotScheduleTime :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The number of nodes that you can resize the cluster to with the
--   elastic resize method.
cluster_elasticResizeNumberOfNodeOptions :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the maintenance track for the cluster.
cluster_maintenanceTrackName :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of Identity and Access Management (IAM) roles that can be used
--   by the cluster to access other Amazon Web Services services.
cluster_iamRoles :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe [ClusterIamRole])

-- | Cluster operations that are waiting to be started.
cluster_pendingActions :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe [Text])

-- | The specific revision number of the database in the cluster.
cluster_clusterRevisionNumber :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | An Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that can be used by the
--   associated Amazon Redshift cluster to access other Amazon Web Services
--   services.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newClusterIamRole</a> smart constructor.
data ClusterIamRole
ClusterIamRole' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ClusterIamRole

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role, for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/RedshiftCopyUnload</tt>.
[$sel:iamRoleArn:ClusterIamRole'] :: ClusterIamRole -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that describes the status of the IAM role's association with
--   an Amazon Redshift cluster.
--   
--   The following are possible statuses and descriptions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>in-sync</tt>: The role is available for use by the
--   cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>adding</tt>: The role is in the process of being associated
--   with the cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>removing</tt>: The role is in the process of being
--   disassociated with the cluster.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:applyStatus:ClusterIamRole'] :: ClusterIamRole -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ClusterIamRole</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   the IAM role, for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/RedshiftCopyUnload</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applyStatus:ClusterIamRole'</a>,
--   <a>clusterIamRole_applyStatus</a> - A value that describes the status
--   of the IAM role's association with an Amazon Redshift cluster.
--   
--   The following are possible statuses and descriptions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>in-sync</tt>: The role is available for use by the
--   cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>adding</tt>: The role is in the process of being associated
--   with the cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>removing</tt>: The role is in the process of being
--   disassociated with the cluster.</li>
--   </ul>

-- | Describes the status of a parameter group.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newClusterParameterStatus</a> smart constructor.
data ClusterParameterStatus
ClusterParameterStatus' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ClusterParameterStatus

-- | The status of the parameter that indicates whether the parameter is in
--   sync with the database, waiting for a cluster reboot, or encountered
--   an error when being applied.
--   
--   The following are possible statuses and descriptions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>in-sync</tt>: The parameter value is in sync with the
--   database.</li>
--   <li><tt>pending-reboot</tt>: The parameter value will be applied after
--   the cluster reboots.</li>
--   <li><tt>applying</tt>: The parameter value is being applied to the
--   database.</li>
--   <li><tt>invalid-parameter</tt>: Cannot apply the parameter value
--   because it has an invalid value or syntax.</li>
--   <li><tt>apply-deferred</tt>: The parameter contains static property
--   changes. The changes are deferred until the cluster reboots.</li>
--   <li><tt>apply-error</tt>: Cannot connect to the cluster. The parameter
--   change will be applied after the cluster reboots.</li>
--   <li><tt>unknown-error</tt>: Cannot apply the parameter change right
--   now. The change will be applied after the cluster reboots.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:parameterApplyStatus:ClusterParameterStatus'] :: ClusterParameterStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the parameter.
[$sel:parameterName:ClusterParameterStatus'] :: ClusterParameterStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The error that prevented the parameter from being applied to the
--   database.
[$sel:parameterApplyErrorDescription:ClusterParameterStatus'] :: ClusterParameterStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ClusterParameterStatus</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterApplyStatus:ClusterParameterStatus'</a>,
--   <a>clusterParameterStatus_parameterApplyStatus</a> - The status of the
--   parameter that indicates whether the parameter is in sync with the
--   database, waiting for a cluster reboot, or encountered an error when
--   being applied.
--   
--   The following are possible statuses and descriptions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>in-sync</tt>: The parameter value is in sync with the
--   database.</li>
--   <li><tt>pending-reboot</tt>: The parameter value will be applied after
--   the cluster reboots.</li>
--   <li><tt>applying</tt>: The parameter value is being applied to the
--   database.</li>
--   <li><tt>invalid-parameter</tt>: Cannot apply the parameter value
--   because it has an invalid value or syntax.</li>
--   <li><tt>apply-deferred</tt>: The parameter contains static property
--   changes. The changes are deferred until the cluster reboots.</li>
--   <li><tt>apply-error</tt>: Cannot connect to the cluster. The parameter
--   change will be applied after the cluster reboots.</li>
--   <li><tt>unknown-error</tt>: Cannot apply the parameter change right
--   now. The change will be applied after the cluster reboots.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterName:ClusterParameterStatus'</a>,
--   <a>clusterParameterStatus_parameterName</a> - The name of the
--   parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterApplyErrorDescription:ClusterParameterStatus'</a>,
--   <a>clusterParameterStatus_parameterApplyErrorDescription</a> - The
--   error that prevented the parameter from being applied to the database.
newClusterParameterStatus :: ClusterParameterStatus

-- | The status of the parameter that indicates whether the parameter is in
--   sync with the database, waiting for a cluster reboot, or encountered
--   an error when being applied.
--   
--   The following are possible statuses and descriptions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>in-sync</tt>: The parameter value is in sync with the
--   database.</li>
--   <li><tt>pending-reboot</tt>: The parameter value will be applied after
--   the cluster reboots.</li>
--   <li><tt>applying</tt>: The parameter value is being applied to the
--   database.</li>
--   <li><tt>invalid-parameter</tt>: Cannot apply the parameter value
--   because it has an invalid value or syntax.</li>
--   <li><tt>apply-deferred</tt>: The parameter contains static property
--   changes. The changes are deferred until the cluster reboots.</li>
--   <li><tt>apply-error</tt>: Cannot connect to the cluster. The parameter
--   change will be applied after the cluster reboots.</li>
--   <li><tt>unknown-error</tt>: Cannot apply the parameter change right
--   now. The change will be applied after the cluster reboots.</li>
--   </ul>
clusterParameterStatus_parameterApplyStatus :: Lens' ClusterParameterStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the parameter.
clusterParameterStatus_parameterName :: Lens' ClusterParameterStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | The error that prevented the parameter from being applied to the
--   database.
clusterParameterStatus_parameterApplyErrorDescription :: Lens' ClusterParameterStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes a security group.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newClusterSecurityGroup</a> smart constructor.
data ClusterSecurityGroup
ClusterSecurityGroup' :: Maybe [IPRange] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe [EC2SecurityGroup] -> Maybe Text -> ClusterSecurityGroup

-- | A list of IP ranges (CIDR blocks) that are permitted to access
--   clusters associated with this cluster security group.
[$sel:iPRanges:ClusterSecurityGroup'] :: ClusterSecurityGroup -> Maybe [IPRange]

-- | The name of the cluster security group to which the operation was
--   applied.
[$sel:clusterSecurityGroupName:ClusterSecurityGroup'] :: ClusterSecurityGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of tags for the cluster security group.
[$sel:tags:ClusterSecurityGroup'] :: ClusterSecurityGroup -> Maybe [Tag]

--   associated with this cluster security group.
[$sel:eC2SecurityGroups:ClusterSecurityGroup'] :: ClusterSecurityGroup -> Maybe [EC2SecurityGroup]

-- | A description of the security group.
[$sel:description:ClusterSecurityGroup'] :: ClusterSecurityGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ClusterSecurityGroup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:iPRanges:ClusterSecurityGroup'</a>,
--   <a>clusterSecurityGroup_iPRanges</a> - A list of IP ranges (CIDR
--   blocks) that are permitted to access clusters associated with this
--   cluster security group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterSecurityGroupName:ClusterSecurityGroup'</a>,
--   <a>clusterSecurityGroup_clusterSecurityGroupName</a> - The name of the
--   cluster security group to which the operation was applied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:ClusterSecurityGroup'</a>,
--   <a>clusterSecurityGroup_tags</a> - The list of tags for the cluster
--   security group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eC2SecurityGroups:ClusterSecurityGroup'</a>,
--   <a>clusterSecurityGroup_eC2SecurityGroups</a> - A list of EC2 security
--   groups that are permitted to access clusters associated with this
--   cluster security group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:ClusterSecurityGroup'</a>,
--   <a>clusterSecurityGroup_description</a> - A description of the
--   security group.
newClusterSecurityGroup :: ClusterSecurityGroup

--   clusters associated with this cluster security group.

-- | The name of the cluster security group to which the operation was
--   applied.
clusterSecurityGroup_clusterSecurityGroupName :: Lens' ClusterSecurityGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of tags for the cluster security group.
clusterSecurityGroup_tags :: Lens' ClusterSecurityGroup (Maybe [Tag])

--   associated with this cluster security group.
clusterSecurityGroup_eC2SecurityGroups :: Lens' ClusterSecurityGroup (Maybe [EC2SecurityGroup])

-- | A description of the security group.
clusterSecurityGroup_description :: Lens' ClusterSecurityGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes a cluster security group.
--

-- | Returns the destination region and retention period that are
--   configured for cross-region snapshot copy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newClusterSnapshotCopyStatus</a> smart constructor.
data ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus
ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Integer -> ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus

-- | The destination region that snapshots are automatically copied to when
--   cross-region snapshot copy is enabled.
[$sel:destinationRegion:ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus'] :: ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the snapshot copy grant.
[$sel:snapshotCopyGrantName:ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus'] :: ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of days that automated snapshots are retained in the
--   destination region after they are copied from a source region. If the
--   value is -1, the manual snapshot is retained indefinitely.
--   
--   The value must be either -1 or an integer between 1 and 3,653.
[$sel:manualSnapshotRetentionPeriod:ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus'] :: ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of days that automated snapshots are retained in the
--   destination region after they are copied from a source region.
[$sel:retentionPeriod:ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus'] :: ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationRegion:ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus'</a>,
--   <a>clusterSnapshotCopyStatus_destinationRegion</a> - The destination
--   region that snapshots are automatically copied to when cross-region
--   snapshot copy is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotCopyGrantName:ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus'</a>,
--   <a>clusterSnapshotCopyStatus_snapshotCopyGrantName</a> - The name of
--   the snapshot copy grant.
--   
--   <a>$sel:manualSnapshotRetentionPeriod:ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus'</a>,
--   <a>clusterSnapshotCopyStatus_manualSnapshotRetentionPeriod</a> - The
--   number of days that automated snapshots are retained in the
--   destination region after they are copied from a source region. If the
--   value is -1, the manual snapshot is retained indefinitely.
--   
--   The value must be either -1 or an integer between 1 and 3,653.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retentionPeriod:ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus'</a>,
--   <a>clusterSnapshotCopyStatus_retentionPeriod</a> - The number of days
--   that automated snapshots are retained in the destination region after
--   they are copied from a source region.
newClusterSnapshotCopyStatus :: ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus

-- | The destination region that snapshots are automatically copied to when
--   cross-region snapshot copy is enabled.
clusterSnapshotCopyStatus_destinationRegion :: Lens' ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the snapshot copy grant.
clusterSnapshotCopyStatus_snapshotCopyGrantName :: Lens' ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of days that automated snapshots are retained in the
--   destination region after they are copied from a source region. If the
--   value is -1, the manual snapshot is retained indefinitely.
--   
--   The value must be either -1 or an integer between 1 and 3,653.
clusterSnapshotCopyStatus_manualSnapshotRetentionPeriod :: Lens' ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of days that automated snapshots are retained in the
--   destination region after they are copied from a source region.
clusterSnapshotCopyStatus_retentionPeriod :: Lens' ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus (Maybe Integer)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDataShare</a> smart constructor.
data DataShare
DataShare' :: Maybe [DataShareAssociation] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DataShare

-- | A value that specifies when the datashare has an association between a
--   producer and data consumers.
[$sel:dataShareAssociations:DataShare'] :: DataShare -> Maybe [DataShareAssociation]

-- | A value that specifies whether the datashare can be shared to a
--   publicly accessible cluster.
[$sel:allowPubliclyAccessibleConsumers:DataShare'] :: DataShare -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the producer.
[$sel:producerArn:DataShare'] :: DataShare -> Maybe Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that references the datashare that is
--   owned by a specific namespace of the producer cluster. A datashare ARN
--   is in the
--   <tt>arn:aws:redshift:{region}:{account-id}:{datashare}:{namespace-guid}/{datashare-name}</tt>
--   format.
[$sel:dataShareArn:DataShare'] :: DataShare -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DataShare</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataShareAssociations:DataShare'</a>,
--   <a>dataShare_dataShareAssociations</a> - A value that specifies when
--   the datashare has an association between a producer and data
--   consumers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowPubliclyAccessibleConsumers:DataShare'</a>,
--   <a>dataShare_allowPubliclyAccessibleConsumers</a> - A value that
--   specifies whether the datashare can be shared to a publicly accessible
--   cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:producerArn:DataShare'</a>, <a>dataShare_producerArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the producer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataShareArn:DataShare'</a>, <a>dataShare_dataShareArn</a> -
--   An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that references the datashare that is
--   owned by a specific namespace of the producer cluster. A datashare ARN
--   is in the
--   <tt>arn:aws:redshift:{region}:{account-id}:{datashare}:{namespace-guid}/{datashare-name}</tt>
--   format.
newDataShare :: DataShare

-- | A value that specifies when the datashare has an association between a
--   producer and data consumers.
dataShare_dataShareAssociations :: Lens' DataShare (Maybe [DataShareAssociation])

-- | A value that specifies whether the datashare can be shared to a
--   publicly accessible cluster.
dataShare_allowPubliclyAccessibleConsumers :: Lens' DataShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the producer.
dataShare_producerArn :: Lens' DataShare (Maybe Text)

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that references the datashare that is
--   owned by a specific namespace of the producer cluster. A datashare ARN
--   is in the
--   <tt>arn:aws:redshift:{region}:{account-id}:{datashare}:{namespace-guid}/{datashare-name}</tt>
--   format.
dataShare_dataShareArn :: Lens' DataShare (Maybe Text)

-- | The association of a datashare from a producer account with a data
--   consumer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDataShareAssociation</a> smart constructor.
data DataShareAssociation
DataShareAssociation' :: Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe DataShareStatus -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> DataShareAssociation

[$sel:createdDate:DataShareAssociation'] :: DataShareAssociation -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The status of the datashare that is associated.

-- | The status change data of the datashare that is associated.
[$sel:statusChangeDate:DataShareAssociation'] :: DataShareAssociation -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The name of the consumer accounts that have an association with a
--   producer datashare.
[$sel:consumerIdentifier:DataShareAssociation'] :: DataShareAssociation -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DataShareAssociation</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   datashare that is associated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:DataShareAssociation'</a>,
--   <a>dataShareAssociation_status</a> - The status of the datashare that
--   is associated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusChangeDate:DataShareAssociation'</a>,
--   <a>dataShareAssociation_statusChangeDate</a> - The status change data
--   of the datashare that is associated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:consumerIdentifier:DataShareAssociation'</a>,
--   <a>dataShareAssociation_consumerIdentifier</a> - The name of the
--   consumer accounts that have an association with a producer datashare.
newDataShareAssociation :: DataShareAssociation

-- | The creation date of the datashare that is associated.
dataShareAssociation_createdDate :: Lens' DataShareAssociation (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The status of the datashare that is associated.
dataShareAssociation_status :: Lens' DataShareAssociation (Maybe DataShareStatus)

-- | The status change data of the datashare that is associated.
dataShareAssociation_statusChangeDate :: Lens' DataShareAssociation (Maybe UTCTime)

--   producer datashare.
dataShareAssociation_consumerIdentifier :: Lens' DataShareAssociation (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes the status of a cluster while it is in the process of
--   resizing with an incremental resize.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDataTransferProgress</a> smart constructor.
data DataTransferProgress
DataTransferProgress' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> DataTransferProgress

-- | Describes the status of the cluster. While the transfer is in progress
--   the status is <tt>transferringdata</tt>.
[$sel:status:DataTransferProgress'] :: DataTransferProgress -> Maybe Text

-- | Describes the estimated number of seconds remaining to complete the
--   transfer.
[$sel:estimatedTimeToCompletionInSeconds:DataTransferProgress'] :: DataTransferProgress -> Maybe Integer

-- | Describes the total amount of data that has been transfered in MB's.
[$sel:dataTransferredInMegaBytes:DataTransferProgress'] :: DataTransferProgress -> Maybe Integer

-- | Describes the data transfer rate in MB's per second.
[$sel:currentRateInMegaBytesPerSecond:DataTransferProgress'] :: DataTransferProgress -> Maybe Double

-- | Describes the number of seconds that have elapsed during the data
--   transfer.
[$sel:elapsedTimeInSeconds:DataTransferProgress'] :: DataTransferProgress -> Maybe Integer

-- | Describes the total amount of data to be transfered in megabytes.
[$sel:totalDataInMegaBytes:DataTransferProgress'] :: DataTransferProgress -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>DataTransferProgress</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:DataTransferProgress'</a>,
--   <a>dataTransferProgress_status</a> - Describes the status of the
--   cluster. While the transfer is in progress the status is
--   <tt>transferringdata</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:estimatedTimeToCompletionInSeconds:DataTransferProgress'</a>,
--   <a>dataTransferProgress_estimatedTimeToCompletionInSeconds</a> -
--   Describes the estimated number of seconds remaining to complete the
--   transfer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataTransferredInMegaBytes:DataTransferProgress'</a>,
--   <a>dataTransferProgress_dataTransferredInMegaBytes</a> - Describes the
--   total amount of data that has been transfered in MB's.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentRateInMegaBytesPerSecond:DataTransferProgress'</a>,
--   <a>dataTransferProgress_currentRateInMegaBytesPerSecond</a> -
--   Describes the data transfer rate in MB's per second.
--   
--   <a>$sel:elapsedTimeInSeconds:DataTransferProgress'</a>,
--   <a>dataTransferProgress_elapsedTimeInSeconds</a> - Describes the
--   number of seconds that have elapsed during the data transfer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalDataInMegaBytes:DataTransferProgress'</a>,
--   <a>dataTransferProgress_totalDataInMegaBytes</a> - Describes the total
--   amount of data to be transfered in megabytes.
newDataTransferProgress :: DataTransferProgress

--   the status is <tt>transferringdata</tt>.

--   transfer.

-- | Describes the total amount of data that has been transfered in MB's.

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteClusterSnapshotMessage</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteClusterSnapshotMessage
DeleteClusterSnapshotMessage' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> DeleteClusterSnapshotMessage

-- | The unique identifier of the cluster the snapshot was created from.
--   This parameter is required if your IAM user has a policy containing a
--   snapshot resource element that specifies anything other than * for the
--   cluster name.
--   
--   Constraints: Must be the name of valid cluster.
[$sel:snapshotClusterIdentifier:DeleteClusterSnapshotMessage'] :: DeleteClusterSnapshotMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier of the manual snapshot to be deleted.
--   
--   Constraints: Must be the name of an existing snapshot that is in the
--   <tt>available</tt>, <tt>failed</tt>, or <tt>cancelled</tt> state.
[$sel:snapshotIdentifier:DeleteClusterSnapshotMessage'] :: DeleteClusterSnapshotMessage -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteClusterSnapshotMessage</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotClusterIdentifier:DeleteClusterSnapshotMessage'</a>,
--   <a>deleteClusterSnapshotMessage_snapshotClusterIdentifier</a> - The
--   unique identifier of the cluster the snapshot was created from. This
--   parameter is required if your IAM user has a policy containing a
--   snapshot resource element that specifies anything other than * for the
--   cluster name.
--   
--   Constraints: Must be the name of valid cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotIdentifier:DeleteClusterSnapshotMessage'</a>,
--   <a>deleteClusterSnapshotMessage_snapshotIdentifier</a> - The unique
--   identifier of the manual snapshot to be deleted.
--   
--   Constraints: Must be the name of an existing snapshot that is in the
--   <tt>available</tt>, <tt>failed</tt>, or <tt>cancelled</tt> state.
newDeleteClusterSnapshotMessage :: Text -> DeleteClusterSnapshotMessage

-- | The unique identifier of the cluster the snapshot was created from.
--   This parameter is required if your IAM user has a policy containing a
--   snapshot resource element that specifies anything other than * for the
--   cluster name.
--   
--   Constraints: Must be the name of valid cluster.
deleteClusterSnapshotMessage_snapshotClusterIdentifier :: Lens' DeleteClusterSnapshotMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier of the manual snapshot to be deleted.
--   
--   Constraints: Must be the name of an existing snapshot that is in the
--   <tt>available</tt>, <tt>failed</tt>, or <tt>cancelled</tt> state.
deleteClusterSnapshotMessage_snapshotIdentifier :: Lens' DeleteClusterSnapshotMessage Text

-- | Describes an endpoint authorization for authorizing Redshift-managed
--   VPC endpoint access to a cluster across Amazon Web Services accounts.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointAuthorization</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointAuthorization
EndpointAuthorization' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe AuthorizationStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> EndpointAuthorization

-- | Indicates whether all VPCs in the grantee account are allowed access
--   to the cluster.
[$sel:allowedAllVPCs:EndpointAuthorization'] :: EndpointAuthorization -> Maybe Bool

-- | The status of the authorization action.
[$sel:status:EndpointAuthorization'] :: EndpointAuthorization -> Maybe AuthorizationStatus

-- | The cluster identifier.
[$sel:clusterIdentifier:EndpointAuthorization'] :: EndpointAuthorization -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services account ID of the grantee of the cluster.
[$sel:grantee:EndpointAuthorization'] :: EndpointAuthorization -> Maybe Text

-- | The time (UTC) when the authorization was created.
[$sel:authorizeTime:EndpointAuthorization'] :: EndpointAuthorization -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The VPCs allowed access to the cluster.
[$sel:allowedVPCs:EndpointAuthorization'] :: EndpointAuthorization -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The status of the cluster.
[$sel:clusterStatus:EndpointAuthorization'] :: EndpointAuthorization -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services account ID of the cluster owner.
[$sel:grantor:EndpointAuthorization'] :: EndpointAuthorization -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of Redshift-managed VPC endpoints created for the
--   authorization.
[$sel:endpointCount:EndpointAuthorization'] :: EndpointAuthorization -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>EndpointAuthorization</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   VPCs in the grantee account are allowed access to the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:EndpointAuthorization'</a>,
--   <a>endpointAuthorization_status</a> - The status of the authorization
--   action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterIdentifier:EndpointAuthorization'</a>,
--   <a>endpointAuthorization_clusterIdentifier</a> - The cluster
--   identifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:grantee:EndpointAuthorization'</a>,
--   <a>endpointAuthorization_grantee</a> - The Amazon Web Services account
--   ID of the grantee of the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authorizeTime:EndpointAuthorization'</a>,

--   authorization was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowedVPCs:EndpointAuthorization'</a>,

--   the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterStatus:EndpointAuthorization'</a>,

--   cluster.

--   <a>$sel:grantor:EndpointAuthorization'</a>,

--   ID of the cluster owner.
--

--   <a>endpointAuthorization_endpointCount</a> - The number of
--   Redshift-managed VPC endpoints created for the authorization.

-- | Describes event subscriptions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventSubscription</a> smart constructor.
data EventSubscription
EventSubscription' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> EventSubscription

-- | The name of the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription.
[$sel:custSubscriptionId:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe Text

-- | The status of the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Can be one of the following: active | no-permission |
--   topic-not-exist</li>
--   <li>The status "no-permission" indicates that Amazon Redshift no
--   longer has permission to post to the Amazon SNS topic. The status
--   "topic-not-exist" indicates that the topic was deleted after the
--   subscription was created.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of the sources that publish events to the Amazon Redshift event
--   notification subscription.
[$sel:sourceIdsList:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The event severity specified in the Amazon Redshift event notification
--   subscription.
--   
--   Values: ERROR, INFO
[$sel:severity:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of Amazon Redshift event categories specified in the event
--   notification subscription.
--   
--   Values: Configuration, Management, Monitoring, Security, Pending
[$sel:eventCategoriesList:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A boolean value indicating whether the subscription is enabled;
--   <tt>true</tt> indicates that the subscription is enabled.
[$sel:enabled:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe Bool

-- | The date and time the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription
--   was created.
[$sel:subscriptionCreationTime:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The Amazon Web Services account associated with the Amazon Redshift
--   event notification subscription.
[$sel:customerAwsId:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of tags for the event subscription.
[$sel:tags:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The source type of the events returned by the Amazon Redshift event
--   notification, such as cluster, cluster-snapshot,
--   cluster-parameter-group, cluster-security-group, or scheduled-action.
[$sel:sourceType:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic used by the
--   event notification subscription.
[$sel:snsTopicArn:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EventSubscription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:custSubscriptionId:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_custSubscriptionId</a> - The name of the Amazon
--   Redshift event notification subscription.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:EventSubscription'</a>, <a>eventSubscription_status</a>
--   - The status of the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Can be one of the following: active | no-permission |
--   topic-not-exist</li>
--   <li>The status "no-permission" indicates that Amazon Redshift no
--   longer has permission to post to the Amazon SNS topic. The status
--   "topic-not-exist" indicates that the topic was deleted after the
--   subscription was created.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceIdsList:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_sourceIdsList</a> - A list of the sources that
--   publish events to the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription.
--   
--   <a>$sel:severity:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_severity</a> - The event severity specified in
--   the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription.
--   
--   Values: ERROR, INFO
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventCategoriesList:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_eventCategoriesList</a> - The list of Amazon
--   Redshift event categories specified in the event notification
--   subscription.
--   
--   Values: Configuration, Management, Monitoring, Security, Pending
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_enabled</a> - A boolean value indicating whether
--   the subscription is enabled; <tt>true</tt> indicates that the
--   subscription is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subscriptionCreationTime:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_subscriptionCreationTime</a> - The date and time
--   the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customerAwsId:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_customerAwsId</a> - The Amazon Web Services
--   account associated with the Amazon Redshift event notification
--   subscription.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:EventSubscription'</a>, <a>eventSubscription_tags</a> -
--   The list of tags for the event subscription.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceType:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_sourceType</a> - The source type of the events
--   returned by the Amazon Redshift event notification, such as cluster,
--   cluster-snapshot, cluster-parameter-group, cluster-security-group, or
--   scheduled-action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snsTopicArn:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_snsTopicArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the Amazon SNS topic used by the event notification subscription.
newEventSubscription :: EventSubscription

-- | The name of the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription.
eventSubscription_custSubscriptionId :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Can be one of the following: active | no-permission |
--   topic-not-exist</li>
--   <li>The status "no-permission" indicates that Amazon Redshift no
--   longer has permission to post to the Amazon SNS topic. The status
--   "topic-not-exist" indicates that the topic was deleted after the
--   subscription was created.</li>
--   </ul>
eventSubscription_status :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of the sources that publish events to the Amazon Redshift event
--   notification subscription.
eventSubscription_sourceIdsList :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe [Text])

-- | The event severity specified in the Amazon Redshift event notification
--   subscription.
--   
--   Values: ERROR, INFO
eventSubscription_severity :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of Amazon Redshift event categories specified in the event
--   notification subscription.
--   
--   Values: Configuration, Management, Monitoring, Security, Pending
eventSubscription_eventCategoriesList :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe [Text])

-- | A boolean value indicating whether the subscription is enabled;
--   <tt>true</tt> indicates that the subscription is enabled.
eventSubscription_enabled :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Bool)

-- | The date and time the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription
--   was created.
eventSubscription_subscriptionCreationTime :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Amazon Web Services account associated with the Amazon Redshift
--   event notification subscription.
eventSubscription_customerAwsId :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of tags for the event subscription.
eventSubscription_tags :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The source type of the events returned by the Amazon Redshift event
--   notification, such as cluster, cluster-snapshot,
--   cluster-parameter-group, cluster-security-group, or scheduled-action.
eventSubscription_sourceType :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic used by the
--   event notification subscription.
eventSubscription_snsTopicArn :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | Returns information about an HSM client certificate. The certificate
--   is stored in a secure Hardware Storage Module (HSM), and used by the
--   Amazon Redshift cluster to encrypt data files.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHsmClientCertificate</a> smart constructor.
data HsmClientCertificate
HsmClientCertificate' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> HsmClientCertificate

-- | The public key that the Amazon Redshift cluster will use to connect to
--   the HSM. You must register the public key in the HSM.
[$sel:hsmClientCertificatePublicKey:HsmClientCertificate'] :: HsmClientCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the HSM client certificate.
[$sel:hsmClientCertificateIdentifier:HsmClientCertificate'] :: HsmClientCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of tags for the HSM client certificate.
[$sel:tags:HsmClientCertificate'] :: HsmClientCertificate -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>HsmClientCertificate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsmClientCertificatePublicKey:HsmClientCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>hsmClientCertificate_hsmClientCertificatePublicKey</a> - The public
--   key that the Amazon Redshift cluster will use to connect to the HSM.
--   You must register the public key in the HSM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsmClientCertificateIdentifier:HsmClientCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>hsmClientCertificate_hsmClientCertificateIdentifier</a> - The
--   identifier of the HSM client certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:HsmClientCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>hsmClientCertificate_tags</a> - The list of tags for the HSM client
--   certificate.
newHsmClientCertificate :: HsmClientCertificate

--   the HSM. You must register the public key in the HSM.

hsmClientCertificate_tags :: Lens' HsmClientCertificate (Maybe [Tag])

-- | Returns information about an HSM configuration, which is an object
--   that describes to Amazon Redshift clusters the information they
--   require to connect to an HSM where they can store database encryption
--   keys.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHsmConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data HsmConfiguration
HsmConfiguration' :: Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> HsmConfiguration

-- | The list of tags for the HSM configuration.
[$sel:tags:HsmConfiguration'] :: HsmConfiguration -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The IP address that the Amazon Redshift cluster must use to access the
--   HSM.
[$sel:hsmIpAddress:HsmConfiguration'] :: HsmConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | A text description of the HSM configuration.
[$sel:description:HsmConfiguration'] :: HsmConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the partition in the HSM where the Amazon Redshift
--   clusters will store their database encryption keys.
[$sel:hsmPartitionName:HsmConfiguration'] :: HsmConfiguration -> Maybe Text

[$sel:hsmConfigurationIdentifier:HsmConfiguration'] :: HsmConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>HsmConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:HsmConfiguration'</a>, <a>hsmConfiguration_tags</a> - The
--   list of tags for the HSM configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsmIpAddress:HsmConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>hsmConfiguration_hsmIpAddress</a> - The IP address that the Amazon
--   Redshift cluster must use to access the HSM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:HsmConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>hsmConfiguration_description</a> - A text description of the HSM
--   configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsmPartitionName:HsmConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>hsmConfiguration_hsmPartitionName</a> - The name of the partition
--   in the HSM where the Amazon Redshift clusters will store their
--   database encryption keys.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsmConfigurationIdentifier:HsmConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>hsmConfiguration_hsmConfigurationIdentifier</a> - The name of the
--   Amazon Redshift HSM configuration.
newHsmConfiguration :: HsmConfiguration

hsmConfiguration_tags :: Lens' HsmConfiguration (Maybe [Tag])

--   HSM.

--   clusters will store their database encryption keys.
hsmConfiguration_hsmPartitionName :: Lens' HsmConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the Amazon Redshift HSM configuration.
hsmConfiguration_hsmConfigurationIdentifier :: Lens' HsmConfiguration (Maybe Text)

--   Values: active, applying

--   Values: active, applying

--   <a>hsmStatus_hsmClientCertificateIdentifier</a> - Specifies the name
--   of the HSM client certificate the Amazon Redshift cluster uses to
--   retrieve the data encryption keys stored in an HSM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsmConfigurationIdentifier:HsmStatus'</a>,
--   <a>hsmStatus_hsmConfigurationIdentifier</a> - Specifies the name of
--   the HSM configuration that contains the information the Amazon
--   Redshift cluster can use to retrieve and store keys in an HSM.

-- | Describes the status of logging for a cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLoggingStatus</a> smart constructor.
data LoggingStatus
LoggingStatus' :: Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> LoggingStatus

-- | The last time that logs were delivered.
[$sel:lastSuccessfulDeliveryTime:LoggingStatus'] :: LoggingStatus -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The name of the S3 bucket where the log files are stored.
[$sel:bucketName:LoggingStatus'] :: LoggingStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | <tt>true</tt> if logging is on, <tt>false</tt> if logging is off.
[$sel:loggingEnabled:LoggingStatus'] :: LoggingStatus -> Maybe Bool

-- | The prefix applied to the log file names.
[$sel:s3KeyPrefix:LoggingStatus'] :: LoggingStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The last time when logs failed to be delivered.
[$sel:lastFailureTime:LoggingStatus'] :: LoggingStatus -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The message indicating that logs failed to be delivered.
[$sel:lastFailureMessage:LoggingStatus'] :: LoggingStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>LoggingStatus</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   logs were delivered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketName:LoggingStatus'</a>, <a>loggingStatus_bucketName</a>
--   - The name of the S3 bucket where the log files are stored.
--   
--   <a>$sel:loggingEnabled:LoggingStatus'</a>,
--   <a>loggingStatus_loggingEnabled</a> - <tt>true</tt> if logging is on,
--   <tt>false</tt> if logging is off.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3KeyPrefix:LoggingStatus'</a>,
--   <a>loggingStatus_s3KeyPrefix</a> - The prefix applied to the log file
--   names.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastFailureTime:LoggingStatus'</a>,
--   <a>loggingStatus_lastFailureTime</a> - The last time when logs failed
--   to be delivered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastFailureMessage:LoggingStatus'</a>,
--   <a>loggingStatus_lastFailureMessage</a> - The message indicating that
--   logs failed to be delivered.
newLoggingStatus :: LoggingStatus

-- | The last time that logs were delivered.
loggingStatus_lastSuccessfulDeliveryTime :: Lens' LoggingStatus (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the S3 bucket where the log files are stored.
loggingStatus_bucketName :: Lens' LoggingStatus (Maybe Text)

loggingStatus_loggingEnabled :: Lens' LoggingStatus (Maybe Bool)

-- | The prefix applied to the log file names.
loggingStatus_s3KeyPrefix :: Lens' LoggingStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | The last time when logs failed to be delivered.
loggingStatus_lastFailureTime :: Lens' LoggingStatus (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The message indicating that logs failed to be delivered.
loggingStatus_lastFailureMessage :: Lens' LoggingStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | Defines a maintenance track that determines which Amazon Redshift
--   version to apply during a maintenance window. If the value for
--   <tt>MaintenanceTrack</tt> is <tt>current</tt>, the cluster is updated
--   to the most recently certified maintenance release. If the value is
--   <tt>trailing</tt>, the cluster is updated to the previously certified
--   maintenance release.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMaintenanceTrack</a> smart constructor.
data MaintenanceTrack
MaintenanceTrack' :: Maybe [UpdateTarget] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> MaintenanceTrack

-- | An array of UpdateTarget objects to update with the maintenance track.
[$sel:updateTargets:MaintenanceTrack'] :: MaintenanceTrack -> Maybe [UpdateTarget]

-- | The version number for the cluster release.
[$sel:databaseVersion:MaintenanceTrack'] :: MaintenanceTrack -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the maintenance track. Possible values are
--   <tt>current</tt> and <tt>trailing</tt>.
[$sel:maintenanceTrackName:MaintenanceTrack'] :: MaintenanceTrack -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MaintenanceTrack</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:updateTargets:MaintenanceTrack'</a>,
--   <a>maintenanceTrack_updateTargets</a> - An array of UpdateTarget
--   objects to update with the maintenance track.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseVersion:MaintenanceTrack'</a>,
--   <a>maintenanceTrack_databaseVersion</a> - The version number for the
--   cluster release.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maintenanceTrackName:MaintenanceTrack'</a>,
--   <a>maintenanceTrack_maintenanceTrackName</a> - The name of the
--   maintenance track. Possible values are <tt>current</tt> and
--   <tt>trailing</tt>.
newMaintenanceTrack :: MaintenanceTrack

-- | An array of UpdateTarget objects to update with the maintenance track.
maintenanceTrack_updateTargets :: Lens' MaintenanceTrack (Maybe [UpdateTarget])

-- | The version number for the cluster release.
maintenanceTrack_databaseVersion :: Lens' MaintenanceTrack (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the maintenance track. Possible values are
--   <tt>current</tt> and <tt>trailing</tt>.
maintenanceTrack_maintenanceTrackName :: Lens' MaintenanceTrack (Maybe Text)

-- | A set of elements to filter the returned node configurations.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNodeConfigurationOptionsFilter</a> smart
--   constructor.
data NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter
NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe OperatorType -> Maybe NodeConfigurationOptionsFilterName -> NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter

-- | List of values. Compare Name using Operator to Values. If filter Name
--   is NumberOfNodes, then values can range from 0 to 200. If filter Name
--   is EstimatedDiskUtilizationPercent, then values can range from 0 to
--   100. For example, filter NumberOfNodes (name) GT (operator) 3
--   (values).
[$sel:values:NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter'] :: NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The filter operator. If filter Name is NodeType only the 'in' operator
--   is supported. Provide one value to evaluate for 'eq', 'lt', 'le',
--   'gt', and 'ge'. Provide two values to evaluate for 'between'. Provide
--   a list of values for 'in'.
[$sel:operator:NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter'] :: NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter -> Maybe OperatorType

-- | The name of the element to filter.
[$sel:name:NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter'] :: NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter -> Maybe NodeConfigurationOptionsFilterName

-- | Create a value of <a>NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter'</a>,
--   <a>nodeConfigurationOptionsFilter_values</a> - List of values. Compare
--   Name using Operator to Values. If filter Name is NumberOfNodes, then
--   values can range from 0 to 200. If filter Name is
--   EstimatedDiskUtilizationPercent, then values can range from 0 to 100.
--   For example, filter NumberOfNodes (name) GT (operator) 3 (values).
--   
--   <a>$sel:operator:NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter'</a>,
--   <a>nodeConfigurationOptionsFilter_operator</a> - The filter operator.
--   If filter Name is NodeType only the 'in' operator is supported.
--   Provide one value to evaluate for 'eq', 'lt', 'le', 'gt', and 'ge'.
--   Provide two values to evaluate for 'between'. Provide a list of values
--   for 'in'.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter'</a>,
--   <a>nodeConfigurationOptionsFilter_name</a> - The name of the element
--   to filter.
newNodeConfigurationOptionsFilter :: NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter

-- | List of values. Compare Name using Operator to Values. If filter Name
--   is NumberOfNodes, then values can range from 0 to 200. If filter Name
--   is EstimatedDiskUtilizationPercent, then values can range from 0 to
--   100. For example, filter NumberOfNodes (name) GT (operator) 3
--   (values).
nodeConfigurationOptionsFilter_values :: Lens' NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter (Maybe [Text])

-- | The filter operator. If filter Name is NodeType only the 'in' operator
--   is supported. Provide one value to evaluate for 'eq', 'lt', 'le',
--   'gt', and 'ge'. Provide two values to evaluate for 'between'. Provide
--   a list of values for 'in'.
nodeConfigurationOptionsFilter_operator :: Lens' NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter (Maybe OperatorType)

-- | The name of the element to filter.
nodeConfigurationOptionsFilter_name :: Lens' NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter (Maybe NodeConfigurationOptionsFilterName)

-- | Describes a parameter in a cluster parameter group.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newParameter</a> smart constructor.
data Parameter
Parameter' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ParameterApplyType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Parameter

-- | The valid range of values for the parameter.
[$sel:allowedValues:Parameter'] :: Parameter -> Maybe Text

-- | The source of the parameter value, such as "engine-default" or "user".
[$sel:source:Parameter'] :: Parameter -> Maybe Text

-- | The value of the parameter. If <tt>ParameterName</tt> is
--   <tt>wlm_json_configuration</tt>, then the maximum size of
--   <tt>ParameterValue</tt> is 8000 characters.
[$sel:parameterValue:Parameter'] :: Parameter -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies how to apply the WLM configuration parameter. Some
--   properties can be applied dynamically, while other properties require
--   that any associated clusters be rebooted for the configuration changes
--   to be applied. For more information about parameters and parameter
--   groups, go to <a>Amazon Redshift Parameter Groups</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Redshift Cluster Management Guide</i>.
[$sel:applyType:Parameter'] :: Parameter -> Maybe ParameterApplyType

-- | The name of the parameter.
[$sel:parameterName:Parameter'] :: Parameter -> Maybe Text

-- | A description of the parameter.
[$sel:description:Parameter'] :: Parameter -> Maybe Text

-- | The data type of the parameter.
[$sel:dataType:Parameter'] :: Parameter -> Maybe Text

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, the parameter can be modified. Some parameters have
--   security or operational implications that prevent them from being
--   changed.
[$sel:isModifiable:Parameter'] :: Parameter -> Maybe Bool

-- | The earliest engine version to which the parameter can apply.
[$sel:minimumEngineVersion:Parameter'] :: Parameter -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Parameter</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding

--   - The value of the parameter. If <tt>ParameterName</tt> is
--   <tt>wlm_json_configuration</tt>, then the maximum size of
--   <tt>ParameterValue</tt> is 8000 characters.

-- | Describes cluster attributes that are in a pending state. A change to
--   one or more the attributes was requested and is in progress or will be
--   applied.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPendingModifiedValues</a> smart constructor.
data PendingModifiedValues
PendingModifiedValues' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> PendingModifiedValues

-- | An option that specifies whether to create the cluster with enhanced
--   VPC routing enabled. To create a cluster that uses enhanced VPC
--   routing, the cluster must be in a VPC. For more information, see
--   <a>Enhanced VPC Routing</a> in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management
--   Guide.
--   
--   If this option is <tt>true</tt>, enhanced VPC routing is enabled.
--   
--   Default: false
[$sel:enhancedVpcRouting:PendingModifiedValues'] :: PendingModifiedValues -> Maybe Bool

-- | The encryption type for a cluster. Possible values are: KMS and None.
[$sel:encryptionType:PendingModifiedValues'] :: PendingModifiedValues -> Maybe Text

-- | The pending or in-progress change of the automated snapshot retention
--   period.
[$sel:automatedSnapshotRetentionPeriod:PendingModifiedValues'] :: PendingModifiedValues -> Maybe Int

-- | The pending or in-progress change of the admin user password for the
--   cluster.
[$sel:masterUserPassword:PendingModifiedValues'] :: PendingModifiedValues -> Maybe Text

-- | The pending or in-progress change of the ability to connect to the
--   cluster from the public network.
[$sel:publiclyAccessible:PendingModifiedValues'] :: PendingModifiedValues -> Maybe Bool

-- | The pending or in-progress change of the cluster type.
[$sel:clusterType:PendingModifiedValues'] :: PendingModifiedValues -> Maybe Text

-- | The pending or in-progress change of the new identifier for the
--   cluster.
[$sel:clusterIdentifier:PendingModifiedValues'] :: PendingModifiedValues -> Maybe Text

-- | The pending or in-progress change of the number of nodes in the
--   cluster.
[$sel:numberOfNodes:PendingModifiedValues'] :: PendingModifiedValues -> Maybe Int

-- | The pending or in-progress change of the service version.
[$sel:clusterVersion:PendingModifiedValues'] :: PendingModifiedValues -> Maybe Text

-- | The pending or in-progress change of the cluster's node type.
[$sel:nodeType:PendingModifiedValues'] :: PendingModifiedValues -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the maintenance track that the cluster will change to
--   during the next maintenance window.
[$sel:maintenanceTrackName:PendingModifiedValues'] :: PendingModifiedValues -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PendingModifiedValues</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

-- | Describes a recurring charge.

--   charge frequency.
