-- | Modifies the settings for a cluster.
--   
--   You can also change node type and the number of nodes to scale up or
--   down the cluster. When resizing a cluster, you must specify both the
--   number of nodes and the node type even if one of the parameters does
--   not change.
--   
--   You can add another security or parameter group, or change the admin
--   user password. Resetting a cluster password or modifying the security
--   groups associated with a cluster do not need a reboot. However,
--   modifying a parameter group requires a reboot for parameters to take
--   effect. For more information about managing clusters, go to <a>Amazon
--   Redshift Clusters</a> in the <i>Amazon Redshift Cluster Management
--   Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.Redshift.ModifyCluster

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newModifyCluster</a> smart constructor.
data ModifyCluster
ModifyCluster' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> ModifyCluster

-- | An option that specifies whether to create the cluster with enhanced
--   VPC routing enabled. To create a cluster that uses enhanced VPC
--   routing, the cluster must be in a VPC. For more information, see
--   <a>Enhanced VPC Routing</a> in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management
--   Guide.
--   
--   If this option is <tt>true</tt>, enhanced VPC routing is enabled.
--   
--   Default: false
[$sel:enhancedVpcRouting:ModifyCluster'] :: ModifyCluster -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Elastic IP (EIP) address for the cluster.
--   
--   Constraints: The cluster must be provisioned in EC2-VPC and
--   publicly-accessible through an Internet gateway. For more information
--   about provisioning clusters in EC2-VPC, go to <a>Supported Platforms
--   to Launch Your Cluster</a> in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management
--   Guide.
[$sel:elasticIp:ModifyCluster'] :: ModifyCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the name of the HSM client certificate the Amazon Redshift
--   cluster uses to retrieve the data encryption keys stored in an HSM.
[$sel:hsmClientCertificateIdentifier:ModifyCluster'] :: ModifyCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates whether the cluster is encrypted. If the value is encrypted
--   (true) and you provide a value for the <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> parameter, we
--   encrypt the cluster with the provided <tt>KmsKeyId</tt>. If you don't
--   provide a <tt>KmsKeyId</tt>, we encrypt with the default key.
--   
--   If the value is not encrypted (false), then the cluster is decrypted.
[$sel:encrypted:ModifyCluster'] :: ModifyCluster -> Maybe Bool

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, major version upgrades will be applied automatically
--   to the cluster during the maintenance window.
--   
--   Default: <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:allowVersionUpgrade:ModifyCluster'] :: ModifyCluster -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the cluster parameter group to apply to this cluster. This
--   change is applied only after the cluster is rebooted. To reboot a
--   cluster use RebootCluster.
--   
--   Default: Uses existing setting.
--   
--   Constraints: The cluster parameter group must be in the same parameter
--   group family that matches the cluster version.
[$sel:clusterParameterGroupName:ModifyCluster'] :: ModifyCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of days that automated snapshots are retained. If the value
--   is 0, automated snapshots are disabled. Even if automated snapshots
--   are disabled, you can still create manual snapshots when you want with
--   CreateClusterSnapshot.
--   
--   If you decrease the automated snapshot retention period from its
--   current value, existing automated snapshots that fall outside of the
--   new retention period will be immediately deleted.
--   
--   You can't disable automated snapshots for RA3 node types. Set the
--   automated retention period from 1-35 days.
--   
--   Default: Uses existing setting.
--   
--   Constraints: Must be a value from 0 to 35.
[$sel:automatedSnapshotRetentionPeriod:ModifyCluster'] :: ModifyCluster -> Maybe Int

-- | The option to enable relocation for an Amazon Redshift cluster between
--   Availability Zones after the cluster modification is complete.
[$sel:availabilityZoneRelocation:ModifyCluster'] :: ModifyCluster -> Maybe Bool

-- | The new identifier for the cluster.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain from 1 to 63 alphanumeric characters or hyphens.</li>
--   <li>Alphabetic characters must be lowercase.</li>
--   <li>First character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   <li>Must be unique for all clusters within an Amazon Web Services
--   account.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Example: <tt>examplecluster</tt>
[$sel:newClusterIdentifier':ModifyCluster'] :: ModifyCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The new password for the cluster admin user. This change is
--   asynchronously applied as soon as possible. Between the time of the
--   request and the completion of the request, the
--   <tt>MasterUserPassword</tt> element exists in the
--   <tt>PendingModifiedValues</tt> element of the operation response.
--   
--   Operations never return the password, so this operation provides a way
--   to regain access to the admin user account for a cluster if the
--   password is lost.
--   
--   Default: Uses existing setting.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be between 8 and 64 characters in length.</li>
--   <li>Must contain at least one uppercase letter.</li>
--   <li>Must contain at least one lowercase letter.</li>
--   <li>Must contain one number.</li>
--   <li>Can be any printable ASCII character (ASCII code 33 to 126) except
--   ' (single quote), " (double quote), \, /, @, or space.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:masterUserPassword:ModifyCluster'] :: ModifyCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, the cluster can be accessed from a public network.
--   Only clusters in VPCs can be set to be publicly available.
[$sel:publiclyAccessible:ModifyCluster'] :: ModifyCluster -> Maybe Bool

-- | The new cluster type.
--   
--   When you submit your cluster resize request, your existing cluster
--   goes into a read-only mode. After Amazon Redshift provisions a new
--   cluster based on your resize requirements, there will be outage for a
--   period while the old cluster is deleted and your connection is
--   switched to the new cluster. You can use DescribeResize to track the
--   progress of the resize request.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt> multi-node | single-node </tt>
[$sel:clusterType:ModifyCluster'] :: ModifyCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of virtual private cloud (VPC) security groups to be associated
--   with the cluster. This change is asynchronously applied as soon as
--   possible.
[$sel:vpcSecurityGroupIds:ModifyCluster'] :: ModifyCluster -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The Key Management Service (KMS) key ID of the encryption key that you
--   want to use to encrypt data in the cluster.
[$sel:kmsKeyId:ModifyCluster'] :: ModifyCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The default for number of days that a newly created manual snapshot is
--   retained. If the value is -1, the manual snapshot is retained
--   indefinitely. This value doesn't retroactively change the retention
--   periods of existing manual snapshots.
--   
--   The value must be either -1 or an integer between 1 and 3,653.
--   
--   The default value is -1.
[$sel:manualSnapshotRetentionPeriod:ModifyCluster'] :: ModifyCluster -> Maybe Int

-- | The option to initiate relocation for an Amazon Redshift cluster to
--   the target Availability Zone.
[$sel:availabilityZone:ModifyCluster'] :: ModifyCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The weekly time range (in UTC) during which system maintenance can
--   occur, if necessary. If system maintenance is necessary during the
--   window, it may result in an outage.
--   
--   This maintenance window change is made immediately. If the new
--   maintenance window indicates the current time, there must be at least
--   120 minutes between the current time and end of the window in order to
--   ensure that pending changes are applied.
--   
--   Default: Uses existing setting.
--   
--   Format: ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi, for example
--   <tt>wed:07:30-wed:08:00</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Days: Mon | Tue | Wed | Thu | Fri | Sat | Sun
--   
--   Constraints: Must be at least 30 minutes.
[$sel:preferredMaintenanceWindow:ModifyCluster'] :: ModifyCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The option to change the port of an Amazon Redshift cluster.
[$sel:port:ModifyCluster'] :: ModifyCluster -> Maybe Int

-- | The new number of nodes of the cluster. If you specify a new number of
--   nodes, you must also specify the node type parameter.
--   
--   For more information about resizing clusters, go to <a>Resizing
--   Clusters in Amazon Redshift</a> in the <i>Amazon Redshift Cluster
--   Management Guide</i>.
--   
--   Valid Values: Integer greater than <tt>0</tt>.
[$sel:numberOfNodes:ModifyCluster'] :: ModifyCluster -> Maybe Int

-- | The new version number of the Amazon Redshift engine to upgrade to.
--   
--   For major version upgrades, if a non-default cluster parameter group
--   is currently in use, a new cluster parameter group in the cluster
--   parameter group family for the new version must be specified. The new
--   cluster parameter group can be the default for that cluster parameter
--   group family. For more information about parameters and parameter
--   groups, go to <a>Amazon Redshift Parameter Groups</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Redshift Cluster Management Guide</i>.
--   
--   Example: <tt>1.0</tt>
[$sel:clusterVersion:ModifyCluster'] :: ModifyCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of cluster security groups to be authorized on this cluster.
--   This change is asynchronously applied as soon as possible.
--   
--   Security groups currently associated with the cluster, and not in the
--   list of groups to apply, will be revoked from the cluster.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be 1 to 255 alphanumeric characters or hyphens</li>
--   <li>First character must be a letter</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:clusterSecurityGroups:ModifyCluster'] :: ModifyCluster -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The new node type of the cluster. If you specify a new node type, you
--   must also specify the number of nodes parameter.
--   
--   For more information about resizing clusters, go to <a>Resizing
--   Clusters in Amazon Redshift</a> in the <i>Amazon Redshift Cluster
--   Management Guide</i>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>ds2.xlarge</tt> | <tt>ds2.8xlarge</tt> |
--   <tt>dc1.large</tt> | <tt>dc1.8xlarge</tt> | <tt>dc2.large</tt> |
--   <tt>dc2.8xlarge</tt> | <tt>ra3.xlplus</tt> | <tt>ra3.4xlarge</tt> |
--   <tt>ra3.16xlarge</tt>
[$sel:nodeType:ModifyCluster'] :: ModifyCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the name of the HSM configuration that contains the
--   information the Amazon Redshift cluster can use to retrieve and store
--   keys in an HSM.
[$sel:hsmConfigurationIdentifier:ModifyCluster'] :: ModifyCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The name for the maintenance track that you want to assign for the
--   cluster. This name change is asynchronous. The new track name stays in
--   the <tt>PendingModifiedValues</tt> for the cluster until the next
--   maintenance window. When the maintenance track changes, the cluster is
--   switched to the latest cluster release available for the maintenance
--   track. At this point, the maintenance track name is applied.
[$sel:maintenanceTrackName:ModifyCluster'] :: ModifyCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier of the cluster to be modified.
--   
--   Example: <tt>examplecluster</tt>
[$sel:clusterIdentifier:ModifyCluster'] :: ModifyCluster -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ModifyCluster</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:enhancedVpcRouting:ModifyCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyCluster_enhancedVpcRouting</a> - An option that specifies
--   whether to create the cluster with enhanced VPC routing enabled. To
--   create a cluster that uses enhanced VPC routing, the cluster must be
--   in a VPC. For more information, see <a>Enhanced VPC Routing</a> in the
--   Amazon Redshift Cluster Management Guide.
--   
--   If this option is <tt>true</tt>, enhanced VPC routing is enabled.
--   
--   Default: false
--   
--   <a>$sel:elasticIp:ModifyCluster'</a>, <a>modifyCluster_elasticIp</a> -
--   The Elastic IP (EIP) address for the cluster.
--   
--   Constraints: The cluster must be provisioned in EC2-VPC and
--   publicly-accessible through an Internet gateway. For more information
--   about provisioning clusters in EC2-VPC, go to <a>Supported Platforms
--   to Launch Your Cluster</a> in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management
--   Guide.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsmClientCertificateIdentifier:ModifyCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyCluster_hsmClientCertificateIdentifier</a> - Specifies the
--   name of the HSM client certificate the Amazon Redshift cluster uses to
--   retrieve the data encryption keys stored in an HSM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encrypted:ModifyCluster'</a>, <a>modifyCluster_encrypted</a> -
--   Indicates whether the cluster is encrypted. If the value is encrypted
--   (true) and you provide a value for the <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> parameter, we
--   encrypt the cluster with the provided <tt>KmsKeyId</tt>. If you don't
--   provide a <tt>KmsKeyId</tt>, we encrypt with the default key.
--   
--   If the value is not encrypted (false), then the cluster is decrypted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowVersionUpgrade:ModifyCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyCluster_allowVersionUpgrade</a> - If <tt>true</tt>, major
--   version upgrades will be applied automatically to the cluster during
--   the maintenance window.
--   
--   Default: <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterParameterGroupName:ModifyCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyCluster_clusterParameterGroupName</a> - The name of the
--   cluster parameter group to apply to this cluster. This change is
--   applied only after the cluster is rebooted. To reboot a cluster use
--   RebootCluster.
--   
--   Default: Uses existing setting.
--   
--   Constraints: The cluster parameter group must be in the same parameter
--   group family that matches the cluster version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:automatedSnapshotRetentionPeriod:ModifyCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyCluster_automatedSnapshotRetentionPeriod</a> - The number of
--   days that automated snapshots are retained. If the value is 0,
--   automated snapshots are disabled. Even if automated snapshots are
--   disabled, you can still create manual snapshots when you want with
--   CreateClusterSnapshot.
--   
--   If you decrease the automated snapshot retention period from its
--   current value, existing automated snapshots that fall outside of the
--   new retention period will be immediately deleted.
--   
--   You can't disable automated snapshots for RA3 node types. Set the
--   automated retention period from 1-35 days.
--   
--   Default: Uses existing setting.
--   
--   Constraints: Must be a value from 0 to 35.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZoneRelocation:ModifyCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyCluster_availabilityZoneRelocation</a> - The option to enable
--   relocation for an Amazon Redshift cluster between Availability Zones
--   after the cluster modification is complete.
--   
--   <a>$sel:newClusterIdentifier':ModifyCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyCluster_newClusterIdentifier</a> - The new identifier for the
--   cluster.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain from 1 to 63 alphanumeric characters or hyphens.</li>
--   <li>Alphabetic characters must be lowercase.</li>
--   <li>First character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   <li>Must be unique for all clusters within an Amazon Web Services
--   account.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Example: <tt>examplecluster</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:masterUserPassword:ModifyCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyCluster_masterUserPassword</a> - The new password for the
--   cluster admin user. This change is asynchronously applied as soon as
--   possible. Between the time of the request and the completion of the
--   request, the <tt>MasterUserPassword</tt> element exists in the
--   <tt>PendingModifiedValues</tt> element of the operation response.
--   
--   Operations never return the password, so this operation provides a way
--   to regain access to the admin user account for a cluster if the
--   password is lost.
--   
--   Default: Uses existing setting.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be between 8 and 64 characters in length.</li>
--   <li>Must contain at least one uppercase letter.</li>
--   <li>Must contain at least one lowercase letter.</li>
--   <li>Must contain one number.</li>
--   <li>Can be any printable ASCII character (ASCII code 33 to 126) except
--   ' (single quote), " (double quote), \, /, @, or space.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:publiclyAccessible:ModifyCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyCluster_publiclyAccessible</a> - If <tt>true</tt>, the
--   cluster can be accessed from a public network. Only clusters in VPCs
--   can be set to be publicly available.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterType:ModifyCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyCluster_clusterType</a> - The new cluster type.
--   
--   When you submit your cluster resize request, your existing cluster
--   goes into a read-only mode. After Amazon Redshift provisions a new
--   cluster based on your resize requirements, there will be outage for a
--   period while the old cluster is deleted and your connection is
--   switched to the new cluster. You can use DescribeResize to track the
--   progress of the resize request.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt> multi-node | single-node </tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcSecurityGroupIds:ModifyCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyCluster_vpcSecurityGroupIds</a> - A list of virtual private
--   cloud (VPC) security groups to be associated with the cluster. This
--   change is asynchronously applied as soon as possible.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyId:ModifyCluster'</a>, <a>modifyCluster_kmsKeyId</a> -
--   The Key Management Service (KMS) key ID of the encryption key that you
--   want to use to encrypt data in the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:manualSnapshotRetentionPeriod:ModifyCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyCluster_manualSnapshotRetentionPeriod</a> - The default for
--   number of days that a newly created manual snapshot is retained. If
--   the value is -1, the manual snapshot is retained indefinitely. This
--   value doesn't retroactively change the retention periods of existing
--   manual snapshots.
--   
--   The value must be either -1 or an integer between 1 and 3,653.
--   
--   The default value is -1.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZone:ModifyCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyCluster_availabilityZone</a> - The option to initiate
--   relocation for an Amazon Redshift cluster to the target Availability
--   Zone.
--   
--   <a>$sel:preferredMaintenanceWindow:ModifyCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyCluster_preferredMaintenanceWindow</a> - The weekly time
--   range (in UTC) during which system maintenance can occur, if
--   necessary. If system maintenance is necessary during the window, it
--   may result in an outage.
--   
--   This maintenance window change is made immediately. If the new
--   maintenance window indicates the current time, there must be at least
--   120 minutes between the current time and end of the window in order to
--   ensure that pending changes are applied.
--   
--   Default: Uses existing setting.
--   
--   Format: ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi, for example
--   <tt>wed:07:30-wed:08:00</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Days: Mon | Tue | Wed | Thu | Fri | Sat | Sun
--   
--   Constraints: Must be at least 30 minutes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:ModifyCluster'</a>, <a>modifyCluster_port</a> - The
--   option to change the port of an Amazon Redshift cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfNodes:ModifyCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyCluster_numberOfNodes</a> - The new number of nodes of the
--   cluster. If you specify a new number of nodes, you must also specify
--   the node type parameter.
--   
--   For more information about resizing clusters, go to <a>Resizing
--   Clusters in Amazon Redshift</a> in the <i>Amazon Redshift Cluster
--   Management Guide</i>.
--   
--   Valid Values: Integer greater than <tt>0</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterVersion:ModifyCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyCluster_clusterVersion</a> - The new version number of the
--   Amazon Redshift engine to upgrade to.
--   
--   For major version upgrades, if a non-default cluster parameter group
--   is currently in use, a new cluster parameter group in the cluster
--   parameter group family for the new version must be specified. The new
--   cluster parameter group can be the default for that cluster parameter
--   group family. For more information about parameters and parameter
--   groups, go to <a>Amazon Redshift Parameter Groups</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Redshift Cluster Management Guide</i>.
--   
--   Example: <tt>1.0</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterSecurityGroups:ModifyCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyCluster_clusterSecurityGroups</a> - A list of cluster
--   security groups to be authorized on this cluster. This change is
--   asynchronously applied as soon as possible.
--   
--   Security groups currently associated with the cluster, and not in the
--   list of groups to apply, will be revoked from the cluster.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be 1 to 255 alphanumeric characters or hyphens</li>
--   <li>First character must be a letter</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:nodeType:ModifyCluster'</a>, <a>modifyCluster_nodeType</a> -
--   The new node type of the cluster. If you specify a new node type, you
--   must also specify the number of nodes parameter.
--   
--   For more information about resizing clusters, go to <a>Resizing
--   Clusters in Amazon Redshift</a> in the <i>Amazon Redshift Cluster
--   Management Guide</i>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>ds2.xlarge</tt> | <tt>ds2.8xlarge</tt> |
--   <tt>dc1.large</tt> | <tt>dc1.8xlarge</tt> | <tt>dc2.large</tt> |
--   <tt>dc2.8xlarge</tt> | <tt>ra3.xlplus</tt> | <tt>ra3.4xlarge</tt> |
--   <tt>ra3.16xlarge</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsmConfigurationIdentifier:ModifyCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyCluster_hsmConfigurationIdentifier</a> - Specifies the name
--   of the HSM configuration that contains the information the Amazon
--   Redshift cluster can use to retrieve and store keys in an HSM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maintenanceTrackName:ModifyCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyCluster_maintenanceTrackName</a> - The name for the
--   maintenance track that you want to assign for the cluster. This name
--   change is asynchronous. The new track name stays in the
--   <tt>PendingModifiedValues</tt> for the cluster until the next
--   maintenance window. When the maintenance track changes, the cluster is
--   switched to the latest cluster release available for the maintenance
--   track. At this point, the maintenance track name is applied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterIdentifier:ModifyCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyCluster_clusterIdentifier</a> - The unique identifier of the
--   cluster to be modified.
--   
--   Example: <tt>examplecluster</tt>
newModifyCluster :: Text -> ModifyCluster

-- | An option that specifies whether to create the cluster with enhanced
--   VPC routing enabled. To create a cluster that uses enhanced VPC
--   routing, the cluster must be in a VPC. For more information, see
--   <a>Enhanced VPC Routing</a> in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management
--   Guide.
--   
--   If this option is <tt>true</tt>, enhanced VPC routing is enabled.
--   
--   Default: false
modifyCluster_enhancedVpcRouting :: Lens' ModifyCluster (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Elastic IP (EIP) address for the cluster.
--   
--   Constraints: The cluster must be provisioned in EC2-VPC and
--   publicly-accessible through an Internet gateway. For more information
--   about provisioning clusters in EC2-VPC, go to <a>Supported Platforms
--   to Launch Your Cluster</a> in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management
--   Guide.
modifyCluster_elasticIp :: Lens' ModifyCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the name of the HSM client certificate the Amazon Redshift
--   cluster uses to retrieve the data encryption keys stored in an HSM.
modifyCluster_hsmClientCertificateIdentifier :: Lens' ModifyCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether the cluster is encrypted. If the value is encrypted
--   (true) and you provide a value for the <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> parameter, we
--   encrypt the cluster with the provided <tt>KmsKeyId</tt>. If you don't
--   provide a <tt>KmsKeyId</tt>, we encrypt with the default key.
--   
--   If the value is not encrypted (false), then the cluster is decrypted.
modifyCluster_encrypted :: Lens' ModifyCluster (Maybe Bool)

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, major version upgrades will be applied automatically
--   to the cluster during the maintenance window.
--   
--   Default: <tt>false</tt>
modifyCluster_allowVersionUpgrade :: Lens' ModifyCluster (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the cluster parameter group to apply to this cluster. This
--   change is applied only after the cluster is rebooted. To reboot a
--   cluster use RebootCluster.
--   
--   Default: Uses existing setting.
--   
--   Constraints: The cluster parameter group must be in the same parameter
--   group family that matches the cluster version.
modifyCluster_clusterParameterGroupName :: Lens' ModifyCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of days that automated snapshots are retained. If the value
--   is 0, automated snapshots are disabled. Even if automated snapshots
--   are disabled, you can still create manual snapshots when you want with
--   CreateClusterSnapshot.
--   
--   If you decrease the automated snapshot retention period from its
--   current value, existing automated snapshots that fall outside of the
--   new retention period will be immediately deleted.
--   
--   You can't disable automated snapshots for RA3 node types. Set the
--   automated retention period from 1-35 days.
--   
--   Default: Uses existing setting.
--   
--   Constraints: Must be a value from 0 to 35.
modifyCluster_automatedSnapshotRetentionPeriod :: Lens' ModifyCluster (Maybe Int)

-- | The option to enable relocation for an Amazon Redshift cluster between
--   Availability Zones after the cluster modification is complete.
modifyCluster_availabilityZoneRelocation :: Lens' ModifyCluster (Maybe Bool)

-- | The new identifier for the cluster.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain from 1 to 63 alphanumeric characters or hyphens.</li>
--   <li>Alphabetic characters must be lowercase.</li>
--   <li>First character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   <li>Must be unique for all clusters within an Amazon Web Services
--   account.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Example: <tt>examplecluster</tt>
modifyCluster_newClusterIdentifier :: Lens' ModifyCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The new password for the cluster admin user. This change is
--   asynchronously applied as soon as possible. Between the time of the
--   request and the completion of the request, the
--   <tt>MasterUserPassword</tt> element exists in the
--   <tt>PendingModifiedValues</tt> element of the operation response.
--   
--   Operations never return the password, so this operation provides a way
--   to regain access to the admin user account for a cluster if the
--   password is lost.
--   
--   Default: Uses existing setting.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be between 8 and 64 characters in length.</li>
--   <li>Must contain at least one uppercase letter.</li>
--   <li>Must contain at least one lowercase letter.</li>
--   <li>Must contain one number.</li>
--   <li>Can be any printable ASCII character (ASCII code 33 to 126) except
--   ' (single quote), " (double quote), \, /, @, or space.</li>
--   </ul>
modifyCluster_masterUserPassword :: Lens' ModifyCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, the cluster can be accessed from a public network.
--   Only clusters in VPCs can be set to be publicly available.
modifyCluster_publiclyAccessible :: Lens' ModifyCluster (Maybe Bool)

-- | The new cluster type.
--   
--   When you submit your cluster resize request, your existing cluster
--   goes into a read-only mode. After Amazon Redshift provisions a new
--   cluster based on your resize requirements, there will be outage for a
--   period while the old cluster is deleted and your connection is
--   switched to the new cluster. You can use DescribeResize to track the
--   progress of the resize request.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt> multi-node | single-node </tt>
modifyCluster_clusterType :: Lens' ModifyCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of virtual private cloud (VPC) security groups to be associated
--   with the cluster. This change is asynchronously applied as soon as
--   possible.
modifyCluster_vpcSecurityGroupIds :: Lens' ModifyCluster (Maybe [Text])

-- | The Key Management Service (KMS) key ID of the encryption key that you
--   want to use to encrypt data in the cluster.
modifyCluster_kmsKeyId :: Lens' ModifyCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The default for number of days that a newly created manual snapshot is
--   retained. If the value is -1, the manual snapshot is retained
--   indefinitely. This value doesn't retroactively change the retention
--   periods of existing manual snapshots.
--   
--   The value must be either -1 or an integer between 1 and 3,653.
--   
--   The default value is -1.
modifyCluster_manualSnapshotRetentionPeriod :: Lens' ModifyCluster (Maybe Int)

-- | The option to initiate relocation for an Amazon Redshift cluster to
--   the target Availability Zone.
modifyCluster_availabilityZone :: Lens' ModifyCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The weekly time range (in UTC) during which system maintenance can
--   occur, if necessary. If system maintenance is necessary during the
--   window, it may result in an outage.
--   
--   This maintenance window change is made immediately. If the new
--   maintenance window indicates the current time, there must be at least
--   120 minutes between the current time and end of the window in order to
--   ensure that pending changes are applied.
--   
--   Default: Uses existing setting.
--   
--   Format: ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi, for example
--   <tt>wed:07:30-wed:08:00</tt>.
--   
--   Valid Days: Mon | Tue | Wed | Thu | Fri | Sat | Sun
--   
--   Constraints: Must be at least 30 minutes.
modifyCluster_preferredMaintenanceWindow :: Lens' ModifyCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The option to change the port of an Amazon Redshift cluster.
modifyCluster_port :: Lens' ModifyCluster (Maybe Int)

-- | The new number of nodes of the cluster. If you specify a new number of
--   nodes, you must also specify the node type parameter.
--   
--   For more information about resizing clusters, go to <a>Resizing
--   Clusters in Amazon Redshift</a> in the <i>Amazon Redshift Cluster
--   Management Guide</i>.
--   
--   Valid Values: Integer greater than <tt>0</tt>.
modifyCluster_numberOfNodes :: Lens' ModifyCluster (Maybe Int)

-- | The new version number of the Amazon Redshift engine to upgrade to.
--   
--   For major version upgrades, if a non-default cluster parameter group
--   is currently in use, a new cluster parameter group in the cluster
--   parameter group family for the new version must be specified. The new
--   cluster parameter group can be the default for that cluster parameter
--   group family. For more information about parameters and parameter
--   groups, go to <a>Amazon Redshift Parameter Groups</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Redshift Cluster Management Guide</i>.
--   
--   Example: <tt>1.0</tt>
modifyCluster_clusterVersion :: Lens' ModifyCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of cluster security groups to be authorized on this cluster.
--   This change is asynchronously applied as soon as possible.
--   
--   Security groups currently associated with the cluster, and not in the
--   list of groups to apply, will be revoked from the cluster.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be 1 to 255 alphanumeric characters or hyphens</li>
--   <li>First character must be a letter</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens</li>
--   </ul>
modifyCluster_clusterSecurityGroups :: Lens' ModifyCluster (Maybe [Text])

-- | The new node type of the cluster. If you specify a new node type, you
--   must also specify the number of nodes parameter.
--   
--   For more information about resizing clusters, go to <a>Resizing
--   Clusters in Amazon Redshift</a> in the <i>Amazon Redshift Cluster
--   Management Guide</i>.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>ds2.xlarge</tt> | <tt>ds2.8xlarge</tt> |
--   <tt>dc1.large</tt> | <tt>dc1.8xlarge</tt> | <tt>dc2.large</tt> |
--   <tt>dc2.8xlarge</tt> | <tt>ra3.xlplus</tt> | <tt>ra3.4xlarge</tt> |
--   <tt>ra3.16xlarge</tt>
modifyCluster_nodeType :: Lens' ModifyCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the name of the HSM configuration that contains the
--   information the Amazon Redshift cluster can use to retrieve and store
--   keys in an HSM.
modifyCluster_hsmConfigurationIdentifier :: Lens' ModifyCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The name for the maintenance track that you want to assign for the
--   cluster. This name change is asynchronous. The new track name stays in
--   the <tt>PendingModifiedValues</tt> for the cluster until the next
--   maintenance window. When the maintenance track changes, the cluster is
--   switched to the latest cluster release available for the maintenance
--   track. At this point, the maintenance track name is applied.
modifyCluster_maintenanceTrackName :: Lens' ModifyCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier of the cluster to be modified.
--   
--   Example: <tt>examplecluster</tt>
modifyCluster_clusterIdentifier :: Lens' ModifyCluster Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newModifyClusterResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ModifyClusterResponse
ModifyClusterResponse' :: Maybe Cluster -> Int -> ModifyClusterResponse
[$sel:cluster:ModifyClusterResponse'] :: ModifyClusterResponse -> Maybe Cluster

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ModifyClusterResponse'] :: ModifyClusterResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ModifyClusterResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cluster:ModifyClusterResponse'</a>,
--   <a>modifyClusterResponse_cluster</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ModifyClusterResponse'</a>,
--   <a>modifyClusterResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newModifyClusterResponse :: Int -> ModifyClusterResponse

-- | Undocumented member.
modifyClusterResponse_cluster :: Lens' ModifyClusterResponse (Maybe Cluster)

-- | The response's http status code.
modifyClusterResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ModifyClusterResponse Int

-- | Modifies an authentication profile.
module Network.AWS.Redshift.ModifyAuthenticationProfile

[$sel:authenticationProfileName:ModifyAuthenticationProfile'] :: ModifyAuthenticationProfile -> Text

-- | The new content of the authentication profile in JSON format. The
--   maximum length of the JSON string is determined by a quota for your
--   account.
[$sel:authenticationProfileContent:ModifyAuthenticationProfile'] :: ModifyAuthenticationProfile -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ModifyAuthenticationProfile</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   name of the authentication profile to replace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authenticationProfileContent:ModifyAuthenticationProfile'</a>,
--   <a>modifyAuthenticationProfile_authenticationProfileContent</a> - The
--   new content of the authentication profile in JSON format. The maximum
--   length of the JSON string is determined by a quota for your account.
newModifyAuthenticationProfile :: Text -> Text -> ModifyAuthenticationProfile

-- | The name of the authentication profile to replace.
modifyAuthenticationProfile_authenticationProfileName :: Lens' ModifyAuthenticationProfile Text

-- | The new content of the authentication profile in JSON format. The
--   maximum length of the JSON string is determined by a quota for your
--   account.
modifyAuthenticationProfile_authenticationProfileContent :: Lens' ModifyAuthenticationProfile Text

--   constructor.

-- | Modifies whether a cluster can use AQUA (Advanced Query Accelerator).
module Network.AWS.Redshift.ModifyAquaConfiguration

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newModifyAquaConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data ModifyAquaConfiguration
ModifyAquaConfiguration' :: Maybe AquaConfigurationStatus -> Text -> ModifyAquaConfiguration

-- | The new value of AQUA configuration status. Possible values include
--   the following.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>enabled - Use AQUA if it is available for the current Amazon Web
--   Services Region and Amazon Redshift node type.</li>
--   <li>disabled - Don't use AQUA.</li>
--   <li>auto - Amazon Redshift determines whether to use AQUA.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:aquaConfigurationStatus:ModifyAquaConfiguration'] :: ModifyAquaConfiguration -> Maybe AquaConfigurationStatus

-- | The identifier of the cluster to be modified.
[$sel:clusterIdentifier:ModifyAquaConfiguration'] :: ModifyAquaConfiguration -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ModifyAquaConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:aquaConfigurationStatus:ModifyAquaConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>modifyAquaConfiguration_aquaConfigurationStatus</a> - The new value
--   of AQUA configuration status. Possible values include the following.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>enabled - Use AQUA if it is available for the current Amazon Web
--   Services Region and Amazon Redshift node type.</li>
--   <li>disabled - Don't use AQUA.</li>
--   <li>auto - Amazon Redshift determines whether to use AQUA.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterIdentifier:ModifyAquaConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>modifyAquaConfiguration_clusterIdentifier</a> - The identifier of
--   the cluster to be modified.
newModifyAquaConfiguration :: Text -> ModifyAquaConfiguration

-- | The new value of AQUA configuration status. Possible values include
--   the following.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>enabled - Use AQUA if it is available for the current Amazon Web
--   Services Region and Amazon Redshift node type.</li>
--   <li>disabled - Don't use AQUA.</li>
--   <li>auto - Amazon Redshift determines whether to use AQUA.</li>
--   </ul>
modifyAquaConfiguration_aquaConfigurationStatus :: Lens' ModifyAquaConfiguration (Maybe AquaConfigurationStatus)

-- | The identifier of the cluster to be modified.
modifyAquaConfiguration_clusterIdentifier :: Lens' ModifyAquaConfiguration Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newModifyAquaConfigurationResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ModifyAquaConfigurationResponse
ModifyAquaConfigurationResponse' :: Maybe AquaConfiguration -> Int -> ModifyAquaConfigurationResponse

-- | The updated AQUA configuration of the cluster.
[$sel:aquaConfiguration:ModifyAquaConfigurationResponse'] :: ModifyAquaConfigurationResponse -> Maybe AquaConfiguration

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ModifyAquaConfigurationResponse'] :: ModifyAquaConfigurationResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ModifyAquaConfigurationResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:aquaConfiguration:ModifyAquaConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>modifyAquaConfigurationResponse_aquaConfiguration</a> - The updated
--   AQUA configuration of the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ModifyAquaConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>modifyAquaConfigurationResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's
--   http status code.
newModifyAquaConfigurationResponse :: Int -> ModifyAquaConfigurationResponse

-- | The updated AQUA configuration of the cluster.
modifyAquaConfigurationResponse_aquaConfiguration :: Lens' ModifyAquaConfigurationResponse (Maybe AquaConfiguration)

-- | The response's http status code.
modifyAquaConfigurationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ModifyAquaConfigurationResponse Int

instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Redshift.ModifyAquaConfiguration.ModifyAquaConfiguration

-- | Returns an array of DC2 ReservedNodeOfferings that matches the payment
--   type, term, and usage price of the given DC1 reserved node.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.

-- | Returns a database user name and temporary password with temporary
--   authorization to log on to an Amazon Redshift database. The action
--   returns the database user name prefixed with <tt>IAM:</tt> if
--   <tt>AutoCreate</tt> is <tt>False</tt> or <tt>IAMA:</tt> if
--   <tt>AutoCreate</tt> is <tt>True</tt>. You can optionally specify one
--   or more database user groups that the user will join at log on. By
--   default, the temporary credentials expire in 900 seconds. You can
--   optionally specify a duration between 900 seconds (15 minutes) and
--   3600 seconds (60 minutes). For more information, see <a>Using IAM
--   Authentication to Generate Database User Credentials</a> in the Amazon
--   Redshift Cluster Management Guide.
--   
--   The Identity and Access Management (IAM) user or role that runs
--   GetClusterCredentials must have an IAM policy attached that allows
--   access to all necessary actions and resources. For more information
--   about permissions, see <a>Resource Policies for
--   GetClusterCredentials</a> in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management
--   Guide.
--   
--   If the <tt>DbGroups</tt> parameter is specified, the IAM policy must
--   allow the <tt>redshift:JoinGroup</tt> action with access to the listed
--   <tt>dbgroups</tt>.
--   
--   In addition, if the <tt>AutoCreate</tt> parameter is set to
--   <tt>True</tt>, then the policy must include the
--   <tt>redshift:CreateClusterUser</tt> privilege.
--   
--   If the <tt>DbName</tt> parameter is specified, the IAM policy must
--   allow access to the resource <tt>dbname</tt> for the specified
--   database name.
module Network.AWS.Redshift.GetClusterCredentials

-- | The request parameters to get cluster credentials.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetClusterCredentials</a> smart constructor.
data GetClusterCredentials
GetClusterCredentials' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> Text -> Text -> GetClusterCredentials

-- | A list of the names of existing database groups that the user named in
--   <tt>DbUser</tt> will join for the current session, in addition to any
--   group memberships for an existing user. If not specified, a new user
--   is added only to PUBLIC.
--   
--   Database group name constraints
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be 1 to 64 alphanumeric characters or hyphens</li>
--   <li>Must contain only lowercase letters, numbers, underscore, plus
--   sign, period (dot), at symbol (@), or hyphen.</li>
--   <li>First character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Must not contain a colon ( : ) or slash ( / ).</li>
--   <li>Cannot be a reserved word. A list of reserved words can be found
--   in <a>Reserved Words</a> in the Amazon Redshift Database Developer
--   Guide.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:dbGroups:GetClusterCredentials'] :: GetClusterCredentials -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The name of a database that <tt>DbUser</tt> is authorized to log on
--   to. If <tt>DbName</tt> is not specified, <tt>DbUser</tt> can log on to
--   any existing database.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be 1 to 64 alphanumeric characters or hyphens</li>
--   <li>Must contain only lowercase letters, numbers, underscore, plus
--   sign, period (dot), at symbol (@), or hyphen.</li>
--   <li>First character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Must not contain a colon ( : ) or slash ( / ).</li>
--   <li>Cannot be a reserved word. A list of reserved words can be found
--   in <a>Reserved Words</a> in the Amazon Redshift Database Developer
--   Guide.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:dbName:GetClusterCredentials'] :: GetClusterCredentials -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a database user with the name specified for the user named in
--   <tt>DbUser</tt> if one does not exist.
[$sel:autoCreate:GetClusterCredentials'] :: GetClusterCredentials -> Maybe Bool

-- | The number of seconds until the returned temporary password expires.
--   
--   Constraint: minimum 900, maximum 3600.
--   
--   Default: 900
[$sel:durationSeconds:GetClusterCredentials'] :: GetClusterCredentials -> Maybe Int

-- | The name of a database user. If a user name matching <tt>DbUser</tt>
--   exists in the database, the temporary user credentials have the same
--   permissions as the existing user. If <tt>DbUser</tt> doesn't exist in
--   the database and <tt>Autocreate</tt> is <tt>True</tt>, a new user is
--   created using the value for <tt>DbUser</tt> with PUBLIC permissions.
--   If a database user matching the value for <tt>DbUser</tt> doesn't
--   exist and <tt>Autocreate</tt> is <tt>False</tt>, then the command
--   succeeds but the connection attempt will fail because the user doesn't
--   exist in the database.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>CREATE USER</a> in the Amazon Redshift
--   Database Developer Guide.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be 1 to 64 alphanumeric characters or hyphens. The user name
--   can't be <tt>PUBLIC</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Must contain only lowercase letters, numbers, underscore, plus
--   sign, period (dot), at symbol (@), or hyphen.</li>
--   <li>First character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Must not contain a colon ( : ) or slash ( / ).</li>
--   <li>Cannot be a reserved word. A list of reserved words can be found
--   in <a>Reserved Words</a> in the Amazon Redshift Database Developer
--   Guide.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:dbUser:GetClusterCredentials'] :: GetClusterCredentials -> Text

-- | The unique identifier of the cluster that contains the database for
--   which your are requesting credentials. This parameter is case
--   sensitive.
[$sel:clusterIdentifier:GetClusterCredentials'] :: GetClusterCredentials -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetClusterCredentials</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   PUBLIC.

--   Database group name constraints

-- | Temporary credentials with authorization to log on to an Amazon
--   Redshift database.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetClusterCredentialsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetClusterCredentialsResponse
GetClusterCredentialsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Int -> GetClusterCredentialsResponse

-- | A database user name that is authorized to log on to the database
--   <tt>DbName</tt> using the password <tt>DbPassword</tt>. If the
--   specified DbUser exists in the database, the new user name has the
--   same database privileges as the the user named in DbUser. By default,
--   the user is added to PUBLIC. If the <tt>DbGroups</tt> parameter is
--   specifed, <tt>DbUser</tt> is added to the listed groups for any
--   sessions created using these credentials.
[$sel:dbUser:GetClusterCredentialsResponse'] :: GetClusterCredentialsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time the password in <tt>DbPassword</tt> expires.
[$sel:expiration:GetClusterCredentialsResponse'] :: GetClusterCredentialsResponse -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | A temporary password that authorizes the user name returned by
--   <tt>DbUser</tt> to log on to the database <tt>DbName</tt>.
[$sel:dbPassword:GetClusterCredentialsResponse'] :: GetClusterCredentialsResponse -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetClusterCredentialsResponse'] :: GetClusterCredentialsResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>GetClusterCredentialsResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

--   <a>$sel:dbPassword:GetClusterCredentialsResponse'</a>,

--   <a>getClusterCredentialsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newGetClusterCredentialsResponse :: Int -> GetClusterCredentialsResponse

-- | A database user name that is authorized to log on to the database
--   <tt>DbName</tt> using the password <tt>DbPassword</tt>. If the
--   specified DbUser exists in the database, the new user name has the
--   same database privileges as the the user named in DbUser. By default,
--   the user is added to PUBLIC. If the <tt>DbGroups</tt> parameter is
--   specifed, <tt>DbUser</tt> is added to the listed groups for any
--   sessions created using these credentials.

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.GetClusterCredentials.GetClusterCredentialsResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Redshift.GetClusterCredentials.GetClusterCredentialsResponse

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Redshift.GetClusterCredentials.GetClusterCredentialsResponse

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Redshift.GetClusterCredentials.GetClusterCredentials


-- | Enables the automatic copy of snapshots from one region to another
--   region for a specified cluster.
module Network.AWS.Redshift.EnableSnapshotCopy

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newEnableSnapshotCopy</a> smart constructor.
data EnableSnapshotCopy
EnableSnapshotCopy' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Text -> Text -> EnableSnapshotCopy

-- | The name of the snapshot copy grant to use when snapshots of an Amazon
--   Web Services KMS-encrypted cluster are copied to the destination
--   region.
[$sel:snapshotCopyGrantName:EnableSnapshotCopy'] :: EnableSnapshotCopy -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of days to retain newly copied snapshots in the destination
--   Amazon Web Services Region after they are copied from the source
--   Amazon Web Services Region. If the value is -1, the manual snapshot is
--   retained indefinitely.
--   
--   The value must be either -1 or an integer between 1 and 3,653.
[$sel:manualSnapshotRetentionPeriod:EnableSnapshotCopy'] :: EnableSnapshotCopy -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of days to retain automated snapshots in the destination
--   region after they are copied from the source region.
--   
--   Default: 7.
--   
--   Constraints: Must be at least 1 and no more than 35.
[$sel:retentionPeriod:EnableSnapshotCopy'] :: EnableSnapshotCopy -> Maybe Int

-- | The unique identifier of the source cluster to copy snapshots from.
--   
--   Constraints: Must be the valid name of an existing cluster that does
--   not already have cross-region snapshot copy enabled.
[$sel:clusterIdentifier:EnableSnapshotCopy'] :: EnableSnapshotCopy -> Text

-- | The destination Amazon Web Services Region that you want to copy
--   snapshots to.
--   
--   Constraints: Must be the name of a valid Amazon Web Services Region.
--   For more information, see <a>Regions and Endpoints</a> in the Amazon
--   Web Services General Reference.
[$sel:destinationRegion:EnableSnapshotCopy'] :: EnableSnapshotCopy -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EnableSnapshotCopy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotCopyGrantName:EnableSnapshotCopy'</a>,
--   <a>enableSnapshotCopy_snapshotCopyGrantName</a> - The name of the
--   snapshot copy grant to use when snapshots of an Amazon Web Services
--   KMS-encrypted cluster are copied to the destination region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:manualSnapshotRetentionPeriod:EnableSnapshotCopy'</a>,
--   <a>enableSnapshotCopy_manualSnapshotRetentionPeriod</a> - The number
--   of days to retain newly copied snapshots in the destination Amazon Web
--   Services Region after they are copied from the source Amazon Web
--   Services Region. If the value is -1, the manual snapshot is retained
--   indefinitely.
--   
--   The value must be either -1 or an integer between 1 and 3,653.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retentionPeriod:EnableSnapshotCopy'</a>,
--   <a>enableSnapshotCopy_retentionPeriod</a> - The number of days to
--   retain automated snapshots in the destination region after they are
--   copied from the source region.
--   
--   Default: 7.
--   
--   Constraints: Must be at least 1 and no more than 35.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterIdentifier:EnableSnapshotCopy'</a>,
--   <a>enableSnapshotCopy_clusterIdentifier</a> - The unique identifier of
--   the source cluster to copy snapshots from.
--   
--   Constraints: Must be the valid name of an existing cluster that does
--   not already have cross-region snapshot copy enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationRegion:EnableSnapshotCopy'</a>,
--   <a>enableSnapshotCopy_destinationRegion</a> - The destination Amazon
--   Web Services Region that you want to copy snapshots to.
--   
--   Constraints: Must be the name of a valid Amazon Web Services Region.
--   For more information, see <a>Regions and Endpoints</a> in the Amazon
--   Web Services General Reference.
newEnableSnapshotCopy :: Text -> Text -> EnableSnapshotCopy

-- | The name of the snapshot copy grant to use when snapshots of an Amazon
--   Web Services KMS-encrypted cluster are copied to the destination
--   region.
enableSnapshotCopy_snapshotCopyGrantName :: Lens' EnableSnapshotCopy (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of days to retain newly copied snapshots in the destination
--   Amazon Web Services Region after they are copied from the source
--   Amazon Web Services Region. If the value is -1, the manual snapshot is
--   retained indefinitely.
--   
--   The value must be either -1 or an integer between 1 and 3,653.
enableSnapshotCopy_manualSnapshotRetentionPeriod :: Lens' EnableSnapshotCopy (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of days to retain automated snapshots in the destination
--   region after they are copied from the source region.
--   
--   Default: 7.
--   
--   Constraints: Must be at least 1 and no more than 35.
enableSnapshotCopy_retentionPeriod :: Lens' EnableSnapshotCopy (Maybe Int)

-- | The unique identifier of the source cluster to copy snapshots from.
--   
--   Constraints: Must be the valid name of an existing cluster that does
--   not already have cross-region snapshot copy enabled.
enableSnapshotCopy_clusterIdentifier :: Lens' EnableSnapshotCopy Text

-- | The destination Amazon Web Services Region that you want to copy
--   snapshots to.
--   
--   Constraints: Must be the name of a valid Amazon Web Services Region.
--   For more information, see <a>Regions and Endpoints</a> in the Amazon
--   Web Services General Reference.
enableSnapshotCopy_destinationRegion :: Lens' EnableSnapshotCopy Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newEnableSnapshotCopyResponse</a> smart constructor.
data EnableSnapshotCopyResponse
EnableSnapshotCopyResponse' :: Maybe Cluster -> Int -> EnableSnapshotCopyResponse
[$sel:cluster:EnableSnapshotCopyResponse'] :: EnableSnapshotCopyResponse -> Maybe Cluster

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:EnableSnapshotCopyResponse'] :: EnableSnapshotCopyResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>EnableSnapshotCopyResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>$sel:cluster:EnableSnapshotCopyResponse'</a>,

--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:EnableSnapshotCopyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>enableSnapshotCopyResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newEnableSnapshotCopyResponse :: Int -> EnableSnapshotCopyResponse

enableSnapshotCopyResponse_cluster :: Lens' EnableSnapshotCopyResponse (Maybe Cluster)

enableSnapshotCopyResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' EnableSnapshotCopyResponse Int

instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Redshift.EnableSnapshotCopy.EnableSnapshotCopyResponse

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Redshift.EnableSnapshotCopy.EnableSnapshotCopyResponse

-- | Starts logging information, such as queries and connection attempts,
--   for the specified Amazon Redshift cluster.
module Network.AWS.Redshift.EnableLogging

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newEnableLogging</a> smart constructor.
data EnableLogging
EnableLogging' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> EnableLogging

-- | The prefix applied to the log file names.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Cannot exceed 512 characters</li>
--   <li>Cannot contain spaces( ), double quotes ("), single quotes ('), a
--   backslash (\), or control characters. The hexadecimal codes for
--   invalid characters are:<ul><li>x00 to
--   x20</li><li>x22</li><li>x27</li><li>x5c</li><li>x7f or
--   larger</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:s3KeyPrefix:EnableLogging'] :: EnableLogging -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the cluster on which logging is to be started.
--   
--   Example: <tt>examplecluster</tt>
[$sel:clusterIdentifier:EnableLogging'] :: EnableLogging -> Text

-- | The name of an existing S3 bucket where the log files are to be
--   stored.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be in the same region as the cluster</li>
--   <li>The cluster must have read bucket and put object permissions</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:bucketName:EnableLogging'] :: EnableLogging -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EnableLogging</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3KeyPrefix:EnableLogging'</a>,
--   <a>enableLogging_s3KeyPrefix</a> - The prefix applied to the log file
--   names.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Cannot exceed 512 characters</li>
--   <li>Cannot contain spaces( ), double quotes ("), single quotes ('), a
--   backslash (\), or control characters. The hexadecimal codes for
--   invalid characters are:<ul><li>x00 to
--   x20</li><li>x22</li><li>x27</li><li>x5c</li><li>x7f or
--   larger</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterIdentifier:EnableLogging'</a>,
--   <a>enableLogging_clusterIdentifier</a> - The identifier of the cluster
--   on which logging is to be started.
--   
--   Example: <tt>examplecluster</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketName:EnableLogging'</a>, <a>enableLogging_bucketName</a>
--   - The name of an existing S3 bucket where the log files are to be
--   stored.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be in the same region as the cluster</li>
--   <li>The cluster must have read bucket and put object permissions</li>
--   </ul>
newEnableLogging :: Text -> Text -> EnableLogging

-- | The prefix applied to the log file names.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Cannot exceed 512 characters</li>
--   <li>Cannot contain spaces( ), double quotes ("), single quotes ('), a
--   backslash (\), or control characters. The hexadecimal codes for
--   invalid characters are:<ul><li>x00 to
--   x20</li><li>x22</li><li>x27</li><li>x5c</li><li>x7f or
--   larger</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
enableLogging_s3KeyPrefix :: Lens' EnableLogging (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the cluster on which logging is to be started.
--   
--   Example: <tt>examplecluster</tt>
enableLogging_clusterIdentifier :: Lens' EnableLogging Text

-- | The name of an existing S3 bucket where the log files are to be
--   stored.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be in the same region as the cluster</li>
--   <li>The cluster must have read bucket and put object permissions</li>
--   </ul>
enableLogging_bucketName :: Lens' EnableLogging Text

-- | Describes the status of logging for a cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLoggingStatus</a> smart constructor.
data LoggingStatus
LoggingStatus' :: Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> LoggingStatus

-- | The last time that logs were delivered.
[$sel:lastSuccessfulDeliveryTime:LoggingStatus'] :: LoggingStatus -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The name of the S3 bucket where the log files are stored.
[$sel:bucketName:LoggingStatus'] :: LoggingStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | <tt>true</tt> if logging is on, <tt>false</tt> if logging is off.
[$sel:loggingEnabled:LoggingStatus'] :: LoggingStatus -> Maybe Bool

-- | The prefix applied to the log file names.
[$sel:s3KeyPrefix:LoggingStatus'] :: LoggingStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The last time when logs failed to be delivered.
[$sel:lastFailureTime:LoggingStatus'] :: LoggingStatus -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The message indicating that logs failed to be delivered.
[$sel:lastFailureMessage:LoggingStatus'] :: LoggingStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>LoggingStatus</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastSuccessfulDeliveryTime:LoggingStatus'</a>,
--   <a>loggingStatus_lastSuccessfulDeliveryTime</a> - The last time that
--   logs were delivered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketName:LoggingStatus'</a>, <a>loggingStatus_bucketName</a>
--   - The name of the S3 bucket where the log files are stored.
--   
--   <a>$sel:loggingEnabled:LoggingStatus'</a>,
--   <a>loggingStatus_loggingEnabled</a> - <tt>true</tt> if logging is on,
--   <tt>false</tt> if logging is off.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3KeyPrefix:LoggingStatus'</a>,
--   <a>loggingStatus_s3KeyPrefix</a> - The prefix applied to the log file
--   names.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastFailureTime:LoggingStatus'</a>,
--   <a>loggingStatus_lastFailureTime</a> - The last time when logs failed
--   to be delivered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastFailureMessage:LoggingStatus'</a>,
--   <a>loggingStatus_lastFailureMessage</a> - The message indicating that
--   logs failed to be delivered.
newLoggingStatus :: LoggingStatus

-- | The last time that logs were delivered.
loggingStatus_lastSuccessfulDeliveryTime :: Lens' LoggingStatus (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the S3 bucket where the log files are stored.
loggingStatus_bucketName :: Lens' LoggingStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | <tt>true</tt> if logging is on, <tt>false</tt> if logging is off.
loggingStatus_loggingEnabled :: Lens' LoggingStatus (Maybe Bool)

-- | The prefix applied to the log file names.
loggingStatus_s3KeyPrefix :: Lens' LoggingStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | The last time when logs failed to be delivered.
loggingStatus_lastFailureTime :: Lens' LoggingStatus (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The message indicating that logs failed to be delivered.
loggingStatus_lastFailureMessage :: Lens' LoggingStatus (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Redshift.EnableLogging.EnableLogging
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.EnableLogging.EnableLogging
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Redshift.EnableLogging.EnableLogging
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Redshift.EnableLogging.EnableLogging
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.Redshift.EnableLogging.EnableLogging
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Redshift.EnableLogging.EnableLogging

instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Redshift.EnableLogging.EnableLogging
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Redshift.EnableLogging.EnableLogging


-- | From a consumer account, remove association for the specified
--   datashare.
module Network.AWS.Redshift.DisassociateDataShareConsumer

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDisassociateDataShareConsumer</a> smart constructor.
data DisassociateDataShareConsumer
DisassociateDataShareConsumer' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> DisassociateDataShareConsumer

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the consumer that association for
--   the datashare is removed from.
[$sel:consumerArn:DisassociateDataShareConsumer'] :: DisassociateDataShareConsumer -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that specifies whether association for the datashare is
--   removed from the entire account.
[$sel:disassociateEntireAccount:DisassociateDataShareConsumer'] :: DisassociateDataShareConsumer -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the datashare to remove association
--   for.
[$sel:dataShareArn:DisassociateDataShareConsumer'] :: DisassociateDataShareConsumer -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DisassociateDataShareConsumer</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:consumerArn:DisassociateDataShareConsumer'</a>,
--   <a>disassociateDataShareConsumer_consumerArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the consumer that association for the datashare is
--   removed from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:disassociateEntireAccount:DisassociateDataShareConsumer'</a>,
--   <a>disassociateDataShareConsumer_disassociateEntireAccount</a> - A
--   value that specifies whether association for the datashare is removed
--   from the entire account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataShareArn:DisassociateDataShareConsumer'</a>,
--   <a>disassociateDataShareConsumer_dataShareArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the datashare to remove association for.
newDisassociateDataShareConsumer :: Text -> DisassociateDataShareConsumer

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the consumer that association for
--   the datashare is removed from.
disassociateDataShareConsumer_consumerArn :: Lens' DisassociateDataShareConsumer (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that specifies whether association for the datashare is
--   removed from the entire account.
disassociateDataShareConsumer_disassociateEntireAccount :: Lens' DisassociateDataShareConsumer (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the datashare to remove association
--   for.
disassociateDataShareConsumer_dataShareArn :: Lens' DisassociateDataShareConsumer Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDataShare</a> smart constructor.
data DataShare
DataShare' :: Maybe [DataShareAssociation] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DataShare

-- | A value that specifies when the datashare has an association between a
--   producer and data consumers.
[$sel:dataShareAssociations:DataShare'] :: DataShare -> Maybe [DataShareAssociation]

-- | A value that specifies whether the datashare can be shared to a
--   publicly accessible cluster.
[$sel:allowPubliclyAccessibleConsumers:DataShare'] :: DataShare -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the producer.
[$sel:producerArn:DataShare'] :: DataShare -> Maybe Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that references the datashare that is
--   owned by a specific namespace of the producer cluster. A datashare ARN
--   is in the
--   <tt>arn:aws:redshift:{region}:{account-id}:{datashare}:{namespace-guid}/{datashare-name}</tt>
--   format.
[$sel:dataShareArn:DataShare'] :: DataShare -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DataShare</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   consumers.

--   <a>$sel:allowPubliclyAccessibleConsumers:DataShare'</a>,
--   <a>dataShare_allowPubliclyAccessibleConsumers</a> - A value that
--   specifies whether the datashare can be shared to a publicly accessible
--   cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:producerArn:DataShare'</a>, <a>dataShare_producerArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the producer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataShareArn:DataShare'</a>, <a>dataShare_dataShareArn</a> -
--   An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that references the datashare that is
--   owned by a specific namespace of the producer cluster. A datashare ARN
--   is in the
--   <tt>arn:aws:redshift:{region}:{account-id}:{datashare}:{namespace-guid}/{datashare-name}</tt>
--   format.
newDataShare :: DataShare

-- | A value that specifies when the datashare has an association between a
--   producer and data consumers.
dataShare_dataShareAssociations :: Lens' DataShare (Maybe [DataShareAssociation])

-- | A value that specifies whether the datashare can be shared to a
--   publicly accessible cluster.
dataShare_allowPubliclyAccessibleConsumers :: Lens' DataShare (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the producer.
dataShare_producerArn :: Lens' DataShare (Maybe Text)

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that references the datashare that is
--   owned by a specific namespace of the producer cluster. A datashare ARN
--   is in the
--   <tt>arn:aws:redshift:{region}:{account-id}:{datashare}:{namespace-guid}/{datashare-name}</tt>
--   format.
dataShare_dataShareArn :: Lens' DataShare (Maybe Text)

-- | Disables the automatic copying of snapshots from one region to another
--   region for a specified cluster.
--   
--   If your cluster and its snapshots are encrypted using a customer
--   master key (CMK) from Key Management Service, use
--   DeleteSnapshotCopyGrant to delete the grant that grants Amazon
--   Redshift permission to the CMK in the destination region.
module Network.AWS.Redshift.DisableSnapshotCopy

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDisableSnapshotCopy</a> smart constructor.
data DisableSnapshotCopy
DisableSnapshotCopy' :: Text -> DisableSnapshotCopy

-- | The unique identifier of the source cluster that you want to disable
--   copying of snapshots to a destination region.
--   
--   Constraints: Must be the valid name of an existing cluster that has
--   cross-region snapshot copy enabled.
[$sel:clusterIdentifier:DisableSnapshotCopy'] :: DisableSnapshotCopy -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DisableSnapshotCopy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterIdentifier:DisableSnapshotCopy'</a>,
--   <a>disableSnapshotCopy_clusterIdentifier</a> - The unique identifier
--   of the source cluster that you want to disable copying of snapshots to
--   a destination region.
--   
--   Constraints: Must be the valid name of an existing cluster that has
--   cross-region snapshot copy enabled.
newDisableSnapshotCopy :: Text -> DisableSnapshotCopy

-- | The unique identifier of the source cluster that you want to disable
--   copying of snapshots to a destination region.
--   
--   Constraints: Must be the valid name of an existing cluster that has
--   cross-region snapshot copy enabled.
disableSnapshotCopy_clusterIdentifier :: Lens' DisableSnapshotCopy Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDisableSnapshotCopyResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DisableSnapshotCopyResponse
DisableSnapshotCopyResponse' :: Maybe Cluster -> Int -> DisableSnapshotCopyResponse
[$sel:cluster:DisableSnapshotCopyResponse'] :: DisableSnapshotCopyResponse -> Maybe Cluster

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DisableSnapshotCopyResponse'] :: DisableSnapshotCopyResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DisableSnapshotCopyResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cluster:DisableSnapshotCopyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>disableSnapshotCopyResponse_cluster</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DisableSnapshotCopyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>disableSnapshotCopyResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newDisableSnapshotCopyResponse :: Int -> DisableSnapshotCopyResponse

-- | Undocumented member.
disableSnapshotCopyResponse_cluster :: Lens' DisableSnapshotCopyResponse (Maybe Cluster)

-- | The response's http status code.
disableSnapshotCopyResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DisableSnapshotCopyResponse Int

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Redshift.DisableSnapshotCopy.DisableSnapshotCopy

-- | Stops logging information, such as queries and connection attempts,
--   for the specified Amazon Redshift cluster.
module Network.AWS.Redshift.DisableLogging

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDisableLogging</a> smart constructor.
data DisableLogging
DisableLogging' :: Text -> DisableLogging

-- | The identifier of the cluster on which logging is to be stopped.
--   
--   Example: <tt>examplecluster</tt>
[$sel:clusterIdentifier:DisableLogging'] :: DisableLogging -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DisableLogging</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterIdentifier:DisableLogging'</a>,
--   <a>disableLogging_clusterIdentifier</a> - The identifier of the
--   cluster on which logging is to be stopped.
--   
--   Example: <tt>examplecluster</tt>
newDisableLogging :: Text -> DisableLogging

-- | The identifier of the cluster on which logging is to be stopped.
--   
--   Example: <tt>examplecluster</tt>
disableLogging_clusterIdentifier :: Lens' DisableLogging Text

-- | Describes the status of logging for a cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLoggingStatus</a> smart constructor.
data LoggingStatus
LoggingStatus' :: Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> LoggingStatus

-- | The last time that logs were delivered.
[$sel:lastSuccessfulDeliveryTime:LoggingStatus'] :: LoggingStatus -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The name of the S3 bucket where the log files are stored.
[$sel:bucketName:LoggingStatus'] :: LoggingStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | <tt>true</tt> if logging is on, <tt>false</tt> if logging is off.
[$sel:loggingEnabled:LoggingStatus'] :: LoggingStatus -> Maybe Bool

-- | The prefix applied to the log file names.
[$sel:s3KeyPrefix:LoggingStatus'] :: LoggingStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The last time when logs failed to be delivered.
[$sel:lastFailureTime:LoggingStatus'] :: LoggingStatus -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The message indicating that logs failed to be delivered.
[$sel:lastFailureMessage:LoggingStatus'] :: LoggingStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>LoggingStatus</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastSuccessfulDeliveryTime:LoggingStatus'</a>,
--   <a>loggingStatus_lastSuccessfulDeliveryTime</a> - The last time that
--   logs were delivered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketName:LoggingStatus'</a>, <a>loggingStatus_bucketName</a>
--   - The name of the S3 bucket where the log files are stored.
--   
--   <a>$sel:loggingEnabled:LoggingStatus'</a>,
--   <a>loggingStatus_loggingEnabled</a> - <tt>true</tt> if logging is on,
--   <tt>false</tt> if logging is off.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3KeyPrefix:LoggingStatus'</a>,
--   <a>loggingStatus_s3KeyPrefix</a> - The prefix applied to the log file
--   names.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastFailureTime:LoggingStatus'</a>,
--   <a>loggingStatus_lastFailureTime</a> - The last time when logs failed
--   to be delivered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastFailureMessage:LoggingStatus'</a>,
--   <a>loggingStatus_lastFailureMessage</a> - The message indicating that
--   logs failed to be delivered.
newLoggingStatus :: LoggingStatus

-- | The last time that logs were delivered.
loggingStatus_lastSuccessfulDeliveryTime :: Lens' LoggingStatus (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the S3 bucket where the log files are stored.
loggingStatus_bucketName :: Lens' LoggingStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | <tt>true</tt> if logging is on, <tt>false</tt> if logging is off.
loggingStatus_loggingEnabled :: Lens' LoggingStatus (Maybe Bool)

-- | The prefix applied to the log file names.
loggingStatus_s3KeyPrefix :: Lens' LoggingStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | The last time when logs failed to be delivered.
loggingStatus_lastFailureTime :: Lens' LoggingStatus (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The message indicating that logs failed to be delivered.
loggingStatus_lastFailureMessage :: Lens' LoggingStatus (Maybe Text)
