--   <a>$sel:preferredMaintenanceWindow:RestoreFromClusterSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>restoreFromClusterSnapshot_preferredMaintenanceWindow</a> - The
--   weekly time range (in UTC) during which automated cluster maintenance
--   can occur.
--   
--   Format: <tt>ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi</tt>
--   
--   Default: The value selected for the cluster from which the snapshot
--   was taken. For more information about the time blocks for each region,
--   see <a>Maintenance Windows</a> in Amazon Redshift Cluster Management
--   Guide.
--   
--   Valid Days: Mon | Tue | Wed | Thu | Fri | Sat | Sun
--   
--   Constraints: Minimum 30-minute window.
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:RestoreFromClusterSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>restoreFromClusterSnapshot_port</a> - The port number on which the
--   cluster accepts connections.
--   
--   Default: The same port as the original cluster.
--   
--   Constraints: Must be between <tt>1115</tt> and <tt>65535</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfNodes:RestoreFromClusterSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>restoreFromClusterSnapshot_numberOfNodes</a> - The number of nodes
--   specified when provisioning the restored cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterSecurityGroups:RestoreFromClusterSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>restoreFromClusterSnapshot_clusterSecurityGroups</a> - A list of
--   security groups to be associated with this cluster.
--   
--   Default: The default cluster security group for Amazon Redshift.
--   
--   Cluster security groups only apply to clusters outside of VPCs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ownerAccount:RestoreFromClusterSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>restoreFromClusterSnapshot_ownerAccount</a> - The Amazon Web
--   Services account used to create or copy the snapshot. Required if you
--   are restoring a snapshot you do not own, optional if you own the
--   snapshot.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nodeType:RestoreFromClusterSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>restoreFromClusterSnapshot_nodeType</a> - The node type that the
--   restored cluster will be provisioned with.
--   
--   Default: The node type of the cluster from which the snapshot was
--   taken. You can modify this if you are using any DS node type. In that
--   case, you can choose to restore into another DS node type of the same
--   size. For example, you can restore ds1.8xlarge into ds2.8xlarge, or
--   ds1.xlarge into ds2.xlarge. If you have a DC instance type, you must
--   restore into that same instance type and size. In other words, you can
--   only restore a dc1.large instance type into another dc1.large instance
--   type or dc2.large instance type. You can't restore dc1.8xlarge to
--   dc2.8xlarge. First restore to a dc1.8xlarge cluster, then resize to a
--   dc2.8large cluster. For more information about node types, see
--   <a>About Clusters and Nodes</a> in the <i>Amazon Redshift Cluster
--   Management Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:aquaConfigurationStatus:RestoreFromClusterSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>restoreFromClusterSnapshot_aquaConfigurationStatus</a> - The value
--   represents how the cluster is configured to use AQUA (Advanced Query
--   Accelerator) after the cluster is restored. Possible values include
--   the following.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>enabled - Use AQUA if it is available for the current Amazon Web
--   Services Region and Amazon Redshift node type.</li>
--   <li>disabled - Don't use AQUA.</li>
--   <li>auto - Amazon Redshift determines whether to use AQUA.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsmConfigurationIdentifier:RestoreFromClusterSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>restoreFromClusterSnapshot_hsmConfigurationIdentifier</a> -
--   Specifies the name of the HSM configuration that contains the
--   information the Amazon Redshift cluster can use to retrieve and store
--   keys in an HSM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maintenanceTrackName:RestoreFromClusterSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>restoreFromClusterSnapshot_maintenanceTrackName</a> - The name of
--   the maintenance track for the restored cluster. When you take a
--   snapshot, the snapshot inherits the <tt>MaintenanceTrack</tt> value
--   from the cluster. The snapshot might be on a different track than the
--   cluster that was the source for the snapshot. For example, suppose
--   that you take a snapshot of a cluster that is on the current track and
--   then change the cluster to be on the trailing track. In this case, the
--   snapshot and the source cluster are on different tracks.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamRoles:RestoreFromClusterSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>restoreFromClusterSnapshot_iamRoles</a> - A list of Identity and
--   Access Management (IAM) roles that can be used by the cluster to
--   access other Amazon Web Services services. You must supply the IAM
--   roles in their Amazon Resource Name (ARN) format. You can supply up to
--   10 IAM roles in a single request.
--   
--   A cluster can have up to 10 IAM roles associated at any time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterIdentifier:RestoreFromClusterSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>restoreFromClusterSnapshot_clusterIdentifier</a> - The identifier
--   of the cluster that will be created from restoring the snapshot.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain from 1 to 63 alphanumeric characters or hyphens.</li>
--   <li>Alphabetic characters must be lowercase.</li>
--   <li>First character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   <li>Must be unique for all clusters within an Amazon Web Services
--   account.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotIdentifier:RestoreFromClusterSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>restoreFromClusterSnapshot_snapshotIdentifier</a> - The name of the
--   snapshot from which to create the new cluster. This parameter isn't
--   case sensitive.
--   
--   Example: <tt>my-snapshot-id</tt>
newRestoreFromClusterSnapshot :: Text -> Text -> RestoreFromClusterSnapshot

--   apply the snapshot retention period to newly copied manual snapshots
--   instead of automated snapshots.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterIdentifier:ModifySnapshotCopyRetentionPeriod'</a>,
--   <a>modifySnapshotCopyRetentionPeriod_clusterIdentifier</a> - The
--   unique identifier of the cluster for which you want to change the
--   retention period for either automated or manual snapshots that are
--   copied to a destination Amazon Web Services Region.
--   
--   Constraints: Must be the valid name of an existing cluster that has
--   cross-region snapshot copy enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retentionPeriod:ModifySnapshotCopyRetentionPeriod'</a>,
--   <a>modifySnapshotCopyRetentionPeriod_retentionPeriod</a> - The number
--   of days to retain automated snapshots in the destination Amazon Web
--   Services Region after they are copied from the source Amazon Web
--   Services Region.
--   
--   By default, this only changes the retention period of copied automated
--   snapshots.
--   
--   If you decrease the retention period for automated snapshots that are
--   copied to a destination Amazon Web Services Region, Amazon Redshift
--   deletes any existing automated snapshots that were copied to the
--   destination Amazon Web Services Region and that fall outside of the
--   new retention period.
--   
--   Constraints: Must be at least 1 and no more than 35 for automated
--   snapshots.
--   
--   If you specify the <tt>manual</tt> option, only newly copied manual
--   snapshots will have the new retention period.
--   
--   If you specify the value of -1 newly copied manual snapshots are
--   retained indefinitely.
--   
--   Constraints: The number of days must be either -1 or an integer
--   between 1 and 3,653 for manual snapshots.
newModifySnapshotCopyRetentionPeriod :: Text -> Int -> ModifySnapshotCopyRetentionPeriod

-- | Describes a cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCluster</a> smart constructor.
data Cluster
Cluster' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe [VpcSecurityGroupMembership] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ResizeInfo -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [DeferredMaintenanceWindow] -> Maybe ScheduleState -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> Maybe ElasticIpStatus -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe HsmStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [ClusterParameterGroupStatus] -> Maybe ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RestoreStatus -> Maybe AquaConfiguration -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe [ClusterNode] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe DataTransferProgress -> Maybe PendingModifiedValues -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Endpoint -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [ClusterSecurityGroupMembership] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [ClusterIamRole] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Cluster

-- | Create a value of <a>Cluster</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalStorageCapacityInMegaBytes:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_totalStorageCapacityInMegaBytes</a> - The total storage
--   capacity of the cluster in megabytes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcSecurityGroups:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_vpcSecurityGroups</a> - A list of Amazon Virtual Private
--   Cloud (Amazon VPC) security groups that are associated with the
--   cluster. This parameter is returned only if the cluster is in a VPC.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enhancedVpcRouting:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_enhancedVpcRouting</a> - An option that specifies whether
--   to create the cluster with enhanced VPC routing enabled. To create a
--   cluster that uses enhanced VPC routing, the cluster must be in a VPC.
--   For more information, see <a>Enhanced VPC Routing</a> in the Amazon
--   Redshift Cluster Management Guide.
--   
--   If this option is <tt>true</tt>, enhanced VPC routing is enabled.
--   
--   Default: false
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterNamespaceArn:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_clusterNamespaceArn</a> - The namespace Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resizeInfo:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_resizeInfo</a> - Returns
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AllowCancelResize: a boolean value indicating if the resize
--   operation can be cancelled.</li>
--   <li>ResizeType: Returns ClassicResize</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterSubnetGroupName:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_clusterSubnetGroupName</a> - The name of the subnet group
--   that is associated with the cluster. This parameter is valid only when
--   the cluster is in a VPC.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedNextSnapshotScheduleTimeStatus:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_expectedNextSnapshotScheduleTimeStatus</a> - The status of
--   next expected snapshot for clusters having a valid snapshot schedule
--   and backups enabled. Possible values are the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>OnTrack - The next snapshot is expected to be taken on time.</li>
--   <li>Pending - The next snapshot is pending to be taken.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:deferredMaintenanceWindows:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_deferredMaintenanceWindows</a> - Describes a group of
--   <tt>DeferredMaintenanceWindow</tt> objects.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotScheduleState:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_snapshotScheduleState</a> - The current state of the
--   cluster snapshot schedule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encrypted:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_encrypted</a> - A boolean
--   value that, if <tt>true</tt>, indicates that data in the cluster is
--   encrypted at rest.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterCreateTime:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_clusterCreateTime</a> - The date and time that the cluster
--   was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowVersionUpgrade:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_allowVersionUpgrade</a> - A boolean value that, if
--   <tt>true</tt>, indicates that major version upgrades will be applied
--   automatically to the cluster during the maintenance window.
--   
--   <a>$sel:automatedSnapshotRetentionPeriod:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_automatedSnapshotRetentionPeriod</a> - The number of days
--   that automatic cluster snapshots are retained.
--   
--   <a>$sel:elasticIpStatus:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_elasticIpStatus</a> -
--   The status of the elastic IP (EIP) address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publiclyAccessible:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_publiclyAccessible</a> - A boolean value that, if
--   <tt>true</tt>, indicates that the cluster can be accessed from a
--   public network.
--   
--   <a>$sel:masterUsername:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_masterUsername</a> -
--   The admin user name for the cluster. This name is used to connect to
--   the database that is specified in the <b>DBName</b> parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotScheduleIdentifier:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_snapshotScheduleIdentifier</a> - A unique identifier for
--   the cluster snapshot schedule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsmStatus:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_hsmStatus</a> - A value
--   that reports whether the Amazon Redshift cluster has finished applying
--   any hardware security module (HSM) settings changes specified in a
--   modify cluster command.
--   
--   Values: active, applying
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyId:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_kmsKeyId</a> - The Key
--   Management Service (KMS) key ID of the encryption key used to encrypt
--   data in the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:manualSnapshotRetentionPeriod:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_manualSnapshotRetentionPeriod</a> - The default number of
--   days to retain a manual snapshot. If the value is -1, the snapshot is
--   retained indefinitely. This setting doesn't change the retention
--   period of existing snapshots.
--   
--   The value must be either -1 or an integer between 1 and 3,653.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterParameterGroups:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_clusterParameterGroups</a> - The list of cluster parameter
--   groups that are associated with this cluster. Each parameter group in
--   the list is returned with its status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterSnapshotCopyStatus:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_clusterSnapshotCopyStatus</a> - A value that returns the
--   destination region and retention period that are configured for
--   cross-region snapshot copy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterAvailabilityStatus:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_clusterAvailabilityStatus</a> - The availability status of
--   the cluster for queries. Possible values are the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Available - The cluster is available for queries.</li>
--   <li>Unavailable - The cluster is not available for queries.</li>
--   <li>Maintenance - The cluster is intermittently available for queries
--   due to maintenance activities.</li>
--   <li>Modifying - The cluster is intermittently available for queries
--   due to changes that modify the cluster.</li>
--   <li>Failed - The cluster failed and is not available for queries.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZone:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_availabilityZone</a>
--   - The name of the Availability Zone in which the cluster is located.
--   
--   <a>$sel:modifyStatus:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_modifyStatus</a> - The
--   status of a modify operation, if any, initiated for the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:preferredMaintenanceWindow:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_preferredMaintenanceWindow</a> - The weekly time range, in
--   Universal Coordinated Time (UTC), during which system maintenance can
--   occur.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterPublicKey:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_clusterPublicKey</a>
--   - The public key for the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:restoreStatus:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_restoreStatus</a> - A
--   value that describes the status of a cluster restore action. This
--   parameter returns null if the cluster was not created by restoring a
--   snapshot.
--   
--   <a>$sel:aquaConfiguration:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_aquaConfiguration</a> - The AQUA (Advanced Query
--   Accelerator) configuration of the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_tags</a> - The list of tags for
--   the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterNodes:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_clusterNodes</a> - The
--   nodes in the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbName:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_dbName</a> - The name of the
--   initial database that was created when the cluster was created. This
--   same name is returned for the life of the cluster. If an initial
--   database was not specified, a database named <tt>dev</tt>dev was
--   created by default.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZoneRelocationStatus:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_availabilityZoneRelocationStatus</a> - Describes the status
--   of the Availability Zone relocation operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterIdentifier:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_clusterIdentifier</a> - The unique identifier of the
--   cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfNodes:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_numberOfNodes</a> - The
--   number of compute nodes in the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataTransferProgress:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_dataTransferProgress</a> -
--   
--   <a>$sel:pendingModifiedValues:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_pendingModifiedValues</a> - A value that, if present,
--   indicates that changes to the cluster are pending. Specific pending
--   changes are identified by subelements.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterStatus:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_clusterStatus</a> - The
--   current state of the cluster. Possible values are the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>available</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>available, prep-for-resize</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>available, resize-cleanup</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>cancelling-resize</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>creating</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>deleting</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>final-snapshot</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>hardware-failure</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>incompatible-hsm</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>incompatible-network</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>incompatible-parameters</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>incompatible-restore</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>modifying</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>paused</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>rebooting</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>renaming</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>resizing</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>rotating-keys</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>storage-full</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>updating-hsm</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpoint:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_endpoint</a> - The
--   connection endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextMaintenanceWindowStartTime:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_nextMaintenanceWindowStartTime</a> - The date and time in
--   UTC when system maintenance can begin.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterVersion:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_clusterVersion</a> -
--   The version ID of the Amazon Redshift engine that is running on the
--   cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterSecurityGroups:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_clusterSecurityGroups</a> - A list of cluster security
--   group that are associated with the cluster. Each security group is
--   represented by an element that contains
--   <tt>ClusterSecurityGroup.Name</tt> and
--   <tt>ClusterSecurityGroup.Status</tt> subelements.
--   
--   Cluster security groups are used when the cluster is not created in an
--   Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC). Clusters that are created in a VPC
--   use VPC security groups, which are listed by the
--   <b>VpcSecurityGroups</b> parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcId:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_vpcId</a> - The identifier of
--   the VPC the cluster is in, if the cluster is in a VPC.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nodeType:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_nodeType</a> - The node type
--   for the nodes in the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedNextSnapshotScheduleTime:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_expectedNextSnapshotScheduleTime</a> - The date and time
--   when the next snapshot is expected to be taken for clusters with a
--   valid snapshot schedule and backups enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:elasticResizeNumberOfNodeOptions:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_elasticResizeNumberOfNodeOptions</a> - The number of nodes
--   that you can resize the cluster to with the elastic resize method.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maintenanceTrackName:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_maintenanceTrackName</a> - The name of the maintenance
--   track for the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamRoles:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_iamRoles</a> - A list of
--   Identity and Access Management (IAM) roles that can be used by the
--   cluster to access other Amazon Web Services services.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pendingActions:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_pendingActions</a> -
--   Cluster operations that are waiting to be started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterRevisionNumber:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_clusterRevisionNumber</a> - The specific revision number of
--   the database in the cluster.
newCluster :: Cluster

-- | An Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that can be used by the
--   associated Amazon Redshift cluster to access other Amazon Web Services
--   services.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newClusterIamRole</a> smart constructor.
data ClusterIamRole
ClusterIamRole' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ClusterIamRole

-- | Create a value of <a>ClusterIamRole</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamRoleArn:ClusterIamRole'</a>,
--   <a>clusterIamRole_iamRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the IAM role, for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/RedshiftCopyUnload</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applyStatus:ClusterIamRole'</a>,
--   <a>clusterIamRole_applyStatus</a> - A value that describes the status
--   of the IAM role's association with an Amazon Redshift cluster.
--   
--   The following are possible statuses and descriptions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>in-sync</tt>: The role is available for use by the
--   cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>adding</tt>: The role is in the process of being associated
--   with the cluster.</li>
--   <li><tt>removing</tt>: The role is in the process of being
--   disassociated with the cluster.</li>
--   </ul>
newClusterIamRole :: ClusterIamRole

-- | Describes the status of a parameter group.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newClusterParameterStatus</a> smart constructor.
data ClusterParameterStatus
ClusterParameterStatus' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ClusterParameterStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>ClusterParameterStatus</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterApplyStatus:ClusterParameterStatus'</a>,
--   <a>clusterParameterStatus_parameterApplyStatus</a> - The status of the
--   parameter that indicates whether the parameter is in sync with the
--   database, waiting for a cluster reboot, or encountered an error when
--   being applied.
--   
--   The following are possible statuses and descriptions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>in-sync</tt>: The parameter value is in sync with the
--   database.</li>
--   <li><tt>pending-reboot</tt>: The parameter value will be applied after
--   the cluster reboots.</li>
--   <li><tt>applying</tt>: The parameter value is being applied to the
--   database.</li>
--   <li><tt>invalid-parameter</tt>: Cannot apply the parameter value
--   because it has an invalid value or syntax.</li>
--   <li><tt>apply-deferred</tt>: The parameter contains static property
--   changes. The changes are deferred until the cluster reboots.</li>
--   <li><tt>apply-error</tt>: Cannot connect to the cluster. The parameter
--   change will be applied after the cluster reboots.</li>
--   <li><tt>unknown-error</tt>: Cannot apply the parameter change right
--   now. The change will be applied after the cluster reboots.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterName:ClusterParameterStatus'</a>,
--   <a>clusterParameterStatus_parameterName</a> - The name of the
--   parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterApplyErrorDescription:ClusterParameterStatus'</a>,
--   <a>clusterParameterStatus_parameterApplyErrorDescription</a> - The
--   error that prevented the parameter from being applied to the database.
newClusterParameterStatus :: ClusterParameterStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>EventSubscription</a> with all optional fields

--

-- | Defines a maintenance track that determines which Amazon Redshift
--   version to apply during a maintenance window. If the value for
--   <tt>MaintenanceTrack</tt> is <tt>current</tt>, the cluster is updated
--   to the most recently certified maintenance release. If the value is
--   <tt>trailing</tt>, the cluster is updated to the previously certified
--   maintenance release.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMaintenanceTrack</a> smart constructor.
data MaintenanceTrack
MaintenanceTrack' :: Maybe [UpdateTarget] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> MaintenanceTrack

-- | Create a value of <a>MaintenanceTrack</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:updateTargets:MaintenanceTrack'</a>,
--   <a>maintenanceTrack_updateTargets</a> - An array of UpdateTarget
--   objects to update with the maintenance track.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseVersion:MaintenanceTrack'</a>,
--   <a>maintenanceTrack_databaseVersion</a> - The version number for the
--   cluster release.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maintenanceTrackName:MaintenanceTrack'</a>,
--   <a>maintenanceTrack_maintenanceTrackName</a> - The name of the
--   maintenance track. Possible values are <tt>current</tt> and
--   <tt>trailing</tt>.
newMaintenanceTrack :: MaintenanceTrack

-- | A set of elements to filter the returned node configurations.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNodeConfigurationOptionsFilter</a> smart
--   constructor.
data NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter
NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe OperatorType -> Maybe NodeConfigurationOptionsFilterName -> NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter'</a>,
--   <a>nodeConfigurationOptionsFilter_values</a> - List of values. Compare
--   Name using Operator to Values. If filter Name is NumberOfNodes, then
--   values can range from 0 to 200. If filter Name is
--   EstimatedDiskUtilizationPercent, then values can range from 0 to 100.
--   For example, filter NumberOfNodes (name) GT (operator) 3 (values).
--   
--   <a>$sel:operator:NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter'</a>,
--   <a>nodeConfigurationOptionsFilter_operator</a> - The filter operator.
--   If filter Name is NodeType only the 'in' operator is supported.
--   Provide one value to evaluate for 'eq', 'lt', 'le', 'gt', and 'ge'.
--   Provide two values to evaluate for 'between'. Provide a list of values
--   for 'in'.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter'</a>,
--   <a>nodeConfigurationOptionsFilter_name</a> - The name of the element
--   to filter.
newNodeConfigurationOptionsFilter :: NodeConfigurationOptionsFilter

-- | Describes a parameter in a cluster parameter group.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newParameter</a> smart constructor.
data Parameter
Parameter' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ParameterApplyType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Parameter

-- | Create a value of <a>Parameter</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowedValues:Parameter'</a>, <a>parameter_allowedValues</a> -
--   The valid range of values for the parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:source:Parameter'</a>, <a>parameter_source</a> - The source of
--   the parameter value, such as "engine-default" or "user".
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterValue:Parameter'</a>, <a>parameter_parameterValue</a>
--   - The value of the parameter. If <tt>ParameterName</tt> is
--   <tt>wlm_json_configuration</tt>, then the maximum size of
--   <tt>ParameterValue</tt> is 8000 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applyType:Parameter'</a>, <a>parameter_applyType</a> -
--   Specifies how to apply the WLM configuration parameter. Some
--   properties can be applied dynamically, while other properties require
--   that any associated clusters be rebooted for the configuration changes
--   to be applied. For more information about parameters and parameter
--   groups, go to <a>Amazon Redshift Parameter Groups</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Redshift Cluster Management Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterName:Parameter'</a>, <a>parameter_parameterName</a> -
--   The name of the parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:Parameter'</a>, <a>parameter_description</a> - A
--   description of the parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataType:Parameter'</a>, <a>parameter_dataType</a> - The data
--   type of the parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isModifiable:Parameter'</a>, <a>parameter_isModifiable</a> -
--   If <tt>true</tt>, the parameter can be modified. Some parameters have
--   security or operational implications that prevent them from being
--   changed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minimumEngineVersion:Parameter'</a>,
--   <a>parameter_minimumEngineVersion</a> - The earliest engine version to
--   which the parameter can apply.
newParameter :: Parameter

--   Routing</a> in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management Guide.

-- | Describes a reserved node. You can call the
--   DescribeReservedNodeOfferings API to obtain the available reserved
--   node offerings.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReservedNode</a> smart constructor.
data ReservedNode
ReservedNode' :: Maybe ReservedNodeOfferingType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [RecurringCharge] -> ReservedNode

-- | Create a value of <a>ReservedNode</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:reservedNodeOfferingType:ReservedNode'</a>,
--   <a>reservedNode_reservedNodeOfferingType</a> -
--   
--   <a>$sel:reservedNodeId:ReservedNode'</a>,
--   <a>reservedNode_reservedNodeId</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   reservation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reservedNodeOfferingId:ReservedNode'</a>,
--   <a>reservedNode_reservedNodeOfferingId</a> - The identifier for the
--   reserved node offering.
--   
--   <a>$sel:duration:ReservedNode'</a>, <a>reservedNode_duration</a> - The
--   duration of the node reservation in seconds.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:ReservedNode'</a>, <a>reservedNode_startTime</a> -
--   The time the reservation started. You purchase a reserved node
--   offering for a duration. This is the start time of that duration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currencyCode:ReservedNode'</a>,
--   <a>reservedNode_currencyCode</a> - The currency code for the reserved
--   cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:ReservedNode'</a>, <a>reservedNode_state</a> - The state
--   of the reserved compute node.
--   
--   Possible Values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>pending-payment-This reserved node has recently been purchased,
--   and the sale has been approved, but payment has not yet been
--   confirmed.</li>
--   <li>active-This reserved node is owned by the caller and is available
--   for use.</li>
--   <li>payment-failed-Payment failed for the purchase attempt.</li>
--   <li>retired-The reserved node is no longer available.</li>
--   <li>exchanging-The owner is exchanging the reserved node for another
--   reserved node.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:fixedPrice:ReservedNode'</a>, <a>reservedNode_fixedPrice</a> -
--   The fixed cost Amazon Redshift charges you for this reserved node.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nodeCount:ReservedNode'</a>, <a>reservedNode_nodeCount</a> -
--   The number of reserved compute nodes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:usagePrice:ReservedNode'</a>, <a>reservedNode_usagePrice</a> -
--   The hourly rate Amazon Redshift charges you for this reserved node.
--   
--   <a>$sel:offeringType:ReservedNode'</a>,
--   <a>reservedNode_offeringType</a> - The anticipated utilization of the
--   reserved node, as defined in the reserved node offering.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nodeType:ReservedNode'</a>, <a>reservedNode_nodeType</a> - The
--   node type of the reserved node.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recurringCharges:ReservedNode'</a>,
--   <a>reservedNode_recurringCharges</a> - The recurring charges for the
--   reserved node.
newReservedNode :: ReservedNode

--   node offering. Recurring charges are only in effect for

--   the resize type is elastic.

--   for the cluster. If not specified, the cluster's current number of
--   nodes is used.

-- | Describes the result of a cluster resize operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResizeProgressMessage</a> smart constructor.
data ResizeProgressMessage
ResizeProgressMessage' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Double -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> ResizeProgressMessage

-- | Create a value of <a>ResizeProgressMessage</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_status</a> - The status of the resize
--   operation.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>NONE</tt> | <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> | <tt>FAILED</tt> |
--   <tt>SUCCEEDED</tt> | <tt>CANCELLING</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:estimatedTimeToCompletionInSeconds:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_estimatedTimeToCompletionInSeconds</a> - The
--   estimated time remaining, in seconds, until the resize operation is
--   complete. This value is calculated based on the average resize rate
--   and the estimated amount of data remaining to be processed. Once the
--   resize operation is complete, this value will be 0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:importTablesNotStarted:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_importTablesNotStarted</a> - The names of
--   tables that have not been yet imported.
--   
--   Valid Values: List of table names
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetNodeType:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_targetNodeType</a> - The node type that the
--   cluster will have after the resize operation is complete.
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_message</a> - An optional string to provide
--   additional details about the resize action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetClusterType:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_targetClusterType</a> - The cluster type
--   after the resize operation is complete.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>multi-node</tt> | <tt>single-node</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:avgResizeRateInMegaBytesPerSecond:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_avgResizeRateInMegaBytesPerSecond</a> - The
--   average rate of the resize operation over the last few minutes,
--   measured in megabytes per second. After the resize operation
--   completes, this value shows the average rate of the entire resize
--   operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetEncryptionType:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_targetEncryptionType</a> - The type of
--   encryption for the cluster after the resize is complete.
--   
--   Possible values are <tt>KMS</tt> and <tt>None</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:elapsedTimeInSeconds:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_elapsedTimeInSeconds</a> - The amount of
--   seconds that have elapsed since the resize operation began. After the
--   resize operation completes, this value shows the total actual time, in
--   seconds, for the resize operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalResizeDataInMegaBytes:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_totalResizeDataInMegaBytes</a> - The
--   estimated total amount of data, in megabytes, on the cluster before
--   the resize operation began.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetNumberOfNodes:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_targetNumberOfNodes</a> - The number of nodes
--   that the cluster will have after the resize operation is complete.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataTransferProgressPercent:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_dataTransferProgressPercent</a> - The percent
--   of data transferred from source cluster to target cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:importTablesCompleted:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_importTablesCompleted</a> - The names of
--   tables that have been completely imported .
--   
--   Valid Values: List of table names.
--   
--   <a>$sel:progressInMegaBytes:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_progressInMegaBytes</a> - While the resize
--   operation is in progress, this value shows the current amount of data,
--   in megabytes, that has been processed so far. When the resize
--   operation is complete, this value shows the total amount of data, in
--   megabytes, on the cluster, which may be more or less than
--   TotalResizeDataInMegaBytes (the estimated total amount of data before
--   resize).
--   
--   <a>$sel:importTablesInProgress:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_importTablesInProgress</a> - The names of
--   tables that are being currently imported.
--   
--   Valid Values: List of table names.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resizeType:ResizeProgressMessage'</a>,
--   <a>resizeProgressMessage_resizeType</a> - An enum with possible values
--   of <tt>ClassicResize</tt> and <tt>ElasticResize</tt>. These values
--   describe the type of resize operation being performed.
newResizeProgressMessage :: ResizeProgressMessage

-- | Describes the status of a cluster restore action. Returns null if the
--   cluster was not created by restoring a snapshot.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRestoreStatus</a> smart constructor.
data RestoreStatus
RestoreStatus' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> RestoreStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>RestoreStatus</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:RestoreStatus'</a>, <a>restoreStatus_status</a> - The
--   status of the restore action. Returns starting, restoring, completed,
--   or failed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:estimatedTimeToCompletionInSeconds:RestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>restoreStatus_estimatedTimeToCompletionInSeconds</a> - The estimate
--   of the time remaining before the restore will complete. Returns 0 for
--   a completed restore. This field is only updated when you restore to
--   DC2 and DS2 node types.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotSizeInMegaBytes:RestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>restoreStatus_snapshotSizeInMegaBytes</a> - The size of the set of
--   snapshot data used to restore the cluster. This field is only updated
--   when you restore to DC2 and DS2 node types.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentRestoreRateInMegaBytesPerSecond:RestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>restoreStatus_currentRestoreRateInMegaBytesPerSecond</a> - The
--   number of megabytes per second being transferred from the backup
--   storage. Returns the average rate for a completed backup. This field
--   is only updated when you restore to DC2 and DS2 node types.
--   
--   <a>$sel:elapsedTimeInSeconds:RestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>restoreStatus_elapsedTimeInSeconds</a> - The amount of time an
--   in-progress restore has been running, or the amount of time it took a
--   completed restore to finish. This field is only updated when you
--   restore to DC2 and DS2 node types.
--   
--   <a>$sel:progressInMegaBytes:RestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>restoreStatus_progressInMegaBytes</a> - The number of megabytes
--   that have been transferred from snapshot storage. This field is only
--   updated when you restore to DC2 and DS2 node types.
newRestoreStatus :: RestoreStatus

-- | Describes a resume cluster operation. For example, a scheduled action

-- | Describes a scheduled action. You can use a scheduled action to
--   trigger some Amazon Redshift API operations on a schedule. For
--   information about which API operations can be scheduled, see
--   ScheduledActionType.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScheduledAction</a> smart constructor.
data ScheduledAction
ScheduledAction' :: Maybe ScheduledActionType -> Maybe [ISO8601] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe ScheduledActionState -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ScheduledAction

-- | Create a value of <a>ScheduledAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetAction:ScheduledAction'</a>,
--   <a>scheduledAction_targetAction</a> - A JSON format string of the
--   Amazon Redshift API operation with input parameters.
--   
--   
--   "<tt>{\"ResizeCluster\":{\"NodeType\":\"ds2.8xlarge\",\"ClusterIdentifier\":\"my-test-cluster\",\"NumberOfNodes\":3}}</tt>".
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextInvocations:ScheduledAction'</a>,
--   <a>scheduledAction_nextInvocations</a> - List of times when the
--   scheduled action will run.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamRole:ScheduledAction'</a>, <a>scheduledAction_iamRole</a> -
--   The IAM role to assume to run the scheduled action. This IAM role must
--   have permission to run the Amazon Redshift API operation in the
--   scheduled action. This IAM role must allow the Amazon Redshift
--   scheduler (Principal scheduler.redshift.amazonaws.com) to assume
--   permissions on your behalf. For more information about the IAM role to
--   use with the Amazon Redshift scheduler, see <a>Using Identity-Based
--   Policies for Amazon Redshift</a> in the <i>Amazon Redshift Cluster
--   Management Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduledActionDescription:ScheduledAction'</a>,
--   <a>scheduledAction_scheduledActionDescription</a> - The description of
--   the scheduled action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:ScheduledAction'</a>,
--   <a>scheduledAction_startTime</a> - The start time in UTC when the
--   schedule is active. Before this time, the scheduled action does not
--   trigger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:ScheduledAction'</a>, <a>scheduledAction_endTime</a> -
--   The end time in UTC when the schedule is no longer active. After this
--   time, the scheduled action does not trigger.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:ScheduledAction'</a>, <a>scheduledAction_state</a> - The
--   state of the scheduled action. For example, <tt>DISABLED</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduledActionName:ScheduledAction'</a>,
--   <a>scheduledAction_scheduledActionName</a> - The name of the scheduled
--   action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:schedule:ScheduledAction'</a>, <a>scheduledAction_schedule</a>
--   - The schedule for a one-time (at format) or recurring (cron format)
--   scheduled action. Schedule invocations must be separated by at least
--   one hour.
--   
--   Format of at expressions is "<tt>at(yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss)</tt>". For
--   example, "<tt>at(2016-03-04T17:27:00)</tt>".
--   
--   Format of cron expressions is "<tt>cron(Minutes Hours Day-of-month
--   Month Day-of-week Year)</tt>". For example, "<tt>cron(0 10 ? * MON
--   *)</tt>". For more information, see <a>Cron Expressions</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon CloudWatch Events User Guide</i>.
newScheduledAction :: ScheduledAction

--   value (of type defined by <tt>Name</tt>) equals an item in the list of
--   scheduled actions.
newScheduledActionFilter :: ScheduledActionFilterName -> ScheduledActionFilter

-- | Describes a snapshot.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSnapshot</a> smart constructor.
data Snapshot
Snapshot' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Int -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [AccountWithRestoreAccess] -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Snapshot

-- | Create a value of <a>Snapshot</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:enhancedVpcRouting:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_enhancedVpcRouting</a> - An option that specifies whether
--   to create the cluster with enhanced VPC routing enabled. To create a
--   cluster that uses enhanced VPC routing, the cluster must be in a VPC.
--   For more information, see <a>Enhanced VPC Routing</a> in the Amazon
--   Redshift Cluster Management Guide.
--   
--   If this option is <tt>true</tt>, enhanced VPC routing is enabled.
--   
--   Default: false
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotIdentifier:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_snapshotIdentifier</a> - The snapshot identifier that is
--   provided in the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Snapshot'</a>, <a>snapshot_status</a> - The snapshot
--   status. The value of the status depends on the API operation used:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>CreateClusterSnapshot and CopyClusterSnapshot returns status as
--   "creating".</li>
--   <li>DescribeClusterSnapshots returns status as "creating",
--   "available", "final snapshot", or "failed".</li>
--   <li>DeleteClusterSnapshot returns status as "deleted".</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:estimatedSecondsToCompletion:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_estimatedSecondsToCompletion</a> - The estimate of the
--   time remaining before the snapshot backup will complete. Returns
--   <tt>0</tt> for a completed backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encrypted:Snapshot'</a>, <a>snapshot_encrypted</a> - If
--   <tt>true</tt>, the data in the snapshot is encrypted at rest.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterCreateTime:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_clusterCreateTime</a> - The time (UTC) when the cluster
--   was originally created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:manualSnapshotRemainingDays:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_manualSnapshotRemainingDays</a> - The number of days until
--   a manual snapshot will pass its retention period.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotCreateTime:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_snapshotCreateTime</a> - The time (in UTC format) when
--   Amazon Redshift began the snapshot. A snapshot contains a copy of the
--   cluster data as of this exact time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptedWithHSM:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_encryptedWithHSM</a> - A boolean that indicates whether
--   the snapshot data is encrypted using the HSM keys of the source
--   cluster. <tt>true</tt> indicates that the data is encrypted using HSM
--   keys.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentBackupRateInMegaBytesPerSecond:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_currentBackupRateInMegaBytesPerSecond</a> - The number of
--   megabytes per second being transferred to the snapshot backup. Returns
--   <tt>0</tt> for a completed backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:masterUsername:Snapshot'</a>, <a>snapshot_masterUsername</a> -
--   The admin user name for the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyId:Snapshot'</a>, <a>snapshot_kmsKeyId</a> - The Key
--   Management Service (KMS) key ID of the encryption key that was used to
--   encrypt data in the cluster from which the snapshot was taken.
--   
--   <a>$sel:manualSnapshotRetentionPeriod:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_manualSnapshotRetentionPeriod</a> - The number of days
--   that a manual snapshot is retained. If the value is -1, the manual
--   snapshot is retained indefinitely.
--   
--   The value must be either -1 or an integer between 1 and 3,653.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engineFullVersion:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_engineFullVersion</a> - The cluster version of the cluster
--   used to create the snapshot. For example, 1.0.15503.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZone:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_availabilityZone</a> - The Availability Zone in which the
--   cluster was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotType:Snapshot'</a>, <a>snapshot_snapshotType</a> - The
--   snapshot type. Snapshots created using CreateClusterSnapshot and
--   CopyClusterSnapshot are of type "manual".
--   
--   <a>$sel:restorableNodeTypes:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_restorableNodeTypes</a> - The list of node types that this
--   cluster snapshot is able to restore into.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountsWithRestoreAccess:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_accountsWithRestoreAccess</a> - A list of the Amazon Web
--   Services accounts authorized to restore the snapshot. Returns
--   <tt>null</tt> if no accounts are authorized. Visible only to the
--   snapshot owner.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Snapshot'</a>, <a>snapshot_tags</a> - The list of tags
--   for the cluster snapshot.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbName:Snapshot'</a>, <a>snapshot_dbName</a> - The name of the
--   database that was created when the cluster was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:actualIncrementalBackupSizeInMegaBytes:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_actualIncrementalBackupSizeInMegaBytes</a> - The size of
--   the incremental backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterIdentifier:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_clusterIdentifier</a> - The identifier of the cluster for
--   which the snapshot was taken.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalBackupSizeInMegaBytes:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_totalBackupSizeInMegaBytes</a> - The size of the complete
--   set of backup data that would be used to restore the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:Snapshot'</a>, <a>snapshot_port</a> - The port that the
--   cluster is listening on.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfNodes:Snapshot'</a>, <a>snapshot_numberOfNodes</a> -
--   The number of nodes in the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:elapsedTimeInSeconds:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_elapsedTimeInSeconds</a> - The amount of time an
--   in-progress snapshot backup has been running, or the amount of time it
--   took a completed backup to finish.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupProgressInMegaBytes:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_backupProgressInMegaBytes</a> - The number of megabytes
--   that have been transferred to the snapshot backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterVersion:Snapshot'</a>, <a>snapshot_clusterVersion</a> -
--   The version ID of the Amazon Redshift engine that is running on the
--   cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcId:Snapshot'</a>, <a>snapshot_vpcId</a> - The VPC
--   identifier of the cluster if the snapshot is from a cluster in a VPC.
--   Otherwise, this field is not in the output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ownerAccount:Snapshot'</a>, <a>snapshot_ownerAccount</a> - For
--   manual snapshots, the Amazon Web Services account used to create or
--   copy the snapshot. For automatic snapshots, the owner of the cluster.
--   The owner can perform all snapshot actions, such as sharing a manual
--   snapshot.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nodeType:Snapshot'</a>, <a>snapshot_nodeType</a> - The node
--   type of the nodes in the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceRegion:Snapshot'</a>, <a>snapshot_sourceRegion</a> - The
--   source region from which the snapshot was copied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotRetentionStartTime:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_snapshotRetentionStartTime</a> - A timestamp representing
--   the start of the retention period for the snapshot.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maintenanceTrackName:Snapshot'</a>,
--   <a>snapshot_maintenanceTrackName</a> - The name of the maintenance
--   track for the snapshot.
newSnapshot :: Snapshot

-- | Describes the status of a RestoreTableFromClusterSnapshot operation.
--

data TableRestoreStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>TableRestoreStatus</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetSchemaName:TableRestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>tableRestoreStatus_targetSchemaName</a> - The name of the schema to
--   restore the table to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotIdentifier:TableRestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>tableRestoreStatus_snapshotIdentifier</a> - The identifier of the
--   snapshot that the table is being restored from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceDatabaseName:TableRestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>tableRestoreStatus_sourceDatabaseName</a> - The name of the source
--   database that contains the table being restored.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:TableRestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>tableRestoreStatus_status</a> - A value that describes the current
--   state of the table restore request.
--   
--   Valid Values: <tt>SUCCEEDED</tt>, <tt>FAILED</tt>, <tt>CANCELED</tt>,
--   <tt>PENDING</tt>, <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceTableName:TableRestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>tableRestoreStatus_sourceTableName</a> - The name of the source
--   table being restored.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestTime:TableRestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>tableRestoreStatus_requestTime</a> - The time that the table
--   restore request was made, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceSchemaName:TableRestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>tableRestoreStatus_sourceSchemaName</a> - The name of the source
--   schema that contains the table being restored.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetDatabaseName:TableRestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>tableRestoreStatus_targetDatabaseName</a> - The name of the
--   database to restore the table to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:TableRestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>tableRestoreStatus_message</a> - A description of the status of the
--   table restore request. Status values include <tt>SUCCEEDED</tt>,
--   <tt>FAILED</tt>, <tt>CANCELED</tt>, <tt>PENDING</tt>,
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterIdentifier:TableRestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>tableRestoreStatus_clusterIdentifier</a> - The identifier of the
--   Amazon Redshift cluster that the table is being restored to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:newTableName':TableRestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>tableRestoreStatus_newTableName</a> - The name of the table to
--   create as a result of the table restore request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:progressInMegaBytes:TableRestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>tableRestoreStatus_progressInMegaBytes</a> - The amount of data
--   restored to the new table so far, in megabytes (MB).
--   
--   <a>$sel:tableRestoreRequestId:TableRestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>tableRestoreStatus_tableRestoreRequestId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the table restore request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalDataInMegaBytes:TableRestoreStatus'</a>,
--   <a>tableRestoreStatus_totalDataInMegaBytes</a> - The total amount of
--   data to restore to the new table, in megabytes (MB).
newTableRestoreStatus :: TableRestoreStatus

-- | A tag consisting of a name/value pair for a resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Tag

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - The key, or name, for the
--   resource tag.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - The value for the resource
--   tag.
newTag :: Tag

-- | A tag and its associated resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTaggedResource</a> smart constructor.
data TaggedResource
TaggedResource' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Tag -> TaggedResource

-- | Create a value of <a>TaggedResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:TaggedResource'</a>,
--   <a>taggedResource_resourceType</a> - The type of resource with which
--   the tag is associated. Valid resource types are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Cluster</li>
--   <li>CIDR/IP</li>
--   <li>EC2 security group</li>
--   <li>Snapshot</li>
--   <li>Cluster security group</li>
--   <li>Subnet group</li>
--   <li>HSM connection</li>
--   <li>HSM certificate</li>
--   <li>Parameter group</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information about Amazon Redshift resource types and
--   constructing ARNs, go to <a>Constructing an Amazon Redshift Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN)</a> in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management
--   Guide.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceName:TaggedResource'</a>,
--   <a>taggedResource_resourceName</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   with which the tag is associated, for example:
--   <tt>arn:aws:redshift:us-east-2:123456789:cluster:t1</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tag:TaggedResource'</a>, <a>taggedResource_tag</a> - The tag
--   for the resource.
newTaggedResource :: TaggedResource

-- | Describes a usage limit object for a cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUsageLimit</a> smart constructor.
data UsageLimit
UsageLimit' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe UsageLimitFeatureType -> Maybe UsageLimitBreachAction -> Maybe UsageLimitLimitType -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe UsageLimitPeriod -> Maybe Text -> UsageLimit

-- | Create a value of <a>UsageLimit</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:amount:UsageLimit'</a>, <a>usageLimit_amount</a> - The limit
--   amount. If time-based, this amount is in minutes. If data-based, this
--   amount is in terabytes (TB).
--   
--   <a>$sel:featureType:UsageLimit'</a>, <a>usageLimit_featureType</a> -
--   The Amazon Redshift feature to which the limit applies.
--   
--   <a>$sel:breachAction:UsageLimit'</a>, <a>usageLimit_breachAction</a> -
--   The action that Amazon Redshift takes when the limit is reached.
--   Possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>log</b> - To log an event in a system table. The default is
--   log.</li>
--   <li><b>emit-metric</b> - To emit CloudWatch metrics.</li>
--   <li><b>disable</b> - To disable the feature until the next usage
--   period begins.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:limitType:UsageLimit'</a>, <a>usageLimit_limitType</a> - The
--   type of limit. Depending on the feature type, this can be based on a
--   time duration or data size.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:UsageLimit'</a>, <a>usageLimit_tags</a> - A list of tag
--   instances.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterIdentifier:UsageLimit'</a>,
--   <a>usageLimit_clusterIdentifier</a> - The identifier of the cluster
--   with a usage limit.
--   
--   <a>$sel:period:UsageLimit'</a>, <a>usageLimit_period</a> - The time
--   period that the amount applies to. A <tt>weekly</tt> period begins on
--   Sunday. The default is <tt>monthly</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:usageLimitId:UsageLimit'</a>, <a>usageLimit_usageLimitId</a> -
--   The identifier of the usage limit.
newUsageLimit :: UsageLimit

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   connecting an Amazon Redshift cluster through the proxy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcId:VpcEndpoint'</a>, <a>vpcEndpoint_vpcId</a> - The VPC
--   identifier that the endpoint is associated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkInterfaces:VpcEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>vpcEndpoint_networkInterfaces</a> - One or more network interfaces
--   of the endpoint. Also known as an interface endpoint.
newVpcEndpoint :: VpcEndpoint
